Beaches & Monkeys of Manuel Antonio: Next, you’ll jump in your hire car or hop aboard the shuttle bus for the journey to Manuel Antonio on the Pacific coast, around 4 hours away. Over the next few days you can kick back at the coast with a visit to the beach-side town of Manuel Antonio. This gem on the Pacific coast is famous for it’s National Park, a great place to spot animals in the jungle. The area also has great sandy beaches, lots of choices for dining out and some of the best family hotels in Costa Rica. You’ll stay in a hotel close to the ocean with an inviting pool and an on-site restaurant. During your stay you’ll learn about Costa Rica’s wildlife while visting Manuel Antonio National Park. You’ll take a guided tour to learn about the flora and fauna, and spot even the smallest and well-camouflaged inhabitants of the rainforest. The rest of your time here is free to spend exploring the National Park or hanging out at the pool or the beach. Next, you’ll take the 3-hour trip to the outskirts on San Jose, either by hire car or by shuttle bus, ready to take your flight home.

tourName: Costa Rica highlights holiday & beach
placesVisited: San Jose, Tortuguero National Park, Arenal Volcano - Monteverde cloud forest, Samara Beach, Nicoya Peninsula, Isla Chora, Sea kayaking, Ecolodge accommodation, Mix of public and private transport
generalInfo:
San Jose - Tortuguero - La Fortuna - Monteverde - Samara Beach - San Jose

Embrace your inner Pura Vida on this whistle- stop roundtrip of Costa Rica, as you explore bio diverse waterways, towering volcanoes and keep your head in the clouds in lush forests and jungles.

Beginning in the bustling townscape of San Jose, shake off the jet lag and get ready for a trip of a lifetime. After some strong coffee and city tour, its time to hit the road for your journey to Tortuguero. Framed by mountains and rivers, this incredible rainforest can only be reached by boat making the journey as much of an adventure as the destination! All your food is included here, allowing you to fully get back to nature and immerse in the sights and sounds straight from a David Attenborough documentary.

From Tortuguero to mighty Arenal Volcano! At over 5000 ft high, this is sure to be one of your holiday highlights. After an exciting hike, take a well earned break in the local hot springs.

Make your way to Monteverde, the perfect place to canopy walk through the iconic Costa Rican cloud forests. Keep your eyes out for prolific wildlife and incredible flora and fauna. Wandering through the mist feels like making your way through the setting of a fairy-tale.

To round up your trip, Samara's sandy beaches are an idyllic place to sit back and relax. This really is a nature lover's paradise, with all the sights and sounds of the jungle on one side of you and the sea on the other. Kayak, snorkel, spot tropical fish and enjoy the atmosphere in this cosy village before returning to San Jose for the end of your Costa Rica visit.

dayInfo.description: We know the way to San José: After a long flight you’ll be pleased to see a representative from our local office waiting to whisk you away to your modern hotel. The next morning you’ll visit the office of our local partner where you’ll be greeted with a Costa Rican coffee. We’ll organise a two hour walk for you around the city with an English speaking guide to discover the secret sights of the city.

Through the Jungle to Tortuguero: From San Jose you’ll be picked up by coach for the journey to Tortuguero. You’ll travel in a coach from the city through some spectacular mountain landscapes before dropping down into the farmlands. After about 3 hours you’ll stop off near Guapiles where you’ll have a breakfast stop. You’ll continue to the Pavona docks where you’ll disembark your coach and switch to a boat for the final 90 minutes of your journey into the rainforest. Keep an eye out for playful monkeys and colourful toucans along the way. The amazing landscape of Tortuguero is not accessible by road. Instead you’ll find rivers meandering through the pristine rainforest to the famous nesting ground of countless turtles. You’ll spend a couple of nights in a jungle lodge, with all of your food and boat trips included. Fill your senses with the sounds of the rainforest, listen to howler monkeys in the distance, smell the tropical hibiscus or spot tiny red frogs in the grass.

Lava Flows of Arenal Volcano: At the end of your stay in the rainforest you’ll return by boat to Pavona docks. You’ll be taken by coach back to your meal stop in Guapiles where you’ll enjoy a delicious lunch. Next, we’ll reserve you a space aboard the shuttle bus from Guapiles near Tortuguero to La Fortuna. If you’re travelling by hire car, you’ll pick up your car in the town of Guapiles. Your driving time today is between 2 to 3 hours. As you head towards La Fortuna, at the foot of Arenal volcano, you’ll notice the landscape becoming more mountainous and the winding road becoming more pot-holed. The mighty volcano and beautiful countryside is one of the most iconic images of Costa Rica. We’ll arrange for you to stay in a comfortable wooden cabin hotel, just outside the popular tourist town. During your stay, you will take a hike through the lush landscape, with the volcano as a beautiful back-drop before being transferred to the hot springs where you can unwind.

Into the Cloud Forests of Monteverde: Next, we’ll arrange for a jeep and boat transfer to take you from your hotel in La Fortuna to your hotel in Monteverde, which should take about 3 hours. If you’re driving you’ll take a bumpy road and perhaps along the way stop off at a cafe. Driving time is usually about 4 hours. Feel the magic of the dense cloud forest of Monteverde. Take a guided canopy walk through the forest where ferns, mosses and orchids bloom amongst the hanging tree branches and beautiful birds dart through the trees. Due to the humid climate the forest gives off a fairy tale-like atmosphere, especially in often-present mist. You’ll stay in a comfortable Swiss-style chalet, set amongst wooded surroundings.

Lazy Days at Samara Beach: Next, you’ll jump in your hire car, or we’ll arrange a seat on the shuttle bus from Monteverde to Samara. Today’s driving time should be around 5 hours. Samara is a cosy village with a long, sandy beach complete with palm trees and a calm sea that slopes gently from the sand. There are no large hotels and the surroundings here are beautiful. You’ll stay in a small scale lodge just a few minutes’ walk from the beach and Samara village. At night you can hear the hundreds of sounds of the jungle and the roar of the sea. During your stay you’ll hop in a kayak to paddle over to Isla Chora with a guide and group, about 20 minutes away from the coast. Here you’ll find an uninhabited white sand beach, the perfect spot for snorkelling and spotting tropical fish darting past your mask. After a buffet of fresh local fruits you’ll kayak back to the mainland. Next, you’ll make the 5 to 6 hour journey from Samara to San Jose where you’ll spend the last night of your trip in the same hotel that you stayed in previously. The next day, we’ll arrange for a transfer to collect you from your hotel and take you to the airport.

tourName: Costa Rica highlights holiday
placesVisited: San Jose, Puerto Viejo, La Fortuna, Arenal Volcano, Monteverde, Manuel Antonio National Park
generalInfo:
San Jose - Puerto Viejo - La Fortuna - Monteverde - Manuel Antonio - San Jose

If you are looking for a 2 week roundtrip that encompasses Costa Rica's top spots across both coastlines in one itinerary, look no further. Ranging from volcanoes to cloud forests, Caribbean influences to pristine beaches, our team of Costa Rica experts are here to put together a tailor made trip based on the bits we know work best, so that you still experience the adventure and authenticity of your destination, but with the hassle taken out of it. We also offer the flexibility of self drive, or transfers, depending on your preference.

From sprawling San Jose to reggae and relaxation in the Caribbean, we recommend kicking back on the sandy beaches with a tropical cocktail or visiting Cahuita national park.

Journeying from your first beach break to volcanic landscapes, today you will make the move to world famous Arenal volcano in La Fortuna, one of the best photo backdrops in the country.

No holiday here is complete without a visit to the cloud forest of Monteverde, where our expert local guides will help you discover the incredible flora and fauna shrouded in ethereal mist that makes Costa Rica such a magical destination.

At your final stop enjoy a serene beach stay complete with breath taking views of the coast and an incredible animal sanctuary visit where you will learn more about the nitty gritty of animal conservation in the eco hub that is Costa Rica.

This holiday also celebrates the fact that Costa Rica has two coastlines, one on the Caribbean and the other on the Pacific, and you get to visit and stay in both, enjoying the Creole culture around Puerto Viejo on the Caribbean and the vast swathes of beach on the Pacific, each seascape topping and tailing this wonderful Costa Rican journey. It also highlights Costa Rica as a top eco-conscious destination, absolutely perfectly suited to the responsible traveller.

You’ll stay in a hill-top villa resort with a pool for refreshing dips and serene views across the ocean. During your stay you’ll visit an animal sanctuary inland who are hard at work rescuing, rehabilitating and releasing a whole host of animals. The area is home to the most visited National Park in the country and is easy to explore on your own with a mix of jungle trails and pretty beaches. Next, you’ll make the 4-hour journey back to San Jose where you’ll spend the night. The next day we’ll arrange for a transfer to collect you from your hotel and take you to the airport. If you’re driving you can drop your car off on the way to the airport and jump in the free transfer to the terminal.

tourName: Costa Rica holiday, coast to coast
placesVisited: San Jose, Southern Caribbean, Tortuguero National Park, Sarapiqui rainforest, Arenal Volcano, Monteverde, Pacific coast beach
generalInfo:
Trips to Costa Rica are invariably going to feature wildlife, activities and an incredible array of landscapes, and this 16 day tailor made Costa Rica trip is absolutely no exception.

Starting on the Caribbean coast you’ll be treated to a range of outdoor activities amongst the rainforests and along the sparkling shoreline with zip-lining through jungle canopies and snorkelling over coral reefs certainly an early highlight of any trip to Costa Rica.

Followed up with boat rides and hot springs in Tortuguero and Arenal Volcano national parks and free time in Sarapiqui rainforest and Montverde cloud forest, this Costa Rica trip really packs a punch with the Pacific coast providing the perfect destination prior to heading to San Jose to prepare for the journey home.

Unlike other Costa Rica trips this is a tailor made tour and gives you the chance to choose your own adventure with a choice of accommodation, transport and additional guided tours and exciting activities adding to the freedom of travelling under your own steam and loving every minute.

dayInfo.description: Arrive / San José. You are met on arrival and transferred to a hotel in the heart of downtown where you stay for the night (switch to a hotel in the greater San Jose area with a swimming pool if you prefer).

Southern Caribbean. a.m transfer east to the south Caribbean coast at Puerto Viejo (4 hrs) where you stay for 2 nights at a lodge set in rainforest just back from the beach. p.m free to relax on a pristine local beach or for optional activities available locally.

Southern Caribbean. Free to relax on a pristine local beach or for optional activities available locally. There are walking trails through the rainforest, you can hire bicycles, go snorkelling on the offshore coral reefs, enjoy a visit to a local indigenous community or take a cacao/chocolate tour.

Tortuguero. Early morning by road then boat to the flooded forest at Tortuguero on the northern Caribbean coast, one of the best locations for wildlife in Costa Rica. p.m visit Tortuguero village and the local beach. N.B between July and October green turtles nest on the beaches here - your lodge can help arrange turtle viewing night tours locally.
Tortuguero. Full day in Tortuguero including an excursion by boat through the narrow channels of the flooded forest for wildlife viewing (shared with others)

Sarapiquí. a.m transfer by boat and road to a local restaurant where you have lunch. If you have chosen to have a hire car you will collect it here. Travel to Puerto Viejo de Sarapiquí in the 'terra firma' lowland rainforest (1 hr) where you stay for 2 nights. Rest of the afternoon free - perhaps enjoy a rainforest night walk here this evening with chances to see nocturnal species such as snakes and frogs.

Sarapiquí. Free day to take advantage of one of the local activities such as visit OTS La Selva biological research station, one of the many reserves/natures gardens here such as Frogs Heaven or Tirimbina, pineapple plantation tours, safari river floats, river rafting
Arenal. a.m travel to Arenal, where you stay for 2 nights. Rest of the day free for local excursions such night walks in the rainforest or visit to a local hotspring complex.

Arenal. Free to relax at your hotel or enjoy the huge range of excursions on offer here including hanging bridges canopy or zipline tours, hiking, kayaking and SUP boarding on Arenal Lake, birdwatching, sloth spotting tours, mountain biking, horse-riding.
Monteverde. a.m travel up to the Monteverde cloud forest, where you stay for the next 2 nights. p.m you could visit one of the many local reserves or enjoy a coffee plantation tour.
Monteverde. You are free for your own choice of activities in the Monteverde area such as nature walks through the Santa Elena and Monteverde cloud forests, canopy walks, zip-lining and horse-riding.

Pacific coast. Travel westwards to your choice of beach destination on the Pacific coast for 3 nights e.g Tamarindo. Days 12-14: free to relax on beach or for optional excursions available locally such as surfing, kayaking, horse-riding
San José. Travel back to San José for a final positioning night.
San José / departure. Transfer to San Jose airport today to catch your onwards international flight.

tourName: Costa Rica holiday, off the beaten track
placesVisited: San Jose, Tortuguero, La Fortuna and Arenal Volcano, Juanilama, Boca Tapada
generalInfo:
San Jose - Tortuguero - La Fortuna - Juanilama - Boca Tapada - San Jose

This Costa Rica roundtrip is all about getting off the beaten track and visiting the hidden gems that this incredible country has to offer.

Starting and finishing in San Jose, your central and modern hotel is a great place to catch your breath before beginning your nature and wildlife adventure.

Either by coach transfer or hire car, take the journey to Tortuguero National Park, famous for its epic biodiversity. Ranging from monkeys to sloths, and toucans to crocs, you're sure to tick some critters off your wildlife spotting bucket list on this trip through the jungle to Torguguero. Once you arrive, take a small boat down the river to your jungle lodge where you will find yourself truly back to nature, immersed in the epic soundscape of the rainforest.

From forests to volcanos, the next stop (and yet another epic photo op) is much famed Arenal Volcano. Enjoy a hike through the unforgettable landscape and kick back and relax in the hot springs nearby.

Just a short drive away, but far off the usual tourist trail, you will find your friendly Costa Rican homestay. Join in with the Juanilama community as your hosts go about their daily life in rural paradise, and learn from their traditional customs and local culture in the Tico village.
This is a fantastic initiative launched by women in the community to inspire independence and entrepreneurial spirit in the locality. A real highlight is learning about the produce and plants in the local area, and a brilliant cooking class Costa-Rican style where you will help make a meal and share it with the community.

Bellies full, its time to get back on the road and head to your next destination: Boca Tapada. A wildlife haven, this is a biodiverse paradise with a range of exciting accommodation from eco-bungalows to treehouses. Enjoy two guided walks lead by expert local guides who have been wildlife spotting in this region for years.

At the end of your trip return to bright and bustling San Jose before your flight home.

At the end of your stay in the rainforest you’ll travel by boat and shuttle bus to La Fortuna.

Arriving in a typical Tico village at the Juanilama community, you will be immersed in local culture and tradition, learning all about everyday rural life. The initiative was launched by a group of women to introduce travellers to villages and communities off the usual tourist trail and give the women a sense of independence and entrepreneurial spirit. She will tell you about the plants and their many uses whilst you collect ingredients for your cooking lesson afterwards at her home. If you’re travelling by hire car you’ll hop in and make your own way there.

Nature Calls!: Today you’ll travel to an area well known for its wildlife and in-particular it’s bird spotting opportunities. Set along the Rio San Carlos, Boca Tapada, the lodges we use in this area are perfect to relax in. Surrounded by nature and with your food included, there’s no need to worry about leaving this little piece of paradise! During your stay, you’ll have your own bungalow with private bathroom and porch, perfect for relaxing after your day’s activities. Whilst staying here you’ll take part in two guided walks – one in the morning and one at night. This will give you the perfect opportunity to spot some of Costa Rica’s infamous wildlife, and the guides here will amaze you with the animals they can spot and their knowledge of them too! If you fancy something even more special there is also a wooden treehouse you can sleep in! Just let your Travel Specialist know and they can check availability for your trip. Next, you’ll travel back towards San Jose – this will take around 3 hours. You’ll stay the night in a comfortable hotel in the Alajuela district before heading to the airport the following day for your international flight home.

tourName: Costa Rica honeymoon, off the beaten track
generalInfo:
Ten days of pure jungle bliss and beach relaxation. Set off on a spectacular off-the-beaten-track Costa Rica honeymoon and let nature do the talking. Go with the flow and swim in the energising waterfalls of Costa Rica’s secret cloud forests. Far from tourists or crowds, discover the lost river in Guanacaste’s unique dwarf forest and bathe in undiscovered hot springs. Finish up on the golden coast, where the dry jungle fringes the lapping Pacific Ocean’s edge.

Beginning in the Central Valley, you’ll be transported north to the lesser-discovered cloud forests of Bajos del Toro, staying in a private reserve. Follow gentle footpaths through the valley towards three thundering falls, and soak in your private hot tub with a glass of bubbly. In the mornings, sample the best local Costa Rican coffee, which is grown and ground nearby. Spend the evenings trying your hand at mixology crafting cocktails with local ingredients, creating a signature taste for your honeymoon.

Head west towards Rio Perdido, the ‘lost river’. This is where adrenaline and adventure kick in, and unlike during other Costa Rica honeymoons, it’s time for adventure travellers to show off their bravery and wicked dare-devil skills. Gear up and hold a steady grip as you climb from the deepest canyon, traverse the rocky landscape on floating walkways, and zipline from one outcrop to another. Swim in a natural thermal river and drift off to the sounds of the forest above. Make sure to watch out for howler monkeys just outside your room.

Finish up with a healthy dose of sun, surf, and sea air on Guanacaste’s golden coast, with sunset views over the Pacific Ocean, and with plentiful opportunities for excursions, you’ll have time to reflect on an epic adventure.

dayInfo.description: Today marks the beginning of your Costa Rica Honeymoon! Congratulations – it’s time to kick back and relax in some sublime settings. Arrive on your international flight into the Central Valley, where you will be met by your English-speaking chauffeur and driven 1 hour north to Bajos del Toro. Once you’ve arrived, check in and relax at your luxury lodge set in a 500-acre private cloud forest reserve and surrounded by rainforests and hidden waterfalls. Expect to be greeted on arrival with a reviving chilled towel and Agua de Sapo, a refreshing local drink with warming ginger. We’ll have your private jacuzzi fired up for you upon arrival. Breathe the pure air, bathe in warm waters, and appreciate the natural bliss of Costa Rica with a glass of champagne.

Today is yours to relax in the cloud forests. At El Silencio, complimentary wellness classes are held daily at 8 am with sound flow yoga and healing. For pure relaxation, join a class before a nourishing breakfast. Whilst you relax in the jacuzzi or bathing in the forests, watch out for the resident hummingbirds. This afternoon we’ve organised a couples spa treatment in the open-air treatment rooms. Lie down on heated beds and listen to the sound of leaves dancing in the light breeze. Drift off to the lulling sound of running water and feel at ease after a long day’s travel yesterday. To get the celebrations started this evening, head over to Toro Bohemio, where your bartender will be waiting to host an evening of crafty cocktails featuring local ingredients, including tamarind, local lemons, and spicy chipotle. Try your hand at mixology and shake, stir and sample your apéritifs before supper.

Following a lively evening and a late breakfast this morning, a local barista will introduce you to the best Costa Rican coffee. The unique climate of the cloud forests enables this pocket-size country to produce the most complex varieties of coffee in the world. During this 1-hour introduction, you will learn about the history of coffee in Costa Rica and the nuances of growing it in the valleys, and you will naturally get to sample a warming cup tailored to your taste - a slow-paced and relaxing start to the day. This afternoon, set off on an encounter with the wilderness surrounding you. Following winding pathways through the fascinating cloud forests, you’ll trace a pristine creek to discover three energising waterfalls. The first two falls are 30 meters high, and the final fall is called La Promesa, one of the highest in the area reaching a soaring 60 meters. Swim in refreshingly cold crystal-clear waters and enjoy a picnic on the banks of the river, surrounded by the sounds and scents of the cloud forest. This evening, set out for a walk in the wilderness and follow the creatures’ calls as sundown approaches. The evening hike offers a unique way to experience your natural surroundings in Costa Rica; attune to the night’s unique rhythm and keep your eyes peeled for nocturnal tree frogs, butterflies, reptiles, and other fascinating specimens.

Following breakfast today, your chauffeur will pick you up from your hotel and escort you to Rio Perdido in Bagaces. The drive will take 4 hours, traversing the Central Valley and heading westward into the province of Guanacaste. On a clear day, you’ll be joined by views of Volcan Arenal on the horizon. Upon arrival, you’ll notice that the surrounding area is completely untouched by tourism - perfect for privacy and as a honeymoon destination. The Nahua indigenous group once inhabited Bagaces, and the area is named after ‘Bagatzi’, the first tribe leader. Just north lies Volcan Miravalles, the highest volcano in Guanacaste, and a protected area home to a diverse landscape, ranging from humid rainforests to dry pre-montane tropical forests. Your lodge is framed by this unique landscape and is surrounded by dwarf forests, along with a neighbouring thermal gorge. This is where you can spend your days swimming in abundant natural hot springs in the heart of the 600-acre private canyon reserve. Upon arrival, check in and relax. Meet with your hosts, who will introduce you to the thermal pools surrounding the lodge’s main building and tailor a calming therapeutic experience for you. Bathe in natural mineral waters from the Earth’s surface and relax into the afternoon.

Today you’ll be visiting Costa Rica’s secret place for exploration – once again, adventure travellers will be delighted! Where hot and cold converge, you’ll be taken to the meeting place of Rio Perdido and the Yurro Waterfall, which is where warm waters mingle with the cool currents of the White Canyon. Begin deep within a narrow canyon and ascend well above Costa Rica’s only dwarf forest. On the horizon, you’ll be greeted by a spectacular view of the Miravelles Volcano’s rocky lowlands. Climb several via ferratas, cross a wobbly challenge bridge and swing on a Tarzan swing with panoramic vistas of the canyon and its diverse surroundings. Speed back down to earth on an exhilarating zipline ride. This afternoon, relax at your jungle lodge. We have organised a special dinner for you this evening under the starry sky on Rio Perdido’s floating platform, which levitates gently 50 meters above the river convergence. Try signature cocktails made with locally grown fruits and gorge on typical organic Costa Rican dishes. A strong favourite is the guaro sour. Exotic flavours will complement the stunning views that unfold around you.

Set off on the road again to the North Pacific Coast. Your drive will take 2.5 hours, so use the journey as an opportunity to watch the landscape change from the dry rainforest of Guanacaste to coastal views. You’ll arrive at your secluded resort in the early afternoon, perched on the hilltop overlooking Las Catalinas. Take in the panoramic views of the Pacific, stretching in every direction. Check into your villa and plunge straight into your private swimming pool. It’s time to sink into the sea breeze and kick back into a hidden seaside paradise.

The next few days are for you to fully decompress and enjoy Costa Rica’s slow-paced beach vibe. Surf, paddle, swim, and dive right from the oceanfront of Las Catalinas. Appreciate the nightly sunset shows right from your villa and set out to explore the ocean in-depth by day. Surf on epic breaks, set off on horseback to explore the local beaches and towns and stretch your body with a vinyasa flow.

After a spectacular honeymoon with a healthy dose of Vitamin D and plenty of rejuvenation time, today marks the end of your adventure. Your chauffeur will escort you on a 1-hour drive back to the airport for your flight from Liberia.

tourName: Costa Rica honeymoons
placesVisited: Central Valley mountains, waterfalls, hummingbirds and artisanal coffee, Arenal volcano with choice of activities, Nicoya Peninsula beach and relaxation
generalInfo:
With its wildlife, pristine beaches and gorgeous scenery, Costa Rica has all the ingredients for a wonderful honeymoon. Beautiful sunsets, private jacuzzi and wild, romantic beaches are the backdrop to your perfect escape. The country’s extraordinary biodiversity means you can visit several different habitats, from beaches and rainforest, to volcanic landscapes. Costa Rica also boasts some really special accommodation, whether you are looking for luxury, a small boutique experience or some budget options. Costa Rica is also perfect for adventurous honeymooners who want to do more than lie on a beach.

This proposed 12-day honeymoon itinerary includes hand-picked accommodation, chosen with seclusion, relaxation and romance in mind. You start with a stay at an off the beaten track mountain lodge where coffee, community and rural life take centre stage, from where you visit waterfall gardens teeming with hummingbirds and a local family run coffee plantation. From here, you travel to the Arenal Volcano, an excellent location for wildlife viewing, wellness and adventure activities with a range of boutique hotels, many of which have onsite hot springs. Before moving on to the Pacific coast for four days of rest and relaxation at a beachfront hotel on the Nicoya Peninsula, characterised by rainforest backed surf beaches

dayInfo.description: Chayote Country. You are met on arrival in San Jose and transferred to Chayote Country (approx 1hr), an off the beaten track region where coffee, agriculture and rural life take centre stage. Stay for 2 nights at Chayote Lodge, set on a hillside at approx 1,700m above the small mountain village of Llano Bonito.

Waterfall and hummingbirds. Today enjoy a full day tour to the picturesque cloudforest village of Bajos del Toro to visit the Toro Amarillo Waterfall, one of the most beautiful in Costa Rica set in an extinct volcano crater with gardens teeming with hummingbirds. Here you walk through rainforest trails and down steep steps to the pool at the base of the falls. Includes lunch at a 'soda' (local diner) in the village.

Coffee plantation visit, to Arenal Volcano. This morning you will be taken to visit a local family run coffee plantation and farm who produce artisanal coffee and export beans to Europe. Here you will explore the grounds with one of the family members and learn about the processes involved in turning bean to cup, as well as sample their coffee prepared in a traditional way using a wooden 'chorreador'. After the tour you will be transferred up to the Arenal volcano region (approx 2hrs) where you stay for 4 nights at an upmarket hotel with volcano views and onsite hotspring pools.

Free in Arenal, p.m dusk rainforest frog watching night walk. First part of the day free to relax and enjoy your hotel grounds and facilities. At dusk you will be taken on a rainforest night walk at the only natural frog sanctuary in Arenal, where up to 28 different species of frog have made the ponds their home. There are also chances to other nocturnal species such as snakes, bats and pocupines.

Canopy Adventures. Today enjoy a ‘sky-tram, walk and zip-line excursion’ at the Sky Adventures park. Start with the ‘sky-tram’, a 15 minute ride in gondolas that soar up over the forest to the highest point in the Arenal reserve, with wonderful views over Arenal lake and the surrounding region. On arrival at the top set off on the sky-trek zip-line tour, whizzing along 8 cross-sectional cables strung between platforms, measuring between 100ft to 2,460 ft long with a maximum height of 660ft. On a clear day there are superb views of the volcano, lake and surrounding forest. End with a sky walk accompanied by a naturalist guide along a series of trails and canopy walkways allowing you the chance to see the forest from a different perspective and spot wildlife such as monkeys, sloth and birds.

Free day in Arenal. A free day to relax and enjoy your hotel's facilities or for optional excursions available locally at additional cost e.g kayaking/SUP boarding on Lake Arenal, walks along trails at the Silencio reserve or National Park, visit to La Fortuna waterfall, chocolate/coffee tours, daytrip to Cano Negro wildlife refuge, sloth spotting tours, horseback riding, cooking classes. We can pre-book any of these or others that you would like to do.

Pacific coast at Santa Teresa/Mal Pais. This morning take a direct flight from Arenal to Cobano, the gateway to Costa Rica's southern Nicoya beaches from where you are transferred to Santa Teresa/Mal Pais. Here two laid-back, low-key, hip, neighboring beaches popular with surfers, beach-lovers, backpackers and upscale glitterati alike. Here you will find gorgeous stretches of rainforest-backed sandy beach with world-class surf breaks, stunning sunsets and a plethora of activities on offer Stay for the next 5 nights at an upmarket hotel set right on the beachfront.

Free to relax at your hotel or on the beach or for optional excursions available locally at additional cost e.g horse-riding along the beach, surfing or surf lessons, yoga, visit to Tortuga island or Montezuma waterfall, the Curu Refuge or Cabo Blanco reserve for nature-viewing/walking (both approx 1h drive from Santa Teresa)

Fly to San Jose / depart Costa Rica. This morning fly back to San Jose airport for afternoon/evening international flights home. Or travel on to another destination in Costa Rica e.g Tortuguero or the Osa Peninsula

tourName: Costa Rica luxury family Holiday
generalInfo:
Set within a diverse landscape of enormous volcanoes, mystical forests, and exclusive areas that don’t feel real are exhilarating activities like hanging bridges, ziplines, raging rapids and peaceful boat rides across volcanic lakes and the Pacific Ocean.

These are what make a Costa Rica family holiday one that’ll stay with you for a lifetime, and after two weeks exploring its tropical terrain, which resembles an active and constantly evolving playground, you’ll be begging for another family holiday in Costa Rica in no time.This two-week Costa Rica holiday is a jam-packed journey for families who want maximum adventure with minimum hassle. Traverse the highlands of the Central Valley areas and wander through the treetops hugging the base of Arenal Volcano, delve deep into the mysterious cloud forests of Monteverde and resurface on a peaceful stretch of sand in Guanacaste. These are some of Costa Rica’s most talked about sites.

The country’s dramatic changing landscapes characterise this Costa Rica family holiday. Beginning north of San Jose, you’ll be transported into smouldering volcanic crevices and the fertile lands surrounding you. Light treks, waterfall plunges, and visits to wildlife sanctuaries are just the beginning of your adventure.

With a foot on the acceleration pedal, venture to Arenal for extreme sports on land and water. Raft down the Balsa River’s raging rapids, and swing from the hanging bridges above. A speedboat cruise across Arenal Lake will transport you to Monteverde’s misty cloud forests, where you’ll take to the trees once more on an epic ziplining adventure. The perfect end to your Costa Rica holiday is to relax on the beach in Papagayo in Guanacaste. It’s where relaxation joins hands with marine adventures in the Pacific Ocean.

dayInfo.description: Bienvenidos a Costa Rica – Arrive at Juan Santamaria International Airport in San Jose, the capital of Costa Rica. Here you will be welcomed by a Travel Representative and transferred to your accommodation, Xandari Resort & Spa, 45 minutes from the airport in the Central Valley.

Begin your first day visiting the Doka Coffee Estate. Tour the plantation and learn about the ancient techniques used by experts to produce some of the best Costa Rica coffee that’ll later be shipped around the world. After the tour, continue to Poas Volcano National Park. Poas is one of Costa Rica’s most active volcanoes, and this is a vivid presence in the national park. Steaming fumaroles emit heat and drama into the landscape. A showy volcano with recent eruptions makes for an exciting adventure for the family. Take the breathtaking views of the main crater at the volcano and hike the Laguna Botos Trail to the azure blue lagoon. A stark contrast to the desolate landscapes of volcanic activity, the lagoon is disguised in blankets of tropical green. The trail and the lagoon take their name from the Botos Indigenous Tribe, who used to live in this area. Here, your knowledgeable local guide will talk you through flora, fauna, and history and lead you to La Paz Waterfall Gardens.

After breakfast, your private transfer will drive you to Arenal. The drive will take 3 hours, but the views make the journey worth it. Whether you approach from the west or the east, the vistas are spectacular. On the road from Xandari, you’ll have Volcan Platanar as your dramatic backdrop, and hopefully if the weather allows, the peak of Arenal Volcano will be there to greet you upon arrival. Arenal is a bucket list destination and is considered one of the best things to do in Costa Rica. It has hosted some transformative moments in recent seismic history. For years Volcan Arenal was a dormant volcano, but since its extraordinary eruption in 1968, and its subsiding in 2010, the volcano has gained a reputation for being an impressive natural marvel. It produces massive explosions, ash columns, and streams of molten rock daily, leaving visitors in awe. After your long journey, you will check into your luxury hotel, Hotel Arenal Kioro Suites with spectacular views of the volcano on the horizon. Look out for the evening light shows tonight!

Before hitting the rapids today we’ve organised a taste tour to get the day off to a stimulating start! Sample some native Cacao beans in various forms and flavours – Jamaica flower, natural cinnamon, nutmeg, and chilli powder. Take to Class III rapids on the Balsa River and prepare to get wet and wild as you navigate rapids such as the ‘Magnetic Rock’ and ‘Dredges’. During the journey, stop for a swim in refreshing waters. Enjoy tropical fruits and cold drinks, and at the end of the rafting tour, you will have earned the hearty, traditional Costa Rican lunch of gallo pinto.

Following breakfast, you’ll be picked up from Hotel Arenal Kioro Suites in La Fortuna and set off to explore your surroundings, although this time, you’ll be viewing them from the heights of treetops. Climb towards the canopies, walk along the trails and watch as the fascinating world of the tropical forest opens up to you. Along 3km of trails, become immersed in the diverse fauna and flora of the rainforest, admiring colourful birds and tropical plant species that will be pointed out and explained by your naturalist guide. Over 50 species of birds have been counted in this area alone. The duration of the tour is 2.5 hours, and after this, you’ll spend the afternoon at leisure; enjoy the swimming pool and vistas surrounding your volcano-facing hotel.

Today you'll set off in another adventure to Monteverde and is 136km from Arenal, and the best way to get from A to B is by boarding a speedboat across Arenal Lake. This is a quick and scenic travel option and serves as a great day out in itself. You’ll have the boat to yourselves, so enjoy the calm crossing, which takes under 3 hours. For the last leg of your journey, on the other side of the lake, your driver will meet you and take you on a 1.5-hour drive to your hotel, Sende Monteverde. Upon arrival, check into your hotel and relax. At Senda Monteverde, your Costa Rica family holiday will turn into a quiet moment where you’ll feel at one with nature. The hotel has direct access to the neighbouring Aguti Wildlife Reserve. Alternatively, stroll out of your eco-hotel into Monteverde Town, just 15 minutes away.

Your next day in Monteverde, explore this area from the treetops! Your local guide will take you to Selvatura Park. This local conservation project also offers various routes across the treetop canopies. Enjoy going along ziplines through the cloud forests, wander along treetop walkways following a 3km trail with eight different bridges, or join your naturalist guide for a natural history hike. After your exhilarating adventure, relax with the sound of fluttering wings in the butterfly garden and the gentle purr of hummingbirds as they glide past.

Say goodbye to the forests today and travel to Costa Rica’s North Pacific coastline. Your private transfer will take you from Monteverde to Papagayo. In 2.5 hours, you’ll be overlooking a serene bay referred to as the “Riviera of Costa Rica”. Less than an hour from Liberia Airport, Papagayo feels a million miles away from real life. Check into El Mangroove, a beachfront luxury resort designed by one of Costa Rica’s most prominent architects, Ronald Zurcher. Choose from two restaurants for dinner with menus curated by a Michelin-starred chef. This is the time to turn your exhilarating Costa Rica family holiday into traditional “holiday mode”, the kind that is commonly used in reference to blissful and hassle-free beach holidays. You won’t need to lift a finger if you don’t want to!

Following a delicious breakfast, head out on your private boat with a naturalist guide to see the marine sights surrounding you. Dolphins and Humpback whales are frequent visitors to the gulf; one of the best family activities here is to track these majestic creatures as they dance mid-air before gliding playfully into the water below. Try your hand at deep water fishing, enjoy a delicious locally prepared lunch on board, and watch the sun go down from a stand-up paddleboard.

The next few days are yours for beach bliss and to relax after an adventurous trip. Alternatively, make the most of the hotel’s impressive array of water sports, such as water skiing, wakeboarding, and tubing.

Today marks the end of your memorable family holiday in Costa Rica. Bid farewell to your spectacular natural surroundings and hop in your car back to Liberia Airport for your international flight home.

tourName: Costa Rica multi activity adventure
generalInfo: This travel package gives you the opportunity to visit and learn at a sustainable farm project. You will also stay at the Boruca indigenous community with additional craft and cultural workshops, visiting the local museum and with delicious traditional food cooked on the wood fire. Then we continue our tour to the Southern Pacific beach where we take you to the stunning Nauyaca waterfalls on a guided horseback riding tour. You are also signed up for a surf lesson before we visit the local sea turtle conservation project and accompany the team on a night patrol to eventually spot an endangered sea turtle laying her eggs, or depending on the season liberate hatchlings into the ocean, an experience you will never forget. The next stop on our tour is the Manuel Antonio National Park famous for its beautiful beaches and worth a visit. Prepare yourself for a guided hike to spot monkeys, sloths, iguanas and many tropical plants. Afterwards we drive you to our 2-Day Volunteer Program at a Wildlife Rescue Center, a hands on experience caring and learning about many rescued animals. Our next stop is the cloudforest in Monteverde, where we take you on the amazing Zipline tour. We won't miss out to visit Arenal Volcano and enjoy an afternoon at the hot springs. To finalize this active yet diverse tour around the country we take you on a rafting tour to one of the best rivers worldwide, the Pacuare river.  Our closure Dinner will be held in San Jose. Drop off at the airport is also included as well as all transfer costs and private transfer where stated. Overnight accommodation as described in double room (hotel with CST certification where possible), rural homestay, meals as described. Bilingual guide on site, 24h emergency contact.

dayInfo.description: Airport pickup and first night in San Jose, dinner included
Transfer to Ecological Farm in San Isidro, introduction on sustainability
Learning Experience on the farm, ecological path, reforestation
Transfer to Indigenous community, introduction and cultural workshop
Visit of the local cultural museum, hike to waterfall; afternoon transfer to beach location
2h surf lesson with certified surf instructor and board; visit of the sea turtle conservation program in the afternoon and night patrol.
Horseback riding tour to Nauyaca waterfalls
Manuel Antonio National Park and transfer to Rescue Center, introduction
Volunteering includes e.g preparation of meals, feeding of animals, cleaning, painting, light construction work
Transfer to Monteverde Cloudforest accommodation
Zip line tour, superman flight and swing included; afternoon transfer to La Fortuna, bus-boat-bus
Visit Arenal Volcano and hot springs
Pacuare River Rafting tour, transfer to San Jose in the afternoon, closure dinner
Airport drop off

tourName: Costa Rica & Nicaragua holiday, tailor made
generalInfo:
We have combined two of our favourite destinations to create an adventure that takes you from eco lodge to lodge overland.

As we raft and swim the thrill and beauty of Pacuare River will instantly immerse you into the traffic free natural splendour of Costa Rica before ascending to spent time in the shadow of Volcanoes Arenal and Tenoria. A natural spectacle awaits on and across the border in Nicaragua in the unspoilt Indio Mais biosphere and on and around the twin volcanoes of Ometepe.

There are few colonial cities as stunning as our last port of call, Granada.

dayInfo.description: Welcome to Costa Rica: Welcome to Costa Rica! Upon arrival at San Jose International Airport you’ll meet our representative, who welcomes you and takes you to your hotel.

Begin your Rafting experience on Pacuare River (B,L): After breakfast adventure awaits, paddling the class IV rapids of the Pacuare River. During your expedition lunch will be served by your guide. Pacuare Rafting – Class IV Here you enjoy the feeling of total isolation from urban life and the realness of being connected with nature. You see waterfalls cascade into the river from both sides as colorful, tropical birds fly right over your head. Amazing views of this virgin tropical rainforest area, appear before your eyes as you descend this true exploratory land. Wildlife is abundant, with sloth, toucans, parrots, coatis, morpho butterflies and colorful frogs being common sights. The 18 mile one day run includes a total of 52 rapids. Few rivers in the world can offer you so many. The first 4 miles consist of fun class II-III rapids which is a perfect time to test your new river skills and gain confidence in your team. Here you can find pockets of secondary growth forest that is extremely beautiful. After about 40 minutes we will enter the famous Pacuare River Gorge, which is 5 miles of some of the best white water rafting Costa Rica has to offer. You will also see the Huacas waterfall, a 150-foot dramatic drop into the river. After the gorge the rivers opens up to a 5-mile stretch on the Valle del Pacuare, where the river has a different character. It is wide open, which gives you the opportunity to rest a bit and take the opportunity to do some wildlife spotting. The forest remains just as lush, and the rapids just as fun. We finish in Siquirres, at our own private Exploration Center where you can take a shower, change and enjoy the gardens and terrace while having a beer or two and reflecting with your new friends about the great adventure you just shared.
Transfer to La Fortuna (B): After breakfast at 09:00 you will be transferred to your next destination: La Fortuna!

Hanging Bridges (B): After breakfast you are picked up for a panoramic walk through the jungle, crossing many hanging bridges. The Arenal Hanging Bridges are a fun and educative option to learn more about the primary forest and the local environment. During a walk along the bridges and trails you'll be able to enjoy a unique and impressively close contact with nature. The trail makes a loop with a total length of 3100 meters within the mountainous area. Along these three kilometers of trails you will be immersed in the divers fauna and flora of the rainforest and admire exotic animals, colorful birds and tropical plant species. While you’re walking along the trails, the fascinating world of the tropical forest will open to you.
Transfer to Rio Celeste (B): After breakfast you are transferred to your next destination, at Rio Celeste, close to National Park Volcan Tenorio. Enjoy nature at the lodge, or take an optional tour.
Transfer to Cano Negro (B): After breakfast you transfer takes you to Cano Negro, a well-known wetlands nature reserve for birdwatching.

Cano Negro Boat Tour (B): After breakfast a local guide take you out for a boat tour on Cano Negro, to observe wildlife and the many resident and migratory birds of the reserve. Afternoon at leisure. The Wildlife Refuge Cano Negro is considered one of the richest places on the continent for bird watching. Apart from an abundance of birds, it is homes to many other animals such as sloths, three types of monkeys, alligators, lizards, bats, and a variety of flora typical of wetlands. Enjoy this floating safari through tropical rainforest and pastures until we arrive at the marsh. To name just a few bird species we have Anhinga or Snakebirds, Roseate Spoonbill, Wood Storks, the Olivaceous Cormorant, and the Jabiru, the largest bird in Central America and very endangered. Along the river we can see howler monkeys, spider monkeys, white-faced monkeys, also the tree-toed sloth and some reptiles like caimans, Jesus Christ lizard and turtles.

Transfer to Nicaraguan border and boat to El Castillo (B): Breakfast and transfer to the border where a representative will be waiting for you on the Nicaraguan side. Then you continue to San Carlos where take a public boat to El Castillo.

Hiking Indio Maiz (B): After breakfast you take a boat for a scenic journey over the San Juan River, visiting Indio Maiz Biosphere Reserve. This tropical rain forest is home to the conspicuous Green Parrot (Ara Ambigua), often feeding on the prevalent almond tree. The reserve is also home of the elusive jaguar, toucans, howler monkeys, and different varieties of colourful hummingbirds. Return to El Castillo and enjoy the afternoon at leisure. From El Castillo you ride down San Juan river for about 45 minutes until you reach the Indio Maiz Reserve. The Indio Maiz Reserve is home to numerous animal species, among which are deer, wild boars, pumas, sloths, jaguars, manatees, howler monkeys, white-faced monkeys, spider monkeys, poison dart frogs, snakes, crocodiles, turtles, and iguanas. You have a 2-hour hike in the rain forest, after which you jump back in the boat to witness wildlife. After hike we take the boat and going to explore Bartola river, where you have chance for swimming in the middle of the forest.

Cross Lake Nicaragua - Ometepe Island (B): Early breakfast and departure back to San Carlos in a public boat, from here you take a private boat towards Puerto Colón, bordering the Southside of Lake Nicaragua. Upon arrival, you are transferred by land to San Jorge to embark the public ferry to Ometepe Island. Then continue to your lodge to rest after a long day of travel.

Ometepe Nature Experience (B): Your local guide meets you at your hotel for a tour across Ometepe Island, exploring this remarkable destination's abundant nature and wildlife. Discover the natural beauty of Ometepe as you explore the island with a local guide. Your experience starts at the Peña Inculta nature reserve where you see lava rocks overgrown by primary forest, home to white-faced monkeys, howler monkeys, squirrels, iguanas, bats and many birds. After hiking through the reserve for approximately 45 minutes, you'll visit Hacienda Finca Magdalena, a community-run farm founded in 1888, where you get insight into the process of organic coffee cultivation. A short hike brings you to a site with remnants of pre-Columbian times, before your tour finishes at Ojo de Agua, a pristine natural spring surrounded by dense forest.

Transfer to Granada - Lava Night Experience (B): After breakfast you continue to your next destination, the colonial town of Granada, where you have the afternoon at leisure to stroll around and relax. Late afternoon you head to the first national park of Nicaragua, Masaya Volcano, for a spectacular nocturnal visit, observing a glowing lava lake. Masaya Volcano National Park is one of the most famous volcanoes in the pacific region of Nicaragua due to its constant activity, and was known to the Spanish at the "Mouth of Hell". It offers the unique experience of seeing an active volcano up close, and watching as molten lava glows in crater just meters away from you. It's an awe-inspiring experience allowing visitors to experience a phenomenon once sacred to the pre-Columbian Nicaraguans, who were inspired by the raw power and beauty of nature.

Mombacho Volcano Nature Reserve (B): After breakfast, you visit the dormant Mombacho Volcano, which is covered by tropical dry forest, coffee plantations, and cloud forest. Arriving at the crater, your local guide takes you on a short hike where you discover local wildlife and enjoy, on a clear day, the many spectacular vistas. Afternoon at leisure. Journey into the lush cloud forest around the majestic Mombacho Volcano, spotting wildlife and taking in the incredible panoramic views from the top. After travelling to the Mombacho Nature Reserve, you'll begin to climb the volcano by 4x4 truck, stopping for a delicious local coffee at one of the plantations along the way. Once near the top you'll enjoy a short, guided hike along the trail, passing through a variety of landscapes - keep an eye out for the howler monkeys and white-faced monkeys, sloths, dart frogs, and the endemic Mombacho salamander along the way. Once at the peak, you can enjoy views over Granada, the Las Isletas archipelago and Masaya Volcano.

End of Tour (B): Your Costa Rica- and Nicaragua nature experience has come to an end. You are transferred to Managua International Airport for your flight back home. We hope you enjoyed your time in Central America!

tourName: Costa Rica on a shoestring, self drive holiday
generalInfo:
This self-drive adventure links Costa Rica’s most iconic landscapes into a single flowing journey. After a brief pause in San José, the trip begins in Tortuguero, where the only roads are canals and the rainforest comes alive at dawn with the calls of monkeys and the flash of toucans.

Guided boat safaris here make the wildlife experience effortless, while evenings at a riverside lodge immerse you in the rhythm of the Caribbean lowlands. From there, you collect your car in Guápiles and drive to the Arenal region, where the dramatic cone of the volcano rises above a landscape of hot springs, farmland and rainforest.

Days here include a guided hike across old lava fields, a relaxed sloth-spotting circuit, and time to explore La Fortuna or soak in thermal pools at your own pace.

The journey then climbs into the mist-shrouded cloud forest of Monteverde, where cool air, moss-draped trees and the chance of spotting the resplendent quetzal provide a striking contrast to the lowlands.

Finally, you descend to the Pacific coast for a coastal stay in Manuel Antonio, where palm-lined beaches meet lush rainforest filled with sloths, squirrel monkeys and birdlife. A guided walk in the national park is paired with ample free time for beach relaxation or optional adventures such as kayaking and waterfall hikes.

With car hire, accommodation and key activities included, the itinerary keeps travel straightforward while delivering exceptional variety: rainforest canals, volcanic landscapes, highland forests and tropical shores, all threaded together with just the right balance of freedom and expert guidance.

dayInfo.description: Arrive San José. Met on arrival and transferred to Hotel ; rest of day at leisure. (Overnight San José)
San José to Tortuguero (group transfer). Breakfast stop en route by Braulio Carrillo; boat through the canals to lodge; forest walk after lunch; dinner at the lodge. (B,L,D)
Tortuguero: Dawn canal tour; breakfast; second canal tour; visit the small museum, beach and village; dinner at the lodge. (B,L,D)
Tortuguero to Guápiles (shared transfer). Collect SUV (unlimited mileage; LDW & liability cover) and self-drive to Arenal; afternoon at leisure. Overnight (B)

Arenal: Guided hike on trails across old lava flows with volcano viewpoints (AM). Easygoing sloth-spotting tour by vehicle (PM); chances to see toucans, monkeys, iguanas and poison-dart frogs; local snacks included. (B)
Arenal: Day at leisure for hot springs, La Fortuna and optional activities. (B)
Arenal to Monteverde: Self-drive to the Tilarán range (approx. 3.3 hrs / 119 km). Evening at leisure. Overnight Hotel (B)
Monteverde Cloud Forest Reserve: Guided walk on signed trails with opportunities for hummingbirds and, with luck, resplendent quetzal. (B)
Monteverde to Manuel Antonio: Self-drive to the Pacific (approx. 3.3 hrs). Arrive and check in (B)
Manuel Antonio: Day at leisure—beaches, short waterfall walks, kayaking or time by the pool. (B)
Manuel Antonio National Park: Guided naturalist walk; look for sloths, several monkey species and birdlife; free time for the park’s pristine beaches afterwards. (B)
Manuel Antonio: Second day at leisure for optional activities or relaxation. (B)
Manuel Antonio to San José: Drive back to San José airport (approx. 2.5 hrs) for return flight. (B) Optional night in San Jose region, depending on departure flights.

tourName: Costa Rica & Panama tour
placesVisited: San Jose, Puerto Viejo de Talamancaon the Caribbean coast, Cahulta National Park, boat ride to Isla Colon in the Bocas del Toro archipelago, Boquete, highlands of Panama, Santa Catalina, Panama City, lots of optional activities, including bike tours, waterfall hikes, visiting a coffee plantation or a jaguar rescue centre
generalInfo:
Adventure-lovers rejoice! This trip through Costa Rica and Panama delivers pure beach bliss, idyllic islands, curious creatures and small towns packed with charm. First travel to Costa Rica to uncover cultural gems in San Jose and Puerto Viejo de Talamanca, then journey on to Panama for an intoxicating mixture of relaxation and adventure. Costa Rica and Panama are the very essence of Central American beauty and this tour catches them at their best.

Who hasn’t dreamt of snorkelling, sun-bathing and cocktail-sipping in the Caribbean? Enjoy plenty of time to do just this in Puerto Viejo de Talamanca, as well as seeing sloths, racoons and monkeys in nearby Cahulta National Park. Dial the relaxation up a notch in Bocas del Toro, across the border in Panama, spending several nights on nearby Isla Bastimentos. There may be no roads or cars here, but there are plenty of mangroves, turtles and white sandy beaches.

Waterfalls, wildflowers, hot springs and mountains – Panama’s beautiful Boquete has it all. Tour a coffee plantation, ride a bike along a river or take a relaxing walk through the forest, keeping an eye out for tricksy monkeys and tropical birds. Surfer dudes won’t be disappointed either on this trip. Get off the beaten track and ride the waves in surfy Santa Catalina on the south coast of Panama. If you’d prefer to stay dry, there’s a beachside hammock with your name on it here, too. End your trip by exploring the eclectic streets of Panama City, taking time to admire the engineering masterpiece of the Panama Canal.

This is a 13-day trip, staying in hotels and travelling by local bus, private minibus and boat.

dayInfo.title: San Jose .
dayInfo.description: Bienvenidos! Welcome to Costa Rica. Your adventure begins in San Jose with a welcome meeting at 6 pm tonight at your hotel. As this trip spends very little time here, it’s recommended that you arrive a day or two early and see the sights. If you do, maybe visit The Gold Museum and it's amazing collection of Indigenous gold art. Or if you're in the mood for a bit of shopping, head to the Mercado Municipal de Artesanias or the city's Central Market, where you can buy anything from handicrafts to seafood.

dayInfo.title: Sarapiqui.
dayInfo.description: This morning, hop on a public bus and make your way to Sarapiqui – a town known for its rich biodiversity and lush rainforest. When you arrive, enjoy some free time here to go birdwatching, spot some local wildlife or hike to one of the nearby waterfalls. Then, meet up with a local guide to head out on a jungle walk. Look out for elusive creatures like sloths, bats, snakes, frogs and a whole lot more.

dayInfo.title: Puerto Viejo de Talamanca.
dayInfo.description: Today, take a private transfer to Puerto Viejo. When you arrive, get to know this laid-back jungle town during an orientation walk with your local leader, then enjoy some time to explore at your leisure. A small and coastal city, Puerto Viejo de Talamanca has a lively main street featuring dance halls, reggaeton bars and modern restaurants. If you’re looking for a little bit of relaxation, you'll also find great surf beaches and rainforest fruit farms to kick back on. To top today off, you'll prepare a traditional Caribbean dinner with a local family in their home. Enjoy a mixture of fruits, seafood, tubers and vegetables combined with coconut flavours, ginger, allspice, cinnamon, curry, Panamanian pepper and thyme.

dayInfo.title: Puerto Viejo de Talamanca.
dayInfo.description: Today is free, so you can ease into the vibes of the Caribbean coast. You might like to take your time exploring Cahuita National Park, which is about a 20 minute ride away from Puerto Viejo - your leader can help you arrange a transfer. Cahuita National Park is home to sloths, monkeys, raccoons, snakes and a great variety of birds. If the waves are calling (but your footing isn't so sure), surf lessons are also on offer in town. Of course, you could also simply find a cool spot and relax with a beer in hand.

dayInfo.title: Bocas del Toro.
dayInfo.description: Today, take a private minibus to the border, then walk across an old railway bridge into Panama. Continue by taxi or collective minivan to Almirante, where you'll take a short boat ride to Isla Colon in the Bocas del Toro archipelago – rapidly becoming a Caribbean favourite, this place has it all. Hit the palm-shaded beaches with crystal-clear waters, enjoy some spectacular snorkelling opportunities and look out for lots of wildlife. Culturally, Bocas is home to West Indians, Latinos and expats, resulting in diverse music, nightlife and food scenes. For the next three nights, you'll stay in Isla Colon – the main town of Bocas del Toro. It's a great spot to start your exploration of the archipelago, with most bars, restaurants and local activity operators just metres from your hotel.

dayInfo.title: Bocas del Toro.
dayInfo.description: Today is the first of two free days to explore this tropical archipelago. Several beaches are within reach of town, between 8 and 14 km from your hotel. With azure waters, pristine coral reefs and a rollicking nightlife, it’s easy to see why these islands are a favourite for so many travellers. The safest beaches are Starfish, Sandfly and Big Creek – be aware that others may have strong riptides. When the sun goes down, why not head into town and check out the local bar and restaurant scene? Ask your leader about the best place to grab a drink.

dayInfo.title: Bocas del Toro.
dayInfo.description: This morning, hop on a boat to the nearby Isla Popa, where you’ll get to spend time meeting the Ngabe-Bugle indigenous community. The local women here run a community tourism project, and you’ll have the chance to learn about their lifestyle during an orientation walk through the community. You’ll stop in at a local home as well as a spending some time with a local family. Say your farewells and return to Bocas de Toro, then enjoy the rest of a hugely rewarding day free in the Caribbean sun.

dayInfo.title: Boquete.
dayInfo.description: Travel by boat and private minibus to Boquete – this is a bit of a lengthy journey, so be sure to have a book, podcast or daydream to keep you occupied. Boquete is a picturesque town located in the highlands of Panama, surrounded by mountains, crystal-clear creeks and rivers, forest reserves and colourful wildflowers, as well as coffee plantations and orange groves. Head out on an orientation walk with your leader and enjoy an informal Spanish lesson to get to grips with the local language. Tomorrow will be a free day, wide open for exploring – most optional activities can be organised directly from the hotel, though it’s a good idea to book them when you arrive tonight if you know what you want to do.

dayInfo.title: Boquete.
dayInfo.description: There are plenty of ways to experience Boquete today, so be sure to chat to your leader and the hotel front desk to get the best insider tips. You could discover the secret waterfalls only locals know about on a walking tour in the jungle. Or maybe you’d prefer to soak it up in the Caldera hot springs. If you’re a coffee lover, consider visiting a plantation or simply kicking back in town with a cup of the local brew – some of the best coffee in the world is grown and processed right here in Boquete!

dayInfo.title: Chitre.
dayInfo.description: Say goodbye to Boquete and head to the southern city of Chitre. Arrive around lunchtime, then head out for an orientation walk with your leader (who will also be able to point you in the right direction for a good lunch spot). After a bite to eat, rejoin your fellow travellers head to a mask workshop for a glimpse at the country’s cultural heritage – elaborate masks and costumes are a feature of many festivals in Panama. The afternoon is free for you to continue exploring Chitre.

dayInfo.title: Panama City.
dayInfo.description: Depart Chitre this morning, heading for Panama City. Stop at the Miraflores Visitor Centre, which overlooks one of the locks that control the flow of ships through the Panama Canal. Learn about the canal’s history and engineering, then head back on the road to Panama City. On arrival head out on a leader-led orientation walk. Take in the great views of the historic Casco Viejo (Old Town) and the Panama City skyline as you stroll past crowded waterfront soccer fields, running paths and food carts. You might like to regroup with your fellow travellers in the evening for a final farewell dinner.

dayInfo.title: Panama City.
dayInfo.description: With no planned activities today, you can depart at any time. If you would like to spend some more time in Panama City, just speak to your booking agent.

tourName: Costa Rica private photography tour
generalInfo:
On this exciting photography trip you will visit the most photo-worthy destinations in Costa Rica, that you and your camera are bound to love. The amount of different landscapes and wildlife means that there is always something interesting to capture, providing you with a mixed variation of images. You will also be accompanied by an extremely talented Photography guide who will be teaching you throughout your expedition, the very gifted and award winning travel photographer – Matthew William Ellis.

Matthew is a documentary, destination and commercial travel photographer who has been a finalist in Travel Photographer of the Year for three years. His practices ensure guests follow safe practice guidelines and never impact wildlife or human life. Guests can understand and interact with locals because of his approach and engaging manner.

This photographic holiday is all about learning, practicing and experimenting with newly acquired techniques, tips and tricks, while exploring various locations across Costa Rica. With time spent flicking through slides, sat indoors is kept to a minimum!

By the end of the trip, you will feel confident about both technical and creative aspects of photography. You will learn to take control of your camera using shutter speed, aperture and ISO to create the look that you want from your photography. You will further your photographic eye, develop a proactive photography mindset and understand how to apply this to any given situation in order to allow you to capture eye-catching and emotive photographs when traveling in the future.

When we are not out and about, Matthew will provide feedback and guidance on photos taken during the day, as well as offering assistance with editing, organisation and output of images.

dayInfo.description: Welcome to Costa Rica We will be welcomed at San Jose airport and take a private transfer to the Hotel where you will meet Matthew. Overnight at Hotel Park Inn.

Today we will travel to TORTUGUERO on the Caribbean Coast This morning you have an early morning departure as you head off on the first part of your adventure to Tortuguero National Park. The journey to Tortuguero is by coach followed by boat and we will stop en-route for a typical Costa Rican breakfast. You may get the chance of seeing & taking photos of sloths in the trees around the restaurant. You will arrive at your jungle lodge in time for lunch. This afternoon you will be able to visit the Village of Tortuguero. Through this visit you will learn the ways of life of the local residents of Tortuguero. While you are in Tortuguero you will enjoy 2 boat trips to explore the channels. PHOTOGRAPHY The wildlife photography opportunities here are unrivalled! Floating alongside where the pristine rainforest meets the Tortuguero Lagoon offers beautiful scenery and a wealth of wildlife. Timing is everything in wildlife photography and you will learn about how to be completely ready to capture the exact moment a caiman pops it head up, a bird takes flight or a monkey jumps between branches.

Tortuguero Tortuguero National Park is one of Costa Rica’s most biologically diverse wildlife areas. This is the most important site in the western Caribbean for the nesting of the sea turtles. This very wet tropical forest is home of approximately 2,600 tree and plant species and a large range of wildlife. Birds, amphibians, freshwater fishes, American crocodiles and caimans, White-faced Capuchin, spider and Howler monkeys are living in this stunning area. Among all of these species, Tortuguero welcomes endangered animals such as manatees, tapirs and jaguars, to name a few. This morning we can have an early start where we will have the opportunity of taking some photos of the wildlife around the lodge area before breakfast. PHOTOGRAPHY Today will offer the opportunity to photograph the town of Tortuguero. While there, Matthew will make sure you are 100% confident with the basics of ISO, aperture, shutter speeds, focusing modes and what settings to have your camera so you are ready for the next mornings photographic outing!

Frog Heaven & the Northern Lowlands This morning will leave Tortuguero . After breakfast at the lodge, we will take the boat ride back to dock. Here we will meet up with our private transport and local guide who will be with us for the rest of our trip. We will have lunch and a photo tour in frog heaven before heading to our accommodation in Boca Tapada. PHOTOGRAPHY You will have the opportunity to try your hand at different style of wildlife photography here. We will capture photos of frogs in a controlled, but realistic environment. This will offer you the chance to learn about macro photography, and to start incorporating flash in a natural way.

Tropical Rainforest explorations We will spend the day in this rich eco-system with an incredible variety of fauna and flora. 350 different species of birds have been counted here, among them the Great Green Macaw. A perfect place to get some great photos of the bird and wildlife. Today we can enjoy a hummingbird tour. PHOTOGRAPHY The bird photography opportunities in Boca Tapada are endless. The place we are staying has beautifully positioned bird feeders with backdrops far into the distance, allowing you to capture beautiful photos of birds with a beautiful bokeh, out of focus background. The lodge has a fantastic rainforest trail, and you will get the chance to photograph bats feeding from flowers at night.

Arenal Volcano , La Fortuna You will start your morning with breakfast at the hotel and join a tour to see the king vultures. We will then head to Arenal volcano where as long as the weather is in our favour we should be able to do a landscape shoot. We then head to our new lodging for tonight. PHOTOGRAPHY Arenal Volcano area offers the opportunity to get stuck into a proper landscape shoot (at the mercy of the weather). What do I mean by a proper landscape shoot? Tripods, filters, beautiful light (fingers crossed), a perfectly conical volcano reflected in a lake and unfortunately the possibility of a very early morning! You will learn about how to create eye-catching landscape photos by making the most of the available light and focusing on finding strong compositions. If the stars make an appearance, you will also have the chance to learn night and astrophotography.

Arenal Volcano - Hanging Bridges Today we visit the Arenal Hanging Bridges for a natural history walk. This afternoon we will head to the Tabacon Hot Springs. After an afternoon at the hot springs, we will head out to take some sunset landscape photographs before heading back to our hotel for dinner. PHOTOGRAPHY Walking above the rainforest canopy on hanging bridges offers a truly unique perspective of the scenery and wildlife, and a chance to capture photographs for a completely different angle ensuring you build a diverse and varied portfolio of images from the trip. While staying in Arenal, you will have time to start working on the images you have taken so far on the trip, in front of a spectacular rainforest backdrop. Matthew will offer tutorials on organising and editing photos, ensuring your final images look as fantastic as possible!

Punta Leona Today we head to the Pacific Coast and the beautiful Punta Leona. We will stop on-route for lunch and will be able to see our first glimpse of the crocodiles on the Tarcoles River from the bridge. PHOTOGRAPHY By now you will be very well prepared to explore Carara National Park for another dose of wildlife photography. You never quite know what you are going to see, but that is what makes it so exciting, and with you new wildlife photography skills, you will be ready to capture the moment when it happens. Punta Leona beach is quite simply a photographers paradise. You will have the opportunity to further your landscape photography skills, learning about using long exposures creatively to enhance your compositions. Punta Leona’s palm trees, beautiful golden sands and interesting rock formations offer plenty of compositional elements to play around with too. As the sun goes down you might find yourself with just Coati for company.

Tamar & the Tarcoles River Morning taking before we head to the Carara National Park. Carara is one of Costa Rica’s most popular National Parks (so prepare for more people). A few of the local animals include Opossum, Two-toed Sloths, Agouti, Armadillo, Pacas, Great Anteater, Kinkajou, Tayra, Margay Cat, Collared Peccary, White-tailed Deer, Poison-arrow Frogs, and the Omnipresent Monkeys We will be able to visit the fishing village of Tacoles, before heading onto the Tarcoles River for a sunset boat tour. We will be able to get close to some of the giant crocodiles who call this river home. PHOTOGRAPHY The abundance of bird life and outrageous size of the crocodiles on the Tarcoles River make for a truly spectacular wildlife photography experience. The focus here is going to be learning how to successfully capture birds in flight. With the river and mangrove scenery being much more open than in the rainforest, this will be our best chance to capture Scarlet Macaws flying side by side. They are actually very generous to photographers, letting out squawks and screams that carry for miles so you always know when they are coming!

Uvita Today we head to Uvita. We will stop at La Parcela for lunch, one of the best seafood restaurants in Costa Rica. Tonight we will sleep at La Cusinga Lodge. Located on the South Pacific coast of Costa Rica. La Cusinga Eco Lodge offers guests breathtaking views of the Pacific Ocean and its sunsets. Surrounded by tropical forests and deserted beaches where freshwater waterfalls reach the Pacific Ocean in one of the most beautiful tropical areas of the world. PHOTOGRAPHY Cusinga offer yet more chance for both wildlife and landscape photography. The wide expanse of golden sand is backed by a bank of thick, pristine rainforest meaning the beach is completed isolated and receives virtually no visitors. In one sunrise or sunset shoot, you will have the opportunity to capture the impressive coastal landscape and local wildlife of monkeys and wading birds.

Nauyaca Waterfall Today we will visit the Nauyaca waterfalls. ¨These majestic waterfalls are recognized worldwide for their beauty - located in a canyon approximately eighty meters wide. One of the falls is forty-five meters high in free fall and the other twenty meters high in stepped fall, forming at the foot of it, a pool of a thousand square meters and six meters deep.” There are also many other natural pools, which are there to enjoy. We will have lunch there before returning to Cusinga Lodge. After our visit to Nauyaca Falls we will take a private transfer to San Gerardo – one of the best places to see the Quetzel. Tonight we will stay at Paraiso Quetzal Lodge. PHOTOGRAPHY At Nauyaca Waterfall, you will learn about how to use long exposures effectively in photographing waterfalls and how filters such as polarisers can be used to enhance your images.

San Gerado de Dota San Gerado de Dota is a haven for birdwatchers and hikers. Located in the Savegre River Valley, this allows you quick access to Los Quetzales National Park (the home of the Quetzal). This is one of the most beautiful regions of Costa Rica with green mountainous backdrop & dense forests. Apart from the iconic Quetzal, there is a plethora of humming birds and woodpeckers to enjoy, as well as peccaries and coyotes. PHOTOGRAPHY Today you will learn various techniques for photographing hummingbirds including using just natural light, a single flash, and how to get creative with flash. As with most locations in Costa Rica, you will also have the chance for both landscape and wildlife photography, perfecting your long exposure skills and capturing images of the abundant birdlife during a walk along the river.

San Gerado - Savegre Lodge Today we move lodges but still within San Gerado. Today we will go in search for the Quetzal, offering you the chance to photograph one of the most beautiful birds in Costa Rica. PHOTOGRAPHY Following on from what you learned the previous day about photography hummingbirds, you will have the opportunity to capture photos using a multi-flash set up. All equipment will be provided, and the techniques you learn will be applicable to any flash photography going forward.

San Gerado – Savegre Lodge The trip will come to an end with another chance to search for the Quetzal - we will head out on a Quetzal hunt, along the road in San Gerado. We will have lunch at Savegre Lodge, before exploring this area further.
Airport Transfer You will get a private transfer to the airport in time for your flight home.

tourName: Costa Rica self drive holiday, natural history
placesVisited: Central Valley mountains, waterfalls and hummingbirds, Sarapiqui lowland rainforest and La Selva Bioligical station, remote Caño Negro wildlife rich wetlands, rainforest lodge within driving distance of the Arenal Volcano area, Playa Esterillos nature beach on central Pacific coast
generalInfo:
This two week Costa Rica holiday is a self drive, tailor made itinerary which takes in some of the country’s most stunning off the beaten track secrets - the Chayote Country mountains in the central valley where visitors can experience real local life outside of the main tourist centres, as well as stunning natural scenery, the Sarapiqui rainforest - a birding hotspot and home to the fascinating La Selva biological station, the off grid Caño Negro wildlife rich wetlands in northern Costa Rica, a boutique rainforest lodge with onsite hotspring pools within driving distance of the Arenal volcano and its attractions, and time at a pristine, wild nature beach on the central Pacific coast.
