generalInfo: Costa Rica is a fantastic destination for a honeymoon. It is safe, friendly and easy to travel around. We will see tropical rainforests; see some magical sights and breathtaking flowers and wildlife, even check out the stunning Arenal volcano. A perfect itinerary to allow you to experience Costa Rica and its remarkable flora and fauna at the same time as having a relaxing honeymoon with some downtime on the beach. For this fantastic Costa Rican Honeymoon adventure, we explore National Parks and Forests, experience rapids, unforgettable wildlife, hot springs and even a volcano. There is so much to take in, including days spent relaxing on the beach towards the end of the trip. A perfect way to spend your honeymoon with your loved one. Visit one of most biologically intense places on earth on your special holiday. Raft the Sarapiqui river and see some fantastic national parks, trek the varied coastal habitat and have the chance to see vast array of birds and mammals Costa Rica has to offer.

dayInfo.description: San Jose Meeting and greeting at the San Jose International Airport by our staff and get a private transfer to your Hotel in San Jose. Our staff will help you with the check- in and will give you the Welcome Kit with important information about your trip and will review the itinerary with you. Hotel includes: 2 hours open bar, free international phone calls – Wi-Fi- daily breakfast. Hotel includes: 2 hours open bar, free international phone calls – WiFi- daily breakfast.

Tortuguero National Park (B,L,D) Early morning start as you are picked up from your hotel and transferred to Tortuguero (breakfast on route). You will arrive to Caño Blanco pier before boarding a motor boat (2hours) to take you to the lodge for lunch. In the afternoon you will get the chance to adventure into Tortuguero Town and visit the Turtle Centre! ** Today we recommend taking the tour to see turtles, it has to be arranged at the front desk of the hotel (cost $35 per person). You can also book it for the second night in case that you don’t have any luck on the first night.

Tortuguero National Park (B,L,D) Day in Tortuguero, visit to the canals. (Entrance fee to the National Park is not included, as this has to be paid directly at the park, $10 per person). Tour can be in the morning or afternoon; it will depend on the itinerary. Today you can also visit the butterfly garden, frog garden and the trails around the hotel. Optional tours are offered at the lodge

Siquuirres - San Martin (B,L,D) Breakfast at the lodge, followed by a 2 hour motor boat to the pier where you will board the bus for your return drive to Siquirres. You will be dropped off at a restaurant where the rafting company Rios Tropicales will be waiting to take you to their Operations Centre where lunch will be served. You’ll then depart for our private rafting put-in on the Pacuare River in San Martin. There your professional guides will load your gear into dry bags, prepare all the rafting equipment, give you complete safety and paddle instruction. The first day's Class III rapids welcome you to the Pacuare gorge's charm as you raft deep in the heart of primary rainforest. Along its course lie several densely vegetated gorges sheltering many animals, including sloths, river otters, and anteaters, and an incredible variety of birds—toucans, egrets, herons, kingfishers, sunbirds, and trogons. Before you know it, you'll arrive at our unique Rios Tropicales Lodge where you can spend the afternoon relaxing, hiking or soaking in our waterfall and pools. Nestled in the jungle on our 2,000-acre private reserve, the Lodge offers you all the comforts you need in "Cabecar Indian" style bungalows.

Forest Tour - Rapids - La Fortuna (B,L) Breakfast at the hotel This morning, enjoy a four-platform canopy tour through the forest. Hike on a trail high above the rainforest canopy for sweeping view of the river corridor below. After the hike we will pack up and load the rafts in preparation for paddling down the Pacuare gorge past gushing waterfalls, serene pools and pounding rapids. A snack stop by the riverside lets you explore more waterfalls and natural waterslides. An adrenaline-packed afternoon running rapids like Double Drop, Upper Huacas, Lower Huacas, Cimarron, Dos Montañas and many more, will have you cheering ecstatically. We take out near the town of Siquirres and come back to the Operation Centre where you can take a shower and get ready for the transfer to La Fortuna, home of the famous Arenal Volcano.

La Fortuna Adventure - Baldi Hot Springs (B,D) After a delicious breakfast your adventure begins. Get ready to fly through the rain forest on one of the best zip lines in La Fortuna. You will ride an open-air gondola from the ground to the heights where you'll be dropped off at an observation deck for fantastic views of the volcano and land below. From the observation deck, return to the ground below by riding down on a circuit of zip lines stretching across canyons and between treetops. In the evening you will travel to the Baldi Hot springs where you can relax on the 18 free form, landscaped pools that provide a great view of the volcano and a multitude of options. With temperatures ranging from 83 °F to 103 °F and environments that vary from raging waterfalls to tranquil forest experiences you can find the perfect pool for their mood and the current weather conditions. Dinner is included at the hot springs. Transportation is not included but you can coordinate a taxi from the front desko f the hotel.

Arenal Volcano (B) Today you have a shared transfer to Monteverde. Your 3 hours transfer starts with a ground transfer, then continues from where you will admire the exotic wildlife that lives within this zone while enjoying the transition from the rain forest to the cloud forest, reaching the best view point of the Monteverde Cloud Forest Preserve and an impressive panoramic view of the Arenal Volcano. The scenic transfer ends on the other side of the Lake, where a jeep ride will be waiting for you to take you to your hotel. Afternoon Chocolate & Coffee Tour. On the tour you will be completely immersed for 30 minutes within the world of chocolate enjoying its delicious aromas and learning about its history. You will participate in the chocolate making process and have the opportunity to taste the fruit of the cacao and observe how the small cocoa beans are magically converted into a rich tasting chocolate drink. You will get an insight into the traditional methods that our ancestors used to roast the beans, separate the husks and grind the beans. At the end of the tour you can enjoy the taste of the chocolate you’ve made in a variety of forms; liquid chocolate, plain chocolate, spiced chocolate and of course, coffee chocolate.

Selvatura Park, Monteverdi Cloud Forest (B) Breakfast included at the hotel. Selvatura Park is a nature and Adventure Park where visitors can enjoy the beauty of the Monteverde Cloud Forest today you will enjoy of the Hanging Treetop Walkways Bridges, Selvatura's Tree Top Walkways consist of a 1.9 mile (approximately 3 kilometres) trail that crosses through the Monteverde Cloud Forest. Here visitors will walk on eight different bridges with various lengths ranging between 150 feet (50 meters) up to 510 feet (170 meters) and altitudes ranging between 36 feet (12 meters) up to 180 feet (60 meters).Each bridge has a width of five feet, the widest bridges in Costa Rica, and also a capacity of up to 80 people per bridge making them both the longest and strongest bridge systems in the Monteverde Cloud Forest. The duration of the hike usually takes between 1.5 and 2 hours we recommend the early morning tour so you can have more chance of observing more wild life. After that, visit to the Butterfly garden of Selvatura. Afternoon, shared transfer to Rincon de la Vieja.

Rincon de la Vieja National Park (B) Breakfast included at the hotel Today you have a guided hike to Rincon de la Vieja National Park – Las Pailas section. The Las Pailas section of the Rincón de la Vieja National Park is located very near Hacienda Guachipelín’s ranch. On this loop trail of about 2.5 miles (3.5 km), you can enjoy the best views of the active Rincón de la Vieja Volcano without climbing the main crater. Here you can find a great variety of vegetation and trees, and the Park is home to mammals like raccoons, white-nosed coatis, Central American agoutis, armadillos, tapirs and three species of monkeys, as well as birds such as the Blue-crowned Motmot, the Crested Guan and the Emerald Toucanet. The most impressive and spectacular features of the National Park are its volcanic elements. Steam and sulphur pour out of the yellow and rust-coloured ground at natural fumaroles. Clay and coffee-coloured pools bubble with boiling hot volcanic water. Smooth grey volcanic mud froths and explodes upward at the “Cauldrons” (“Las Pailas” in Spanish), for which this section of the Park is named. You’ll also find beautiful little rushing rivers and small waterfalls crisscrossing the trails. The rest of the day is at leisure (you can choose an option to visit the Hot Springs and relax with the volcanic mud – not included in package)

SPA / HORSE BACKRIDING! (B) You’ll start you morning with breakfast at the hotel. After breakfast you will choose from the following activities: Spa day (Mus Bath + Sauna + hot springs) or horse back riding to the waterfalls.
At the beach! (B) Breakfast included at the hotel These days are for you to enjoy the beach and the facilities of the hotel.
Free days. Breakfast at the Hotel Share transfer from Bosque del Mar Hotel on Playa Hermosa to San Jose

tourName: Mexico, Guatemala & Costa Rica tour, 20 day
generalInfo:
Journey from the vibrant streets of Mexico City to the stunning beaches of Costa Rica on this unforgettable 20-day adventure through Central America! Experience the excitement of Lucha Libre in Mexico City, catch a sunset surf session in Puerto Escondido, and swim in glowing bioluminescent waters. Wander through Oaxaca’s bustling markets, hike to the summit of Guatemala’s Acatenango Volcano for a breathtaking sunrise, and paddleboard across Costa Rica’s Arenal Lake. Soar through cloud forests on a zipline, relax in volcanic hot springs, and cruise along Manuel Antonio’s coastline at sunset. Packed with adventure, culture, and incredible landscapes, this trip is the perfect way to explore three incredible countries in one epic journey!

If this trip seems like something of interest for you, get in touch and we can build an itinerary around the following inclusions:

Accommodation:

- Includes hostel accommodation throughout your tour.
- All accommodation is simple, but clean and comfortable.
- 1 night of Camping

Transport:

- All local transport throughout your tour, including buses and an internal flights.

Guiding:
- Amazing Adventure Leaders in each country for your tour.

Included Activities:

Lucha Libre, traditional Mexican wrestling (Mexico City) 
Walking tour of Mexico City (Mexico City) 
Informal Spanish lesson (Mexico City) 
Surf lesson (Puerto Escondido) 
Alebrijes workshop (on route to Oaxaca) 
Cooking class (Oaxaca) 
Hierve el Agua day tour incl. Visit to Tule tree and Mitla Ancient Ruins (Oaxaca) 
Mezcal tasting (Oaxaca) 
Salsa lesson (Oaxaca) 
Flight from Oaxaca to Cancun 
Chichén Itzá visit 
Visit & swim in local Cenote (Tulum) 
Guided bike tour (Tulum) 
Flight from Tulum to Guatemala City 
2-day hike of the Acatenango Volcano (including lunch & dinner on day 1, & breakfast on day 2) 
Flight from Guatemala City to San José (Costa Rica) 
La Fortuna Waterfall (La Fortuna) 
Arenal Volcano hike (La Fortuna) 
Hanging bridges tour (La Fortuna) 
Natural thermal baths (La Fortuna) 
Arenal Lake boat ride (on route from La Fortuna to Manuel Antonio) 
Ziplining in 100% Aventura National Park (on route from La Fortuna to Manuel Antonio) 
Catamaran day trip incl. snorkelling, dolphin, whale watching, & farewell dinner

dayInfo.description: Mexico City: Get ready for an exciting start to your adventure as you meet your Adventure Leader in the hotel lounge this afternoon for a trip briefing. You’ll get all the details on your journey ahead, plus top tips for staying safe while exploring Central America. Then, it’s time to dive straight into the action—Mexican style! Your first night kicks off with Lucha Libre, the country’s electrifying take on wrestling. Expect dramatic moves, flamboyant costumes, and legendary masked wrestlers putting on an unforgettable show. This is Mexico City at its most thrilling! Arriving early? Here’s how to make the most of your extra time: History buff? Visit the ancient pyramids of Teotihuacán, a UNESCO World Heritage site home to the awe-inspiring Pyramids of the Sun and the Moon. Want a local experience? Head to Xochimilco, where you’ll float along colorful canals on a traditional trajinera (gondola). Enjoy mariachi music, delicious Mexican street food, and maybe even a tequila or two! No matter how you choose to kick off your adventure, get ready for an incredible journey through Mexico!

Mexico City: What better way to kick off your adventure than with a walking tour of Mexico City’s most iconic landmarks? Stroll through the historic Zócalo Main Square, marvel at the grandeur of the Metropolitan Cathedral, take in the stunning murals at the National Palace, and uncover the ancient ruins of the Templo Mayor—a fascinating glimpse into the city’s Aztec past. After a morning of exploration, it’s time to fuel up with a delicious local lunch before switching gears to a Spanish crash course led by your Adventure Leader. Learn key phrases that’ll help you connect with locals and enhance your travel experience—because ordering tacos in Spanish just hits different! The Afternoon Is Yours—How Will You Spend It? Cycle to Chapultepec Castle – Rent a bike and cruise over to Chapultepec Park, home to the only royal castle in the Americas. Once an imperial palace, a battlefield, and now a museum, this historic site offers breathtaking panoramic views of the city. Prefer a more relaxed approach? Hop in an Uber and take a leisurely ride to the castle instead! As the sun sets, gather with your group for an evening of authentic Mexican cuisine. Savour bold flavours, soak in the vibrant atmosphere, and cap it all off with tequila or mezcal—the choice (and the consequences) are yours!

Puerto Escondido: Rise and shine! This morning, we’ll catch an early flight to the breathtaking coastal town of Puerto Escondido, arriving just in time for lunch. Once we land, the afternoon is yours to spend as you wish. Beach time? Dive into the crystal-clear waters, soak up the sun, and unwind on the golden sands. Poolside vibes? Kick back with your travel crew and enjoy some well-earned relaxation at the hostel. Sunset Surf Session – Ride the Waves in Paradise As the late afternoon rolls in, we’ll head to the beach for an unforgettable surf lesson at sunset! Puerto Escondido is a world-famous surfing hotspot, and there’s no better place to check "learn to surf" off your bucket list. What to Expect: Learn surf basics and pop-up techniques from a professional coach Practice on the sand before hitting the waves Ride the ocean under a golden sunset The Night is Yours – What’s the Move? Enjoy fresh seafood at a local restaurant Sip cocktails at a beachfront bar with stunning ocean views Experience La Punta’s buzzing nightlife and dance under the stars Whether you're looking for laid-back beach vibes or an unforgettable night out, Puerto Escondido has it all!

Puerto Escondido: Today is all about relaxation, exploration, and adventure – the choice is yours! Chill Mode: - Soak up the sun on Puerto Escondido’s stunning beaches - Wander through this bohemian coastal town and explore its laid-back charm - Discover nearby hidden beaches for a more secluded escape Adventure Mode: - Dolphin & Whale Watching Tour (seasonal) - Spot playful dolphins, majestic humpback whales, sea turtles, and other marine life - Enjoy breathtaking views of the Pacific Ocean while basking in the sun A Night to Remember – Bioluminescent Lagoon Experience As night falls, get ready for one of nature’s most magical phenomena – the Manialtepec Lagoon. What to Expect: Swim through glowing waters as bioluminescent creatures light up around you A once-in-a-lifetime experience straight out of a fairy tale A true main character moment you’ll never forget Note: This activity is unavailable on nights surrounding a full moon due to visibility. Or… Keep the Night Going! If you’d rather keep the party vibes alive, hit up Puerto Escondido’s legendary nightlife with your travel crew. From beach bars to rooftop parties, the energy here is electric! Whatever you choose, today is all about making unforgettable memories in paradise!

Oaxaca: This morning, we set off early for our next destination—Oaxaca (pronounced Wahaca), a city known for its deep Indigenous heritage, vibrant festivals, and colonial architecture. Along the way, you’ll have the chance to get creative by making your own alebrijes, the intricately painted wooden creatures inspired by traditional Mexican folk art. Arriving in Oaxaca in the early afternoon, your Adventure Leader will meet you before you check into your hostel. The afternoon is yours to explore at your own pace. A great place to start is the botanical gardens, which showcase a stunning variety of native Mexican plant species. Later, join your fellow travelers for a hands-on cooking class, where you’ll learn to prepare a classic Oaxacan dish—mole. This rich, flavorful sauce is a staple of the region, known for its perfect balance of smoky, sweet, and spicy flavors. With your culinary skills sharpened, the evening is yours to enjoy. You might choose to browse the artisan markets, relax at a rooftop bar, or experience live music and traditional dance performances in this lively and culturally rich city.

Hierve el Agua: This morning, we rise early and head straight to the iconic Hierve el Agua, but not before making a stop to see the famous Tule tree—widely regarded as the world’s widest tree! This ancient Montezuma cypress is over 2,000 years old and has a diameter of 14 meters (46 feet), which is roughly the same width as a tennis court or an adult blue whale! Next, we’ll continue our journey to Hierve el Agua, located about 70 km east of Oaxaca. This stunning natural site is known for its mineral-rich rock formations that resemble cascading waterfalls. We’ll take time to explore the area and, if you wish, take a refreshing dip in the spring-fed pools. On our way back to Oaxaca, we’ll immerse ourselves in authentic Mexican culture with two unforgettable stops. First, we’ll visit the Mitla Ancient Ruins, a Zapotec archaeological site famous for its intricate geometric mosaics, well-preserved temples, and its history as a sacred burial ground. Then, we’ll dive into a mezcal tasting session, where you’ll learn about this smoky spirit and its traditional production methods, all guided by an expert. In the evening, it’s time for a fun and lively Mexican experience—salsa dancing! Join your group for an exciting salsa class where you’ll learn the vibrant rhythms and energetic moves that define this cultural dance.

Oaxaca to Tulum: This morning, we'll head to the airport for our next exciting destination—Tulum! After a flight to Cancun, we’ll take a bus transfer to Tulum, arriving around 3pm. The rest of the day is yours to enjoy at your leisure, but if the weather is perfect, you may want to join a sunset sailing tour. (Feel free to email us for more details.)

Tulum: This morning, we’ll set off to explore Chichén Itzá, an awe-inspiring ancient Mayan city and UNESCO World Heritage Site. Home to the iconic El Castillo pyramid, this remarkable site also showcases other stunning Mayan structures that reveal the region’s rich cultural and architectural history. After soaking in the grandeur of Chichén Itzá, we’ll make our way to a local, community-run cenote. These natural limestone sinkholes, once considered sacred by the Mayans, are perfect for a refreshing swim in their vibrant blue waters, surrounded by lush, natural beauty. Next, we’ll head to Valladolid, a picturesque colonial town known for its colorful streets, historic charm, and deep Mayan roots. After a delightful lunch, we’ll continue on our journey back to Tulum. As the evening draws near, consider joining your group to watch the sunset at one of the beach bars or take some time to explore the lively atmosphere of Tulum’s downtown.

Tulum: Today is all about exploration, and what better way to do it than by bike? In the morning, we’ll embark on a guided bike tour through Tulum, where you’ll visit the stunning ancient Mayan ruins perched above the sea. Along the way, we’ll pedal through the vibrant town before reaching the beach for a refreshing dip in the crystal-clear waters. The afternoon is yours to enjoy however you wish! Our local experts recommend the following options to make the most of your time in Tulum: -For a relaxing vibe – cycle back to the hostel for some downtime. -For water enthusiasts – take a snorkel in a beautiful cenote, one of our top picks. -For nature lovers – embark on a guided boat tour through Sian Ka’an at sunset. For beach lovers - lounge on the pristine sands of Playa Paraíso. As evening sets in, why not head to Tulum Pueblo for a delicious meal? Treat yourself to affordable tacos or traditional Yucatán dishes. Finish off the night at Batey Mojito & Guarapo Bar, where you can enjoy a mojito and live music, toasting to another unforgettable day with your travel companions!

Tulum to Guatemala City: Today, your Central American adventure continues as we arrive in our second country—Guatemala! In the morning, we'll head to the airport for a flight to Guatemala City. Upon landing, we’ll set off on a scenic journey to San Pedro La Laguna, a charming town on the southwestern shore of Lake Atitlán. The drive takes around six hours, but the breathtaking views along the way make it well worth the trip. Once we arrive, take the evening to settle in and soak up the beauty and laid-back atmosphere of this stunning lakeside town.

San Pedro La Laguna: This morning, you have the option to take on a truly unforgettable experience—a sunrise hike to the iconic Indian Nose Viewpoint. The early wake-up call will be well worth it as you're rewarded with breathtaking panoramic views of Lake Atitlán and the surrounding volcanoes, all illuminated by the golden glow of sunrise. In the afternoon, you and your fellow travelers can choose from a variety of adventures: - Set sail on a boat party across the lake - Kayak on the tranquil waters of Lake Atitlán - Take the plunge with cliff jumping in San Marcos - Unwind in solar pools—natural hot tubs heated by volcanic energy, offering stunning lake views - Explore the charming streets of San Pedro La Laguna, visiting its church, market, and narrow, colorful alleyways Just a heads-up—there are two action-packed days ahead, so an early night might be a smart move!

Acatenango Volcano: Today begins one of the most unforgettable experiences of the trip—a two-day hike up Acatenango Volcano! We’ll start the day by transferring from San Pedro La Laguna to the trailhead, where the adventure kicks off with a challenging but rewarding six-hour hike. The trail winds through dense cloud forests, farmland, and stunning high-altitude landscapes, offering breathtaking views along the way. We’ll take a well-deserved break for lunch with panoramic vistas before continuing to a prime vantage point to witness Volcán de Fuego’s dramatic eruptions—from a safe distance, of course! As we reach base camp, settle in for a hearty dinner and take in the mesmerizing sight of glowing lava against the night sky. Then, it’s time to rest up for an early morning summit push!

Acatenango Volcano: Today starts early—really early! At 3 AM, we’ll begin the final ascent to Acatenango’s summit, a challenging two-hour climb over steep, loose volcanic ash and gravel. The effort is well worth it, as you’ll be rewarded with breathtaking sunrise views over the surrounding volcanoes and valleys. After taking in the stunning scenery, we’ll descend back to base camp for a well-earned breakfast before making our way to our next destination—Antigua! This charming colonial town is famous for its beautifully preserved Spanish Baroque architecture, cobblestone streets, and vibrant cultural scene. In the evening, we’ll celebrate our achievement with a night out in one of Antigua’s lively bars, where you can enjoy live music and soak up the city’s buzzing atmosphere. If you’re in the mood for a well-deserved rest instead, feel free to kick back and relax! (*The summit hike is optional—if you’d rather catch some extra sleep, you can stay at base camp and enjoy a slower morning.)

Antigua: After your two-day volcano trek, today is all about well-earned rest and relaxation. And what better place to unwind than Antigua? This charming colonial town is rich in culture, history, and stunning architecture—perfect for a slower-paced day. Take a leisurely stroll through its colorful streets, sip on world-class Guatemalan coffee at a cozy café in the central square, or treat yourself to some well-deserved pampering at a local spa. If you’re up for a little more exploring, head up to Cerro de la Cruz for panoramic views of the town, especially at sunset. However you choose to spend the day, Antigua’s laid-back charm makes it the ideal spot to recharge before the next leg of your adventure.

Antigua to Costa Rica: Today, your Central American adventure continues as you arrive in your third and final country—Costa Rica! You'll start with a transfer to Guatemala City airport (about 90 minutes) before boarding a flight to San José. Upon landing, we’ll continue the journey with a scenic three-hour drive to La Fortuna, a vibrant town famous for its stunning Arenal Volcano, rejuvenating hot springs, breathtaking waterfalls, and thrilling outdoor activities. Once you arrive, check into your hostel and take the evening to unwind after a full day of travel. Whether you relax at the hostel, grab a bite to eat, or take a stroll through town, La Fortuna is the perfect place to recharge before the adventures ahead.

La Fortuna: Today is all about immersing yourself in the natural beauty of La Fortuna with a full day of adventure. Start the morning with a visit to the breathtaking La Fortuna Waterfall, where you can admire the cascading waters and take a refreshing dip. From there, head to the Laguna Tabacón camping area, where you’ll have the option to kayak or paddleboard on the serene lake, surrounded by lush rainforest and volcano views. Next, embark on a scenic hike around Arenal Volcano, exploring its unique landscapes before enjoying a well-earned lunch back at the campsite. In the afternoon, take your adventure to new heights with a walk across the Arenal Hanging Bridges, where you’ll navigate a series of suspension bridges offering a stunning aerial perspective of the rainforest. After an action-packed day, it’s time to unwind. La Fortuna is home to some of the world's best hot springs, thanks to its volcanic activity. Soak in the warm, mineral-rich waters and let the natural thermal baths ease your muscles, before enjoying a relaxed evening at your own pace.

La Fortuna: Today is yours to enjoy, but if you're looking for adventure, we've got some incredible optional activities lined up: For the adrenaline junkies, why not spend the day canyoning or white-water rafting—or both if you're up for the challenge? Navigate through La Fortuna’s lush rainforest reserve as you rappel down towering waterfalls, slide into jungle pools, and trek through rocky canyons. If rafting is more your style, take on thrilling rapids while spotting monkeys, toucans, and sloths along the riverbanks. With breathtaking scenery and nonstop excitement, this is the ultimate way to experience La Fortuna’s wild side. For those drawn to nature, a day tour to Rio Celeste is a must. Hike through Tenorio Volcano National Park to witness its striking turquoise waterfall, bubbling hot springs, and dense rainforest. The vibrant blue waters are a natural wonder, making this a truly unforgettable experience. As night falls, consider joining your group for a guided walk through the rainforest, where you'll have the chance to encounter Costa Rica’s fascinating nocturnal wildlife. Keep an eye out for red-eyed tree frogs, glowing insects, and elusive jungle creatures that only come to life after dark. (Note: Due to time constraints, those who choose canyoning and rafting will not be able to do the Rio Celeste tour, and vice versa.)

La Fortuna to Manual Antonio: Today is a travel day as we journey from La Fortuna to Manuel Antonio, a coastal paradise known for its stunning beaches, lush rainforests, and abundant wildlife. But getting there is an adventure in itself! The day begins with a scenic boat ride across Arenal Lake, offering incredible views of the towering volcano and the surrounding landscapes. Once we reach the other side, we’ll continue by land, winding through breathtaking mountain scenery on our way to Monteverde. We’ll stop in Monteverde for lunch before heading to 100% Aventura Park, home to the longest zip line in Costa Rica. Soar high above the treetops, taking in panoramic views of the jungle and Arenal Volcano while spotting wildlife like howler monkeys and toucans. After an exhilarating afternoon, we’ll continue our journey to Manuel Antonio, arriving in the late evening, ready to explore this tropical paradise.

Manual Antonio: This morning, if you're still feeling adventurous, join us for a guided tour of the stunning Manuel Antonio National Park. Explore lush rainforests, discover diverse wildlife including sloths, monkeys, and exotic birds, and unwind on the park's pristine white-sand beaches. For those who prefer a slower pace, enjoy some free time to relax on the beach and soak up the sun. Then, in the late afternoon, we’ll re-group for a thrilling sunset catamaran ride. As we sail along the coast, keep your eyes peeled for playful dolphins and, if you're lucky, majestic whales. When we reach a beautiful spot, take the opportunity to snorkel in the crystal-clear waters, swimming alongside tropical fish and sea turtles. After a perfect day at sea, sit back and relax as we watch the sunset together. The evening will conclude with a delicious farewell dinner, a fitting end to an unforgettable journey through Central America.

San José: Sadly, today marks the end of your incredible journey through Central America. We’ll begin the day with an early transfer back to San José, where the tour will conclude mid-morning. It's time to say goodbye to your Adventure Leader and the unforgettable experiences you've shared. Safe travels, and we hope to see you again on another adventure soon!

tourName: Natural highlights tour of Costa Rica
placesVisited: San Jose, Tortuguero National Park, Sea Turtle Museum, Arenal Volcano, La Fortuna, Caño Negro Wildlife Refuge, Los Chiles village, Tilaran Mountain Range, Monteverde Cloud Forest Reserve
generalInfo:
Costa Rica is brimming over with natural highlights and this nine day circular tour from San Jose promises some of the best locations to find out more including Tortuguero National Park, Caño Negro Wildlife Refuge and the magnificent Monteverde Cloud Forest Reserve.

From innumerate indigenous flora and fauna, including more than 850 different species of bird, to walking trails through cloud forests and river boat rides and the Caribbean coastline, this nine day small group tour highlights why Costa Rica is currently the world’s hottest destination for nature loving travellers.

dayInfo.description: Begin your adventure in San José, the culture-rich capital of Costa Rica. A complimentary transfer from the airport to the hotel is available. Check in and take it easy, there’s plenty of excitement on this trip, so today’s all about relaxing and easing ourselves into the adventure. Around 7.30pm, say hola to your tour leader and fellow travellers when we gather as a group for a short briefing and dinner together. Our main briefing takes place tomorrow afternoon in Tortuguero due to the late arrival of some flights today. Want to explore San Jose further? Secure pre-tour hotel nights through your sales representative. Accommodation: KC Hotel or Delta by Marriott San José Aurola (or similar)

Our adventure begins early this morning, leaving San Jose behind as we travel to Tortuguero National Park in the northeast of Costa Rica. Accessible only by boat or light aircraft, Tortuguero has a vast network of waterways, canals and swamps that are remarkably tranquil, unspoilt and devoid of noise pollution. On reaching the pier, we board a small motorboat for the journey to our lodge (up to 1hr 30min) , which is a short distance from the main lagoon. Please note the transfer from San José to Tortuguero is not private for our groups. This afternoon your tour leader will host the main welcome briefing when we gather as a group to get to know each other and learn more about the adventures ahead. We also visit Tortuguero village, where it’s possible to enter the Sea Turtle Museum (a donation is requested at the entrance). Tortuguero is probably most famous as a nesting site for the endangered green turtle, which can be seen coming ashore to lay eggs from late July to October (as part of an optional excursion). Hawksbill, loggerhead, and giant leatherback turtles also nest in this region, and from late August through to November, baby turtles hatch and make their way to the ocean. Today's travel time will be in the region of five to six hours including a stop for breakfast. Accommodation: Evergreen Lodge or Pachira Lodge (or similar)

A morning boat trip enables us to discover the extraordinary flora and fauna of Tortuguero, passing serenely along the waterways. At this time of day, wildlife is usually at its most active and with the help of our expert guide we are likely to encounter monkeys, caiman, iguanas, butterflies and many of the 300-plus bird species recorded here. We return to the lodge for a hearty breakfast by the river. This afternoon, we enjoy a second boat trip along a different canal. Alternatively, stay at the lodge this afternoon if you want to enjoy the facilities or follow a short walking trail through the forest. Accommodation: Evergreen Lodge or Pachira Lodge (or similar)

We leave Tortuguero the same way we arrived by taking a small boat to the pier. Our bus will be at the pier waiting to drive us to the Arenal region, passing huge banana, pineapple and sugar cane plantations on the way. Arenal was the most active volcano in Costa Rica until 2010, when it entered a resting phase and stopped spitting ash, smoke and lava. However, there is still a lot of geothermal activity here and you'll have the opportunity to visit one of the excellent hot springs this evening. Alternatively, embark on a chocolate and coffee tour or take a walk on the wild side with the Ecoglide zipline . In clear weather, there are great views of the volcano from our overnight base, the nearby town of La Fortuna. Today's travelling time is around 5hr 30min including a lunch stop. Accommodation: Arenal Montechiari or Casa Luna (or similar)

Today we enjoy Costa Rica's natural beauty at its best with a visit to Arenal Observatory Lodge, located within Arenal Volcano National Park. Our walk incorporates a hanging bridge through the treetop canopy and meanders through beautiful tropical gardens and lush rainforest. The property has a variety of trails and the tour leader will select a trail that suits the whole group for an enjoyable walk full of biodiversity. Two impressive observation towers, including the 28-meter-high Nest Tower, offer panoramic views of the surroundings. The adventure takes approximately two to three hours and offers opportunities to see or hear more than 250 species of birds, three types of monkeys and a whole host of other mammals, insects, reptiles, plants and flowers. After the nature walk, a delicious lunch is included in the restaurant. The afternoon is free to relax or embark on one of Arenal's many optional activities, including zip lining and a coffee and chocolate tour. Accommodation: Arenal Montechiari or Casa Luna (or similar)

From Arenal, we travel to the Tilarán Mountain Range in the Central Highlands for our first taste of a Costa Rican cloud forest. The journey provides breath-taking views of the Gulf of Nicoya and the islands below as we ascend the hills towards Monteverde, a forest-cloaked region whose name means Green Mountain. The high altitude supports a complex ecosystem where plants thrive, particularly orchids of which there are some 400-plus different varieties here. Today's drive is around four hours – the last 25mi (40km) of road is gravel and can be bumpy, particularly following heavy rain. In the afternoon, it's possible to join an optional coffee tour to learn about the importance of this crop to the socio-economic development of the country. This evening we set off on a night walk in Monteverde Wildlife Refuge. Situated within primary cloud forest, this reserve is committed to the preservation of native flora and fauna. Taking a nocturnal walk allows for a completely new perspective on the forest, which our guides will bring to life for us. Keep your eyes peeled for sloths, who are often active during the night! Accommodation: Montaña Monteverde or Monteverde Country Lodge (or similar)

Monteverde Cloud Forest Reserve is a favourite destination for birdwatchers and wildlife enthusiasts. A walk through the reserve will reveal huge old growth trees covered in moss while the surrounding mist permeates the atmosphere. The geographic, topographic and climatic conditions of the reserve allow a surprising biodiversity to thrive. There are four ecological ‘life zones’ that harbour different ecosystems for hundreds of species – mammals, birds, butterflies, amphibians, reptiles, insects and arachnids. We can also find a variety of mosses, vines, other plants and trees typical of the cloud forest. One of the reserve trails leads to a lookout point right at the top of the continental divide where, on clear days, you see both Costa Rican coasts: the Caribbean and Pacific. These forests are also one of the few remaining habitats of the endangered resplendent quetzal. Following today's activity, we transfer to San José. Accommodation: KC Hotel or Delta by Marriott San José Aurola (or similar)

The trip comes to an end today after breakfast, and it's time to bid Costa Rica and the rest of the group goodbye. If you aren’t quite ready to leave, speak to your sales representative about extending your adventure – relax on the beach, treat yourself to some spa time, or discover more nature. To ensure total relaxation, you can stay for as many nights as you wish in a range of hotels, and we’ll organise airport transfers in either direction for you.

tourName: Panama and Costa Rica slow travel holiday
generalInfo: This 3-week tailormade journey through Panama and Costa Rica offers the perfect combination of history, culture, adventure and nature. Kickstart this incredible trip in the original walled quarter of Panama City, followed by some kayaking near the iconic Panama Canal. Continue to the beautiful Chiriqui Province, swathed in lush forests for coffee experiences and hiking. Travel from Boquete to the exotic Bocas del Toro archipelago, by road and boat, a paradise for snorkellers and divers with its rice marine life. Cross into Costa Rica and head to Cahuita for eco-adventures like tree planting and trekking in the paths of wild cats, then experience the thrill of white-water rafting on the Pacuare River. Round off with hiking, zip-lining, and culinary delights in Arenal, followed by well-deserved relaxation on the Guanacaste coast in the tranquil village of Nosara. If you still have energy, try surfing or snorkelling in the warm Pacific waters. This is Pura Vida at its finest!

dayInfo.description: ARRIVAL IN PANAMA CITY - Meet and greet on arrival, followed by a private transfer to your hotel, the American Trade Hotel, located in the historic part of the city, approximately a 40-minute drive. INTRODUCING PANAMA CITY - One of the most cosmopolitan cities in Central America, Panama's chic capital is a mosaic of colour and culture with a thriving commercial and financial sector. Panama City has built its reputation with a sense of style drawn from five centuries of history. The city's modern skyline is constantly expanding, adding new skyscrapers to tower over the centuries-old Baroque and Spanish Colonial buildings that populate its older quarter, Casco Viejo. The district was designated a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 2003, and its mix of architectural styles make a great introduction to the diverse cultural influences of Panama City. There are many beautiful buildings in the city, including the gothic Iglesia del Carmen cathedral, the presidential palace, and the Church of San Jose. There is also a great collection of museums, offering a fascinating insight into the city’s history. For foodies, there are plenty of good restaurants to choose from, serving Spanish tapas and Italian pastas to local specialties such as ceviche, and vegetable / meat stews. The fish market near the Casco Viejo is the best place to try fresh seafood. Those looking for some nightlife, will find plenty of buzz around Calle Uruguay, which is popular with many of the American and Asian expat residents.

VISIT THE OLD HISTORIC TOWN - Meet your guide this morning and head to the ruins of Old Panama, to trace back the colonial roots of Panama City. Climb the cathedral tower to take in the views of the city and visit the Old Panama City Museum to gain a deeper understanding of this Central American nation's history. Continue to the old neighbourhood of Casco Antiguo, which dates back to the 1600s, navigating your way down the picturesque narrow lanes, visiting landmarks such as the Flat Arch, The Cathedral, Las Bovedas and the French Plaza. Your guide will describe the ill-fated attempt of the French to construct a canal through the isthmus, along with the events that led to the establishment of the capital in its current location. Afterwards, a private transfer will take you back to your accommodation. Afternoon at leisure to explore independently. (Meals - Breakfast)

KAYAKING THE CANAL WATERSHED - Impressive and thrilling, the Panama Canal entrance is the door to one of the most highly travelled waterways in the world. The striking engineering of the Canal is able to handle more than 12,000 ships per year. Throughout the day and night massive ocean cruise liners, container ships, yachts and watercrafts of all kinds arrive from different continents. The Bridge of the Americas is another incredible manmade wonder of this trip. With 1,700 m in length and 120 m high, it was the first permanent structure to link North America and South America across the Panama Canal. Paddling in front of the Panama Canal from stable, efficient sea kayaks accompanied by professional guides, this venture provides a great perspective of Panama's best sites. As the sun drops below the horizon, soothing sunset colours of this coastal paddle are enchanting. Bird watching and relaxing on a remote beach surrounded by tropical forest gives a good sense of nature's handiwork on Pacific coasts. Along the shore, common species include soaring magnificent frigates, gliding brown pelicans, darting flocks of parrots and various wading migratory shore birds. Kayaking the entrance of the Panama Canal at sunset is a memorable half day escapade among the world's most astonishing man made structures and nature's equally amazing environments. (Meals - Breakfast)

FLY TO DAVID AND TRANSFER TO BOQUETE. AFTERNOON COFFEE EXPERIENCE - You will be collected from your hotel this morning and privately transferred to Panama City International Airport for your flight to David. On arrival, a guide will be waiting to welcome you and drive you (approx. 1 hour) to the Finca Lerida Hotel in Boquete, where you will spend the next 3 nights. INTRODUCING BOQUETE - Tucked away amongst rolling green hills, Boquete is a small town which sits in a unique microclimate at 1,000m above sea level. The valley is swathed in lush forest, the fertile volcanic soils bringing life to coffee plantations, fruit orchards and farmland. Not only is it beautiful but Boquete provides opportunities for an array of outdoor adventures, including hiking, climbing, rafting and canopy excursions. It’s a great place to spend a few days - start your mornings with a cup of fresh local coffee and make the most of the activities available here. HALF DAY FINCA LERIDA COFFEE EXPERIENCE - The coffee experience begins in the fields of Boquete where you can catch a glimpse of the three vital factors that influence the coffee’s quality: the soil, the micro-climate, and the particular genetics of the variety. Learn about the history, origin, qualities and secrets of coffee handling. Then, in the second phase of the experience, you'll learn about coffee production all the way from ripe coffee cherry to roasted bean. What makes this experience unique, besides the invaluable ecological reserve that the coffee plantation shares, is its history that was always tied to Toleff Boche Mönniche, the Norwegian engineer that hand-built the main house and built the first gravity-flow coffee plantation in Panama. The experience ends at the tasting table where the long, intense and complex coffee process ends. This is also the place where you find out whether or not a whole year’s work produced a high quality coffee. Taste the different varieties of coffee and learn how to distinguish between different taste notes. Instruction will be given on how to prepare a good cup of coffee by learning about water temperature, time, toasting and grinding, and different brewing methods like Coffee Maker, French Press, Drip brew and Boiling. This experience illustrates the coffee culture in a fun way, helping you to enjoy this legendary aromatic drink. After this experience, a cup of coffee will never taste the same. (Meals - Breakfast)

HALF DAY HIKING IN THE HIGHLANDS - BARU VOLCANO NATIONAL PARK - Hike one of the many scenic trails surrounding Baru Volcano National Park, home to diverse flora and fauna. Boquete and its surrounding areas offer excellent hiking options for all ages and abilities. Hike through cloud forests and lush vegetation, visit waterfalls and admire the surrounding area while looking out for animals such as howler monkeys, sloths, deer, peccaries and hundreds of species of birds. (Meals - Breakfast)

ZIP-LINING IN BOQUETE (SMALL GROUP) - Glide on ziplines through the canopy of century-old cloud forests, high above the pristine rivers and waterfalls that make up the incredible collection of natural landscapes bordering the National Park La Amistad and the famous Baru Volcano. You will glide through trees to encounter canopy flora and wildlife. After the safety orientation, you will be directed to the take-off platform from which you begin a controlled flight to the following platforms. A harness, an ultra-resistant steel cable, and gravity are the only elements necessary to quickly propel you, the fearless rider, in this incredible adrenaline rush. (Meals - Breakfast)

ROAD AND BOAT TRANSFER TO BOCAS DEL TORO - Private transfer approx. 4 hours from Boquete to Puerto Almirante. Board the 45-min boat transfer to Tranquilo Bay on Isla Bastimentos. This wild island, which is part of the Bocas del Toro archipelago on Panama’s Caribbean coast, is home to protected coral reefs, palm-fringed beaches and wildlife-rich mangrove forests. Just a short journey from Bocas del Toro's main town, Isla Bastimentos is wild, beautiful and undoubtedly one of the highlights of the archipelago. Around the coast you'll encounter palm-fringed beaches where sea turtles nest, mangrove forests full of wildlife and protected coral reefs which provide snorkelling and diving opportunities. This island is also home to the indigenous Ngöbe-Buglé tribe. Introducing Bocas del Toro - An archipelago off the northwest coast of Panama, Bocas del Toro comprises part of Panama’s mainland, along with a chain of seven islands in the Caribbean Sea; the main three being Isla Colon, the small island of Isla Carnero and Isla Bastimentos, which is one of the largest islands in Panama. Bocas Town is the regional capital, and where you will find shops, restaurants, and nightlife. The islands are popular with adventure lovers, offering a plethora of water sports such as snorkelling, scuba diving, surfing, and sailing. It’s also a magnet for hikers with plenty of trails bypassing secluded beaches, small towns, and rich hearty jungles. (Meals - Breakfast)

DAYS AT LEISURE IN BOCAS DEL TORO - Spend the next few days making the most of the on-site activities included in your stay. Wander nature trails, try your hand at fishing, enjoy swimming, snorkelling, sea and mangrove kayaking or stand-up paddle-boarding or climb up to the top of the canopy observation tower to watch the resident birdlife. A guided excursion within the archipelago is included each day, a few examples being: Zapatilla Keys beach outing, Punta Vieja beach outing, chocolate farm & garden tour, Isla Popa bird & wildlife tour, bat cave kayaking & hike outing, snorkelling from a boat at Coral Heads, etc. (Meals - Breakfast)

OVERLAND TRANSFER ACROSS THE BORDER TO CAHUITA, COSTA RICA - Private transfer to Bocas Dock for the boat transfer to Almirante port (approx. 30-40 mins). From there, a driver will take you by road, approx. one hour, to the Sixaola border with Costa Rica where you'll complete the Costa Rica and Panama border formalities. Once in Costa Rica (note there is a 1 hour time difference), a driver will be waiting to meet you at the border and drive you to Salon Delia (approx. 90 minutes by road). At Salon Delia, you'll meet a representative from Selva Bananito who will transfer you the remaining distance to the lodge (around 45 mins). Please note that the transfer operates on a private basis, except for the ferry, and the last road journey from Salon Delia to Selva Bananito which will be shared with other guests. INTRODUCING PUERTO VIEJO AND THE CARIBBEAN COASTLINE - Costa Rica's South Caribbean region remains firmly off the beaten path, yet those who do venture are quickly charmed by the laidback Afro-Caribbean culture which also plays a key roll in influencing the local cuisine. Limon is the gateway city, around 4 hours from San Jose and to the south is Cahuita National Park, the bohemian village of Puerto Viejo, and Gandoca – Manzanillo. Historically, Spanish conquerors arrived in Limon around 1500-1502 A.D and prior to this, the area was inhabited by the Bribri and Cabecar indigenous communities - descendants of these communities are still resident in the region. During this era, locals began to grow cacao as a primary activity. Then, the railroad construction started, which allowed banana production to strengthen the local economy. Port activity and the construction of Victorian style houses finally established the city of Limon as a key industrial centre in the region. Puerto Viejo is located about 1 hour south from Limon and 40 minutes from Cahuita. The town and the surrounding area is best explored on foot or by bike. You'll encounter friendly locals and a range of food shacks, cafes and little independent shops. (Meals - Breakfast, Dinner)

ACTIVITIES / VOLUNTEERING AT SELVA BANANITO - During your stay, a bird watching tour plus one other activity is included per person. Other included activities to choose from include: - Guided walks through the lush rainforest - Introductory Tree Climbing - Horseback riding through the farm - Tree planting - Take a gyrocopter flight for a breath-taking aerial perspective (additional cost). There is also the option to partake in some volunteering activities (8 hours included split over two days), where you can get hands on, and be a part of the Ecolodge's incredible conservation efforts, with a number of volunteer projects including: - Reforestation - Trail Work - Equestrian care - Rainforest Patrols - Monitoring of trap cameras surveillance - Anti poaching campaigns - Helping with the preparation and maintenance of guest rooms. For day 2 of your stay - An overnight jungle stay is included, following in the footprints of wild cats. This involves monitoring the camera traps, spending the night on a jungle platform and cooking on an open fire. The following morning, the hike takes you past the waterfall which can be rappelled. (Meals - Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner)

TRANSFER AND WHITE-WATER RAFTING TO PACUARE - Shared transfer this morning to Salon Delia, where your private driver will be waiting to meet you for the drive to the Pacuare River put-in; a drive of approx. 2 hours, 45 mins. Pacuare River is known as one of the five best rivers in the world for rafting. Adrenaline takes centre stage as you run class II and III rapids while taking in the lush tropical rainforest with all its flora and fauna. Stops will be made at several strategic spots for short hikes to the streams that line the descent. The rafting takes around 75 - 90 minutes. When you reach the lodge, a delicious picnic style lunch will be served by the River. INTRODUCING PACUARE - Pacuare is home to waterfalls, emerald green cliffs, pristine rainforest, and blue morpho butterflies. Besides its obvious natural beauty, its popular with adventure and adrenaline seekers, for one can experience sheer exhilaration battling surging waters down miles of raging rapids on the Pacuare River - known as one of the world's top white-water rivers. Visit the indigenous Cabecar Indians that reside in the nearby Talamanca Mountains for an authentic cultural experience. (Meals - Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner)

ACTIVITIES AT PACUARE - AVE SOL SANCTUARY - A 40-minute interpretive nature walk is included today on a small group basis. Other additional activities (extra cost applies - these must be pre booked in advance): - Guided walk to see the local Cabecar ethnic community - learn about forest lore and techniques and let a few arrows fly with a traditionally made bow. - Become a biologist for the day on a guided trail which range from easy through to challenging. Discover wildlife and their tracks, endemic plant species, rock pools, and creeks and waterfalls. - Embark on some more adrenalin-fuelled rafting down the Pacuare River - Horseback Riding. Otherwise, relax in a hammock and enjoy the rainforest sounds. Lunch is served at the lodge or picnic-style if you’re hiking. (Meals - Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner)

RAFTING OUT FROM PACUARE AND TRANSFER TO ARENAL After breakfast, raft down Class 3 & 4 rapids through the Pacuare Gorge and lower Pacuare. This can take around 75-90 minutes though this varies on the season and the number of breaks the group takes along the way, as there are opportunities for swimming in the canyon. A picnic lunch is included along the river. Finish rafting at the take-out point and transfer to a place where you can shower and change clothes. Your driver will be waiting to meet you to privately transfer you on to your hotel in Arenal, a drive of around 2.5 hours. Your driver will be waiting to meet you to privately transfer you on to your hotel (around 2.5 hours) - Arenal Glamping, where you can experience the rainforest from the comfort of your tent. INTRODUCING ARENAL VOLCANO NATIONAL PARK - Arenal is a spectacular region, named for the huge Arenal volcano which dominates the skyline on a clear day. The area is popular among adventurous travellers as the volcanoes and rainforests provide a range of exhilarating activities, from ziplining to trekking. Outside of the main tourist area lie acres of rolling countryside. (Meals - Breakfast, Lunch)

HIKE THE EL SILENCIO VOLCANO TRAIL WITH A CANOPY ZIPLINING ADVENTURE - Head out of La Fortuna with your private guide to a set of quieter and less touristy walking trails. The Mirador El Silencio loop will take you through mature tertiary rainforest, and across lava fields from a recent volcanic explosion (1968). The knowledgeable guides will present the science of the volcano and the lava. Enjoy spectacular views of the Arenal Volcano as you hike, and an abundance of wildlife from howler monkeys swinging through the trees to leaf cutter ants crossing the trail. There are also many bird species including parrots and toucans. After your gentle walk, tuck into a delicious picnic lunch. All fuelled up, get ready for some adventure with the canopy zip-lining experience, which operates on a small group basis. This thrilling activity features 11 cables and 13 platforms; nine of which are on trees, where you can enjoy direct contact with the surrounding nature. At the end, there is a Tarzan Swing for an additional shot of adrenaline. Jump from a platform (at a height of almost 40 meters) and swing surrounded by forest. (Meals - Breakfast, Picnic Lunch)

CHOCOLATE MAKING WORKSHOP AND CACAO IMMERSION - Pay a visit to Two Little Monkeys chocolate workshop, to learn the ropes of artisanal chocolate making. Watch and sample as the chocolatier takes you through every step of the chocolate making process, from grinding the cacao to pouring moulds and topping the finished product with coconut, sea salt and chilli. Taste the raw cacao before you start and once the chocolate is complete you’ll have plenty of chances to savour the delicious organic chocolates you have created. (This service is on a private basis.) Later this afternoon, head to Doña Mara’s kitchen for a private cooking experience. Learn how to prepare delicious tortillas by hand, from grinding the corn to hand patting the tortillas to toasting them on her wood-fired stove. You will also learn how to prepare the famous ‘picadillos’ (vegetable and meat hash), along with ‘tortas de yuca’ (cassava), among other traditional plates. Enjoy the fruits of your labour with a delicious feast on Dona Mara’s open-air terrace. Afterwards, you will be taken back to your hotel, and the rest of the afternoon is at leisure to relax. (This service is on a private basis.) (Meals - Breakfast, Lunch)

PRIVATE TRANSFER TO NOSARA - After breakfast, a private transfer will take you to Nosara. The drive will take around 5.5 hours. Check in to your Panorama Suite at Lagarta Lodge, your home for the next 4 nights. INTRODUCING NOSARA - Nosara is located on the Nicoya Peninsula of the Guanacaste coast. Overlooking the Pacific, just outside the town of Nosara, this secluded small hotel is a little piece of paradise, away from the tourist trail. The Rio Nosara borders the hotel-owned nature reserve Reserva biológica that covers nearly ninety acres. Guests may join a guided tour or have free access to the well-marked trails. Mornings are particularly good for spotting birdlife, howler monkeys, anteaters, coatis, raccoons, iguanas, butterflies and insects. The reserve’s biodiversity is a combination of subtropical dry forests and mangrove thickets. Walking trails take roughly 2 hours or you can visit by electric boat or a kayak activity on the Rio Nosara (highly recommended). (Meals - Breakfast)

SURF LESSON IN NOSARA - Enjoy a 2 hour surf lesson with a local specialist instructor in one of the top surfing destinations in the world. Nosara has waves for all levels of surfers so it does not matter if you are beginner or experienced. The experienced surf instructors are locals who know the area intimately and the beach, wave and tide conditions. The lesson operates on a private basis, and includes transportation, specialist certified instructor, equipment and snacks. (Meals - Breakfast)

SNORKELLING IN SAN JUANILLO - San Juanillo Beach, with its stunning scenery and clear, warm waters, is one of the best snorkelling destinations in this area. Here, you can embark on an adventure to explore the vibrant marine wildlife and later savour some tropical snacks in this picturesque location. Duration: 4 hours. What to bring: sunblock, swim wear, towel, comfortable clothing, hat or cap, sunglasses, sandals or shoes that can get wet, insect repellent and camera. (This service is on a private basis.) Afternoon at leisure to explore independently. (Meals - Breakfast)

DAY AT LEISURE IN NOSARA - The day is at leisure in Nosara to relax and unwind at your hotel. If you'd like to explore the local area and surroundings, there are plenty of tours/activities which can be pre-booked on a private or small group basis (additional cost): - Complimentary access to the hotel-owned nature reserve Reserva Biológica - Mangrove Boat Tour - Glide along Rio Nosara and Rio Montaña in search of native birds and crocodiles (2 hours) - Surfing at Playa Guiones - group or private lessons - Hiking to Nosara Biological Reserve or along spectacularly sandy beaches - Birdwatching Tour in the Nosara and Ostional Biological Reserves (2 hours) - Night Walk (2 hours) - Guided Bike Ride (2 hours) - Turtle Tour - operates year round, but is subject to mother nature as to whether the turtles are nesting or hatching. This is usually confirmed the day before, therefore best booked locally. (Meals - Breakfast)
TRANSFER FROM NOSARA TO LIBERIA INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT - Depart Nosara on a 3 hour approx. private transfer to the airport in Liberia for your departure flight. (Meals - Breakfast)

tourName: Premium Costa Rica small group tour
generalInfo: Embark on thrilling adventure through Costa Rica’s rainforests, volcanoes and beaches, where wildlife waits around every corner. This nine-day Premium journey will see you uncover the local secrets of San Jose, explore the wild wetlands of Cano Negro, witness the biodiversity of Monteverde and search for sloths in Manuel Antonio. A local leader will take you beneath Costa Rica’s lush surface and show you the country at its very best. Costa Rica’s natural wonders have etched it a place on the map, but you’ll soon discover its cherished traditions and welcoming people are every bit as endearing.

dayInfo.title: San Jose.
dayInfo.description: Bienvenidos! Welcome to Costa Rica. Your adventure begins in San Jose, where you’ll be met at the airport by a local representative and transferred to your hotel. Here, you’ll meet your local leader and small group for a welcome meeting at 6 pm. If you arrive early, Costa Rican coffee is some of the best in the world, so maybe set out to sample some of the local brew. After your meeting, head out with your leader and fellow travellers to dine like a local in the heart of San Jose. Your leader will share the history of the area and its famous residents as you taste local specialties.

dayInfo.title: La Fortuna.
dayInfo.description: Depart San Jose and drive to La Fortuna, known for its mellow atmosphere, bubbling hot springs and the mighty Arenal volcano. When you arrive, visit the Arenal Vida Campesina – a project focused on promoting sustainable agricultural practices while preserving customs and traditions passed down from generation to generation. Tour the property, learn about the process of sugarcane milling then sit down for a farm-fresh lunch. After lunch, visit the Arenal 1968 trails for a gentle walk to the Las Coladas lava field. Along the way, your leader will share the history of the volcano as you look out for howler monkeys, deer and parrots. In the afternoon, check into your hotel which has views of the Arenal Volcano and rooms with a terrace surrounded by tropical gardens filled with birds and butterflies. Spend some time poolside, listening to the songs of birds, then join your group for dinner at a local restaurant.

dayInfo.title: La Fortuna.
dayInfo.description: Today will be spent exploring the diverse wildlife of the Cano Negro Wetlands with a naturalist guide. Start with a drive through fields of yucca, plantain and papaya before boarding a comfortable raft to explore the Frio River. Travelling this way allows you get up close and personal with this region’s wildlife without having to undertake a strenuous hike. If you’re lucky, you might spot monkeys, iguanas, caimans, bats and common basilisks, also known as Jesus Christ lizards for their ability to walk on water. Your expert guide will be on hand to tell you where to look and share information on the intriguing creatures you discover today. Have lunch at a local restaurant before returning to La Fortuna for a free evening. Maybe visit one of the town’s hot springs for a swim beneath the stars.

dayInfo.title: Monteverde.
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, depart La Fortuna and begin the journey to Monteverde. Drive around Lake Arenal and watch dramatic views of the Arenal volcano unfold in front of you. Your leader will be on hand to point out interesting wildlife along the way. Arrive in Monteverde in the early afternoon. Known for its spectacular cloud forests and rich biodiversity, Monteverde is heaven for nature lovers. This afternoon take tour of the Monteverde Cloud Forest Reserve, host to more than 100 different species of mammals and 400 species of birds. Your leader will share information on the fascinating biodiversity of the region and lend their expert eye to spotting wonderful wildlife. Look out for the resplendent quetzal and listen for the sounds of howler monkeys and the unmistakeable call of the three-wattled bellbird. With nearly 500 unique species of orchids, the reserve holds the world’s highest diversity of the flower.

dayInfo.title: Monteverde.
dayInfo.description: After a relaxing morning the day is yours to enjoy however you wish. You may like to explore the town, or view the cloud forest from overhead on a zipline. Speak to your leader about arranging any optional activities that you’d like. Gather again in the evening for a rainforest night walk with our Foundation partner, The Monteverde Conservation League, to explore the Children's Eternal Rain Forest. This private reserve was founded in 1986 through fundraising efforts by children worldwide and is home to an incredible diversity of flora and fauna. Join up with a naturalist guide who’ll lead you through the forest and educate you on everything from the sounds to the species while also helping you spot the various frogs, insects and night birds among the trees.

dayInfo.title: Manuel Antonio.
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, depart for Manuel Antonio – home to a wildlife-rich national park and a string of the country’s best beaches. When you arrive, check into your Feature Stay – a beautiful resort situated above the ocean and Manuel Antonio National Park. After a dip in one of the resort pools or a walk along the beach, you might like to join your group for dinner at one of the hotel restaurants.

dayInfo.title: Manuel Antonio.
dayInfo.description: This morning you’ll set off into Manuel Antonio National Park with an expert naturalist guide by your side. Look out for two and three toed sloths, white faced monkeys, anteaters and iguanas. The park offers criss-crossing walking trails and a beach – just keep an eye out for the raccoons! The afternoon is free. Manuel Antonio has plenty for those seeking an adrenaline rush – speak to your leader about arranging ziplining, snorkelling or kayaking. On the other end of the spectrum, there are few better places to sit back, crack open a coconut and watch the waves lap the shore. Be sure to look up, as sloths and monkeys are known to frequent the trees that line the beach.

dayInfo.title: San Jose.
dayInfo.description: Depart Manuel Antonio to head back to San Jose. When you arrive, have some lunch, then go on a city tour with your leader of downtown San Jose. Explore the mixture of historic and contemporary with stops at the local museums, government buildings, theatres, parks and markets. Visit the central market for a traditional Costa Rican cajeta (ice cream), an essential part of family lunch or dinner. There are lots of varieties to choose from, from coconut, peanut and macadamia and tapa de dulce (a form of cooked sugar cane). Tonight, you’ll have a farewell dinner with your group so raise a glass and cheers to an excellent adventure!

dayInfo.title: San Jose.
dayInfo.description: Your adventure comes to an end after breakfast this morning. If you would like to stay in San Jose, just speak to your booking agent to arrange additional accommodation ahead of time.

tourName: Rare wildlife holiday, Costa Rica
generalInfo: We’ve focussed this particular trip on a spectacular area of Costa Rica that takes you ‘off the beaten track’ yet captures some of the best wildlife areas and experiences to be had in Central America. Starting in Alujuela Province, just beyond the city limits, you’ll instantly be immersed into a rural Costa Rican landscape where escaping into the cloud forests to marvel at the vast myriad of flora and fauna is a must. The following days are spent at the beautiful Cano Negro Wildlife Reserve on the border with Nicaragua, featuring waterways, dense jungle and shallow wetlands. Jaguars are frequently spotted along with capuchin monkeys, alligators, black river turtles and white-tailed deer. Tenoria national park sits just to the North of the better-known Arenal, yet with the turquoise blue waters of Rio Celeste and lush, jungle-clad Tenoria, it’s a standout destination in its own right. Nosara sits on the western fringes of Guanacaste and is one of the most beautifully remote beaches in the country- as perfect for surfing as it is for turtles and marine life.

dayInfo.description: Welcome to Costa Rica – San Ramon Once you arrive, you'll quickly notice that Costa Rica culture abounds in this small city and that the pace of life is slow, relaxed, and focused on forging strong community ties. San Ramon Located in the Alajuela Province in Costa Rica, the laid-back colonial city of San Ramon has been dubbed the ‘City of Presidents and Poets’. It has played an important role in Costa Rica’s history as it has been home to many local literary heroes and political leaders including one of Costa Rica’s most influential leaders, Jose Figueres Ferrer. This small city is surrounded by lush rainforest as well as coffee and sugar cane fields. Visitors can explore the many historical sights dotted around the city, experience a rainforest canopy tour just beyond the city limits, and enjoy an array of restaurants, cafes, and bars serving up local delights. Don’t miss the opportunity to hike through the beautiful tropical forests and spot a variety of animals such as monkeys, deer, and sloths as well as abundant birdlife. Private Transfer from Juan Santamaria International Airport [SJO] to Villa Blanca Cloud Forest Hotel & Nature Reserve.

Cano Negro Wildlife Refuge A stunning natural refuge, Caño Negro is considered by many to be the third most important wetland in the world. A must visit place when in Costa Rica, this sanctuary was named the ‘Wetland of International Importance’ in 1991, and is one of the most significant humid zones in the country. Private Transfer from Villa Blanca Cloud Forest Hotel & Nature Reserve to Natural Lodge Cano Negro Cano Negro Wildlife Refuge Situated near the Nicaraguan border within northern Costa Rica, the remote Cano Negro Wildlife Refuge forms part of the Arenal Huetar Norte Conservation Area. It is a thrilling off-the-beaten-track destination known for its lush landscapes featuring countless waterways, dense jungles and shallow wetlands. A wondrous playground for nature lovers and adventure seekers alike, activities such as boating, rafting, zip-lining, fishing, kayaking, horse riding and rappelling down waterfalls are in abundance. Commonly spotted wildlife includes jaguar, capuchin monkey, bull shark, alligator, black river turtle, white ibis and white-tailed deer. It is well worth venturing off the well-trodden tourist path to visit this fantastic refuge and its surrounding scenic landscapes.

Cano Negro Wildlife Refuge There are 160 species of mammals, of which 90 are bats and 70 are terrestrial mammals. The avifauna (with species considered rare or endemic) is one of the most diverse and important groups in the area. It is made up of 307 species, of which 206 are resident and 101 are migratory. Another important group is the fish, since the water system of this wetland favors their abundance. Cano Nergo Wildlife Safari boat tour on Rio Frio: Wildlife Safari boat tour on Rio Frio takes place at the Caño Negro Wildlife Refuge, located near the border between Costa Rica and Nicaragua and is one of the most important wetlands of the country. Travel along the river in search of monkeys, herons, sloths, caiman, turtles, and hundreds of other species of flora and fauna that inhabit the area around the Caño Negro Wildlife Refuge.

Bijagua Tenorio has everything you could want in a tropical forest natural area and every time we visit we find something new to love. Hiking to the sky blue Celeste waterfall is a highlight, but the hanging bridges in the rainforest and trail to Lago Danta through the cloud forest from the Heliconias entrance are equally amazing. Transfer from Natural Lodge Cano Negro to Casitas Tenorio Tree Chocolate Tour Welcome to the sweetest experience of your life! Located in the foothills of the Tenorio Volcano, our farm is the ultimate destination for cocoa and cuisine lovers. We offer exclusive tours of our chocolate factory, located on site. You will see (and taste!) every step of the chocolate making process from the trees to the finished chocolate bars. You will also be able to taste our delicious and exclusive Tsuru or Yok Chocolate, a 100% handmade chocolate. You will undoubtedly enjoy a unique experience! Tenorio Volcano National Park Set in the north of Costa Rica, Tenorio Volcano National Park is home to a magnificent volcano from which it received its name. The park is covered in natural tropical forests and decorated with rivers and waterfalls. One of the many highlights here is a hike to the magnificent Celeste Waterfall, known for its stunning blue waters. Visitors can also enjoy walking over the many suspension bridges in the rainforest, visiting the Blue Lagoon, and climbing through the cloud forest along the Crater Trail to the top of the volcano to view the steaming Lago Dante. Hikers are likely to spot a variety of wildlife, possibly even the shy tapir and puma. The park also provides the opportunity to bathe in wonderful natural hot springs.
Bijagua Free day at leisure.

Bijagua Located in northern Costa Rica, the Tenorio Volcano National Park is one of the country's youngest parks. Taking its name from the Tenorio Volcano, this national park boasts stunning river views and plenty of opportunities for wildlife adventures. The park was created in 1995 to protect the Tenorio Volcano, which is still active today. The park features four different life zones as well as the beautiful aqua-hued Rio Celeste. Tenorio Volcano National Park Set in the north of Costa Rica, Tenorio Volcano National Park is home to a magnificent volcano from which it received its name. The park is covered in natural tropical forests and decorated with rivers and waterfalls. One of the many highlights here is a hike to the magnificent Celeste Waterfall, known for its stunning blue waters. Visitors can also enjoy walking over the many suspension bridges in the rainforest, visiting the Blue Lagoon, and climbing through the cloud forest along the Crater Trail to the top of the volcano to view the steaming Lago Dante. Hikers are likely to spot a variety of wildlife, possibly even the shy tapir and puma. The park also provides the opportunity to bathe in wonderful natural hot springs.

Nosara Looking for a little beach town surrounded by mangroves, forests and sandy long stretches of beach? You found it! Nosara has it all and more, beautiful hotels, a convenient downtown with variety of restaurants and juice bars, artsy shops and …oh! Wonderful waves for surfing, a refreshing ocean to go swimming and amazing sunsets. Located in Guanacaste, in the northern part of the country, it offers a wide variety of activities for your enjoyment, like visiting the surrounding villas and farms, absorb some of the local culture and learn salsa dancing or experience soothing yoga sessions immersed in serene, amazing landscapes. Nosara Resting on the outer western edge of Costa Rica’s Nicoya Peninsula, between the popular beach towns of Playa Samara and Playa Tamarindo, the surfer’s town Nosara is known for its wildlife, watersports opportunities, and long-standing yoga culture. A long stretch of white-sand beaches fringed by palm trees and verdant jungle make Nosara a prime destination for holidaymakers, and it is one of the only coastal towns with minimal development along the beachfront. Rated as one of the top twenty surfing destinations by National Geographic, the town attracts surfers from all over the world to enjoy its clean, plentiful waves. Animal lovers, hikers, and nature photographers should make sure to visit the Nosara Biological Reserve, where they'll be able to spot monkeys, turtles, and numerous other species.
Nosara Free day at leisure.

Nosara See the sights from the deck of your own private sailing tour or make new friends in a group tour. It’s a unique and personal Costa Rican cruise that regular tourist tour boats can't match. Boat River Tour A boat river tour through Costa Rica is a fantastic way to explore the country's lush natural beauty and diverse wildlife. Costa Rica is home to several rivers that wind their way through dense rainforests, rugged mountains, and rolling hills, providing a unique and unforgettable way to experience the country's stunning landscapes.

Nosara The Ostional National Wildlife Refuge was officially created in 1984 but was declared a protected area in 1982. The refuge was initially construed as being 200 m wide from Punta India to the mouth of Rio Nosara. This area was increased to include the 200 m strip to Punta Guiones in 1985. Finally, in 1992, with the institution of the new "Wildlife Law", came the final definition of the refuge and in 1993 the amplification to the three-mile maritime limit as it is today. After an undetermined waiting time, close to the last quarter of the moon cycle, the "arribada" will begin. At first, few hundred turtles will come out on the beach, followed by a steady stream of animals for the next three to seven days. This is the only place in the world where it is legal to harvest turtle eggs. This practice is designed prevent poaching and to help the local community.

San Jose Back to the city! Today you get to fly back to San Jose and relax in your hotel or go outside and check out the city. San Jose San Jose, affectionately known to its residents as 'Chepe', lies in the heart of Costa Rica and is home to almost two-thirds of the country’s population. With few buildings over 100 years old, the mountainous capital is relatively modern compared to its Latin American counterparts, but still has a significant amount of culture, art and history for visitors to discover. With a number of theatres full of Costa Rican culture, museums that include the largest collection of American jade in the world, and streets full of bright murals and painted buses, San Jose is an eclectic city waiting to be experienced.

tourName: Tailor made Costa Rica wildlife holiday
