A cool breeze pierces the warm air. You continue the journey to Monteverde and find comfort in the mountainous panorama 4,200 feet above the nearby valleys. The cloud forest encompasses 26,000 acres of protected landscape, from decadent forests to verdant pastures.

dayInfo.title: Monteverde - Experiencing the Sky
dayInfo.description: Sweeping clouds rise up the foothills of the mountains and blanket the morning trees and sky. This daily ritual gives the area its captivating name. In the cool early daylight you can hear a gentle twittering that rises and falls. The call comes from the elusive quetzal. The bird can grow up to 13 inches long. Effervescent males have plumage of green with golden-fringed wings. Their tail feather dangles behind them and carries like a streamer when they fly. After breakfast, the day is yours to enjoy the cloud forest and its hidden splendor. Trek through the treetops or stroll along the walkways amidst the atmospheric mist. For an unforgettable romantic experience you can wander through the forest on horseback. The lush greenery emanates fern and canopies drape over the rolling hills. Your horse trots behind your guide. In the trees you spot purple petals sprouting from blossoming orchids. The birdcalls continue throughout the day and the clouds dissipate. You roam over streams and listen to the water trickle past. Rainbows decorate the undulating hillsides. The beauty of Costa Rica isn’t just in the landscape but is also within the charming moments that you share with the one you love.

dayInfo.title: Manuel Antonio - Trees Guiding to the Beach
dayInfo.description: Today your transfer will meet you at your preferred time to whisk you off to the picturesque landscape of Manuel Antonio National Park. The clouds routinely drift over and away from the forest. The birdcalls and rambunctious wildlife settle down in the day’s rising warmth. When you are ready, your private transfer takes you from Monteverde and over the continental divide, the mountainous area that defines which waterways lead to the Pacific or Atlantic Oceans. Arrive at your hotel which offers you the seclusion of the rainforest with views of the pristine cerulean Pacific. In the afternoon you will have a guided tour of Manuel Antonio National Park, a jewel in a country of treasures. Step along the opulent white sand beach and find iguanas basking in the sunlight and lazing on a boulder. They can grow up to six feet long and blend easily into their surroundings. The water peels back from the sand. The gentle sound becomes the loving soundtrack of the afternoon.

dayInfo.title: Manuel Antonio - Watching the Wading Water
dayInfo.description: The sounds of the lapping tide fill the morning. The delicate rhythm is accompanied by the rich and indulgent flavors of fresh coffee. The day is once again yours to experience the encompassing majesty of Costa Rica at your leisure. Sail through the trees on a zip line tour or cruise to nearby Tortuga Island on a catamaran. Witness nature’s aquatic splendor on a dolphin and whale watching tour. When the sails are cast you hear them catch the wind and flutter. The cool breeze is comfortable in the warm sun. Whales migrate over 5,000 miles each year. They grow up to 52 feet long and can sing a unique song that lasts up to 20 minutes. The sea turns from a crystal cerulean to deep blue. The water is calm and you can hear the whales spouting water before you see them. Common dolphins also cruise through the water. They can grow over eight feet long and play alongside boats. You hold your partner’s hand and point into the short distance. A tail flaps and waves. In the quiet you can hear your heart beat. Then the water breaks open and a large humpback whale leaps, almost perpendicular to the sea, before splashing back down.

dayInfo.title: San Jose - A Wandering Day
dayInfo.description: Today your private transfer will depart from Manuel Antonio at your preferred time. The morning wild calls sweep across the trees and over the ocean. You can spend the day lounging on the beach or wandering through the trees. The water peels back from the shore and the palms sway in the calm breeze. You see white-faced capuchin monkeys in the upper-reaches of the canopy. Their black and white fur stands out against the lush greenery. When you are ready your private transfer meets you at the airport and takes you to San Jose. The lively streets continue to thrive. The National Theater displays its elegant neoclassical façade. The fountain casts water into the air and falls in circular beaded curtains. Settle into the charming gardens of your accommodation and relish in the secluded luxuries in the midst of the whirling city.

dayInfo.title: Punta Islita - A Remote Luxury
dayInfo.description: The morning sky pours over the city and brings the streets to life. After breakfast you make your way to the airport for your domestic flight to the stunning beachside community of Punta Islita. Your guide escorts you to the extravagantly beautiful property located on a remote beach. The 300-acre property is set over the hilltops and watches out over the ocean. The water is pristine and the local community is filled with artistic ambiance. Local fishermen venture back from the ocean. Nets abound in their small, colorfully painted boats as they make their way home for the day. The infinity pool is refreshing and offers a panorama of the beachside, surrounded by the endless tropical hillsides. The sounds of the howler monkeys fill the air in the setting sun.

dayInfo.title: Punta Islita - Free and Private Shores
dayInfo.description: The charm of Punta Islita is unparalleled. You are swept away by the beauty of the opulent water and the tranquility that surrounds the entire small cove. After breakfast the day is yours to indulge in the various wonders around you. Spend time together relaxing in the tropical sun or enjoying the warm water of your own jacuzzi. The beauty and wonder of the landscape is all-encompassing. Discover the gorgeous life beneath the surf on a snorkel tour around the cove. Nearby Carrillo is a known for its delightful, vivacious snorkeling. Your boat takes you off of the coast and you jump into the crystal clear ocean ready to witness its unique wonderland. Boulders drop into the water and the greenery fades away. You find patches of glowing schools of fish. The sunlight is able to shine up to 50 feet below the glassy surface. Starfish cling to the rocks and wave with the current. Yellow fish are lustrous and freckled hawkfish are pastel. You could eternally search the seas for stunning life.

dayInfo.title: Punta Islita - Find Glorious Flight
dayInfo.description: The current brings the water back and forth against the shimmering sandy beach. The trees are filled with morning calls. Find opportunity in the day to do as much or as little as you please. Treasure your partner’s company on a sailing tour around the Pacific or just stroll through the meandering pathways of the rainforest. Costa Rica is known for its tremendous jungle and exceptional zip lining adventures. For a wonderful exploration of the greenery you can soar through the trees and over the canyon on a series of crisscrossing aerial wires. Sharing the journey brings you closer together as you both learn what it’s like to feel the high wind rushing past your cheeks. Scarlet macaws are known for their rainbow plumage and long, trailing tail feathers. You can hear their loud and distinct call in the trees. You rush past them in a blur of canopy and extended wings, scarlet wings. You can hear the trundling sounds of Montezuma Waterfall along the hillsides. The terraced pools allow you to witness the variety and veracity of the falls from different levels, and even swing 15 feet above the water on a rope swing.

dayInfo.title: Punta Islita - The Starry Night
dayInfo.description: Relax on the beach and in the spas on a day meant to treat you and your partner to the luxuries of Punta Islita. Find the tranquil sounds of the ocean combined with the soothing aromas of coconut and palm. Breathe deeply and calmly beside your loved one as you indulge in a couple’s massage. The world melts away during your hour-long treatment. The birdcalls and rustling leaves disappear, the ocean current fades, and for a while it is just you and your partner embracing rejuvenating aromatics. In the evening the starlight pours over the resort. A candlelit dinner awaits you on a private stretch of beach. The tide rolls close to your feet. The stars twinkle in the night sky. A unique three-course meal is set before you and the scent of fresh and local ingredients add to the pleasures of Costa Rica.

dayInfo.title: San Jose - Watching the Beachside Go
dayInfo.description: The morning light brushes the hillside. Tropical fruits once again decorate the breakfast table and you can’t help but remember last night’s dreamlike dinner. The bold, sweet citrus of the fresh pineapple brings you back to the morning. After breakfast, your private transfer will take you to the airport for your return flight to San Jose. The afternoon is at your leisure to explore the capital city at your own pace. Barrio Amon is a neighborhood once home to 19th and 20th-century coffee barons. The historic colonial mansions continue to decorate the streets with tropical colors and Art Deco décor.

dayInfo.title: San Jose - The Sweetness of a Getaway
dayInfo.description: The lush gardens of your hotel remind you of the exuberant tropical landscapes you have explored over the past two weeks. You have soared through the canopy and discovered the vibrant hues beneath the waves. Wildlife clamored in the trees and glowed in the skyline. Your final breakfast in Costa Rica comes with the familiar and comforting flavors you have become accustomed to, from star fruit to papaya. After your meal your private transfer escorts you to the airport for your flight home. The rainforest and oceans brimmed with the romance that you will now carry home with you.

tourName: Costa Rica Luxury Vacation Tour for Families
placesVisited: San Jose, Manuel Antonio National Park, Arenal Volcano, Monteverde Cloud Forest Reserve
generalInfo: The jovial spirit of Costa Rica will spread across your vacation and your family’s experiences. Your children will smile with endless delight and you will find an adventure that everyone can enjoy. On this 9-day exploration you will discover the fascinating wildlife and wonderful landscape. Active volcano summits create the skyline. Treetops house elegant birdlife and rambunctious monkeys. Clouds creep through the rainforest and create a unique ecosystem high atop the mountainside. When you traverse the wonders of Costa Rica you find adventure, elegance, luxury, culture, wildlife, and all the elements that bring inspiration to children and parents alike.

dayInfo.title: San Jose - The Culture of Happiness
dayInfo.description: Costa Rica is one of the happiest countries in the world. Locals wander through shopping arcades of San Jose and look at the elegant window displays. The cosmopolitan atmosphere reflects the collection of cultures from around the country, and the depth of history on the streets is displayed in refurbished colonial mansions. Mountains encircle the valley floor and bring a unique skyline to the city. You arrive in San Jose and are met by a private transfer at the airport. Your charming hotel offers you a view of the mountainside and a quiet garden separate from the bustling streets of the city. Almost half of Costa Rica’s population calls San Jose their home. The Central Market was built in the 1880s and continues to be a lively center for the city’s shopping. Find over 200 stalls, restaurants, and shops lining the expansive city block that fills the single pavilion. The zesty citrus of fresh ceviche emanates from the restaurants and fruit stands display gigantic watermelons. Street acts perform exuberant musicals in the Plaza de la Cultura and the wonderful smiles of the locals continue through the evening.

dayInfo.title: Manuel Antonio - Together with Wonder
dayInfo.description: San Jose expands around the Central Valley at an altitude averaging 3,850 feet. The mountains add exciting texture to the panorama from the hotel’s gardens. The entire family will enjoy the sweet, tropical, and unique flavors that accompany breakfast, from star fruit to pineapple. After your meal your private transfer will escort you to Poas National Park, home to one of the widest and deepest craters in the world. The volcano is active and rises 8,885 feet above sea level. The landscape is lunar and desolate atop the simmering crater. The children are eager and excited to see the interior of an active volcano. Your heart thumps enthusiastically as well. At the summit you can look into the crater and see Laguna Caliente, approximately 967 feet deep. Steam rises from the turquoise water. Lush rainforest surrounds the southern lake. The water fills an inactive crater that last erupted over five millennia ago. Cold and reflective water fills Lake Botos. The cool jade color of the leaves gives a prehistoric ambiance to the summit and the lively mountainside. Continue your adventurous exploration of Costa Rica in Manuel Antonio and settle into the comforts of your lavish hotel nestled within the encompassing rainforest and boasting a view of the Pacific Ocean.

dayInfo.title: Manuel Antonio - The Beauty of the Air
dayInfo.description: The loquacious sounds of birds fill the morning trees. Trogons and toucans call out beneath the canopy. The kids are excited to explore the treetops in search of the vivacious and stunning wildlife that calls Costa Rica home. After breakfast you make your way through the canopy on an aerial tram. Board the gondola and rise over the forest ground. The leaves are thick and full. At times the trees open up and offer a view of the canopy from above, a verdant, rolling carpet that covers the countryside. The gondola travels over 222 acres of unspoiled jungle. The thunderous rush of a waterfall echoes in the trees. Parakeets nest in the sweeping forest. They can grow up to seven-inches and have a distinctive tapered tail that that grows to almost half their body length. They chirp and tweet in elegant song that carries over the sound of the waterfall. The majesty of the air comes from the beauty of Costa Rica and the excited smiles of your family as they witness the wildlife and landscape around them.

dayInfo.title: Manuel Antonio - Surrounded by Clouds
dayInfo.description: The waves of the Pacific Ocean brush against the opulent shores of Manuel Antonio National Park. The white sand catches the morning light and the sound of the rainforest once again rises around you. After breakfast you will leave behind the tree-edged shoreline for the famous Cloud Forest Reserve of Monteverde. The reserve is the richest and most complex tropical ecosystem in the Americas, and is home to majestic trees, dense vegetation, and magnificent wildlife. Arrive at your fabulous hotel on the border of the national park. In the afternoon you will adventure through 25,204 acres of protected forest with a tour along the suspension bridges. The combination of six sky-high bridges and walking trails extend to a distance of over a mile and a half. The longest bridge reaches an expanse of 984 feet. Above the forest floor your can spot orchids shimmering in the afternoon light almost 125 feet up in the canopy. Their bright purple and yellow petals pop against the rich jade leaves. The climate from both the Pacific and Atlantic oceans cause moisture to rise into the mountains and converge at Monteverde. The plants take the moisture directly from the clouds and thrive in the varying altitude.

dayInfo.title: Monteverde Cloud Forest Biological Reserve - A Naturalist Guide
dayInfo.description: The clouds rise from the foothills like a wave and sweep through the trees. The landscape turns from lush to gray but adds an adventurous ambiance to the reserve. The wildlife calls out in the cool morning sky. Resplendent quetzals glide through the trees. The elusive bird twitters in the low hanging branches. Their feathers are iridescent green and scarlet. They can grow up to 16 inches long with their streaming tail feather extending an extra 26 inches. When they fly their tail feather floats behind them like a decorative ribbon. After breakfast you will meet your guide and tour through the trails of the Cloud Forest Reserve in search of the captivating flora and fauna. The possibility of seeing a puma even entices the kids. The wildcats can grow to almost eight feet long and have round, erect ears. Your guide takes you through the forest and points out the seemingly endless variety of plants, numbering around 2,500, which can be found in the reserve. The sunlight peaks through the canopy and lights the way. The rambunctious calls of the forest soften, and you continue with your exploration.

dayInfo.title: Monteverde Cloud Forest Biological Reserve - Watching the Family React
dayInfo.description: The exotic forest and wildlife of Monteverde captivate the family. The treetops and forest grounds are filled with quintessence, from the quetzal to roaming endangered anteaters. After breakfast, your private transfer will escort you down the foothills and away from the sweeping Cloud Forest. Pass Lake Arenal, the largest freshwater lake in the country, encompassing 33 square miles. The pure blue water reflects the pristine sky and surrounding greenery. Rainbow bass swims below the water’s surface and kingfisher soar through the sky. Arenal Volcano looms over the landscape. Smoke rises from the smoldering crater. The volcano erupted daily from 1968 until 2012. The rainforest gives way to ardent prairies that cover the rolling hills. Horses graze on the grassland and the 5,357-foot tall summit of the volcano can be seen from all angles. The family awes at how the power and beauty of nature can combine into something as magnificent as Arenal. Arrive at your accommodation and listen to the soothing trickle of the natural hot spring nearby.

dayInfo.title: Monteverde Cloud Forest Biological Reserve - Morning in the Park
dayInfo.description: The tranquil sounds of the running hot spring add elegance to the morning. Steam rises through the lush tropical rainforest that surrounds the water. The family is excited to explore Arenal National Park after breakfast. The park contains 504,094 acres of preserved landscape and is home to the famous Arenal Volcano and the lesser-known Chato Volcano. The steam rises prominently from Arenal Volcano’s crater and adds to the passing clouds. Tapir graze along the forest floor. These peculiar animals can grow over six and a half feet long and stand three feet high. The tapir’s charm with their protruding nose and docile nature, offers you an inimitable experience beneath the canopy. The sun drifts quietly over the rainforest and the tree line ends. The landscape turns to black, craggy volcanic rock. The western foothills of Arenal Volcano become lava fields, containing layers of cooled magma from throughout the decades. Oftentimes you can see red-hot color glowing from beneath the active vent. The shared excellence of exploring the park brings you closer to the volcano and also brings your family closer together.

dayInfo.title: San Jose - The Geometric Countryside
dayInfo.description: The sweeping prairies and conical crater of Arenal fall behind you as your private transfer takes you to the city of Sarchi. The Central Valley is known for its ornate oxcarts and leather-clad wooden furnishings. The foothills lead into the valley and the colorful designs of the town invite the family in. The Rio Trojas divides Sarchi into north and south sections. The heart of Sarchi Norte contains a church that has twin towers and is painted pink and blue. You also find the world’s largest oxcart stretching around 45 feet long. The cart is decorated with colorful geometric and floral décor. The handicrafts of Sarchi are unparalleled, coming from over 200 stores and family operated woodworking shops. The atmosphere is a combination of traditional country-western and modern Costa Rican. The Mercado de Artesanias is positioned in a large warehouse and is operated by a cooperative. Local artisans display their handcrafted goods, from chests to hand-painted ceramic plates. In the afternoon you will return to San Jose and settle into the familiar and comfortable hotel with a garden view of the towering mountain range.

dayInfo.title: San Jose - A Linger Look at San Jose
dayInfo.description: Wake up to the quiet charm of the hotel garden. The twittering birdcalls and brushing ocean current remain fresh in your memory. The bustling streets of the capital city rise with the sunshine. Savor the fresh and sweet flavors of breakfast, from luscious coconut to rambutan, all accompanied with the rich taste of Costa Rican coffee. You have explored the landscape and the culture of the countryside with your family and created unforgettable experiences along the way. Your private transfer escorts you to the airport for your flight home. You adventured through the country and rediscovered the celebrated connection to one another. For ideas on adding on to this customizable tour, please read the section for Costa Rica vacation reviews .

tourName: Costa Rica Monkey Tour: Luxury & Adventure
placesVisited: San Jose, Arenal Volcano, Manuel Antonio, Puerto Jimenez
generalInfo: Luxury and adventure are not two words that often go hand-in-hand, but on this 12-day tour of Costa Rica you will find that the two are not mutually exclusive. This adventurous excursion will take you through dense rainforest and let you explore coveted national parks, and monkey trails to volcanoes which create an unparalleled skyline, all while the Pacific Ocean shimmers an enrapturing sapphire blue. Watch the sunset on your private balcony after coursing through the rapids of the Pacuare River. In Costa Rica, luxury and adventure are combined to create one of life’s most harmonious combinations.

dayInfo.title: San Jose - On the Fringe of the Wild
dayInfo.description: The wonders of Costa Rica begin in San Jose, the bustling capital. Beyond the façade is a cosmopolitan city filled with energetic locals and a vibrant rhythm connected to the pulse of the country. A private guide meets you at the airport and takes you to your lavish boutique accommodation. Outside of the endless energy of San Jose your senses awaken to the tropical aromas of fresh orchids and coffee beans. Hummingbirds flutter around blossoming flowers and the unmistakable rush of waterfalls echoes through the air. The main lounge is a combination of tropical and cabin comfort with a view of the natural falls dipping into the turquoise pool. Settle into Adventure Inn and prepare for the journeys soon to come.

dayInfo.title: San Jose - Lakes and Calderas
dayInfo.description: The sunlight spreads through the sky and shows the bright blue morning against the blanket of lush canopy. Enjoy the day at your leisure, whether roaming around the exceptional Waterfall Gardens to enjoy the sweeping natural beauty of the gardens and waterways or whitewater rafting down the Pacuare River, the adventures are endless. Poas Volcano National Park covers 16,000 acres and reaches a height of 8,900 feet above sea level. Two vast calderas contain two very different, yet equally stunning crater lakes. The main crater is 950 feet deep and is where you find the boiling Fumarole . The acidic water is cool blue and constantly steaming. The lake in Botos crater shimmers cold, jade water. The moonlike landscape of the active crater contrasts with the encompassing greenery of the national park.

dayInfo.title: Arenal - Volcanic Panorama
dayInfo.description: The rich flavors of fresh Costa Rican coffee accompany sweet pineapple and juicy mango. After breakfast a private transfer will escort you from the lush hills of your hotel to the picturesque view of the epic Arenal Volcano. In quaint towns, bougainvilleas drape over small houses and bright shops. Rivers carve the foothills of roaming mountains. The verdant trees open to wide stretches of pristine prairie where horses graze against the backdrop of the looming volcano. Villages and shops rise and fall alongside the road like images out of a European realist painting. Arrive at your five-star resort and spa to find the luxuries of the hotel hidden by the lushness of the jungle. The hot springs rush down a small slope and created a variety of pools. Dip into the reveled springs and feel the pools’ different temperatures when you sample the different levels. Steam rises around you. Exceptional greenery borders the gently rushing water. The quiet ambiance and relaxing hot springs welcome you to tropical paradise.

dayInfo.title: Arenal - Finding Refuge
dayInfo.description: Indulge in the soft sounds of the morning. Birds chirp and call in the trees. Clouds glide over the crater and mix with the caldera’s rising steam. Experience the surrounding wonders of Arenal at your leisure, allowing you to explore the La Fortuna Waterfalls by ATV or wander through the canopy on the hanging bridges. The Cano Negro Refuge is located on the shores of Rio Frio, which means cold lake. When you board the boat at Los Chiles, you make your way upriver to Lago Cano Negro. The water is cold and the banks are lush. A fin pokes through the water’s calm surface. Bull sharks wind their way through the river from the sea en route to Rio Nicaragua. Caiman linger in the underbrush and disguise themselves in the floating foliage. Large glossy ibis graze on the marshlands. Their wingspan can extend up to 41 inches and their plumage, during mating, season shimmers reddish-brown and is highlighted by green wings. Sloths slowly ascend to higher branches and almost blend into the tree bark. The exceptional wildlife of the refuge almost parades in front of you, giving you a taste of Costa Rica’s natural splendor.

dayInfo.title: Manuel Antonio - Rising Steam to Steamy Shores
dayInfo.description: Breakfast comes beneath the looming beauty of the volcano’s panorama. The sweet and savory delights of your meal somehow seem tastier when enjoying the opulent scenery. Soon you will leave Arenal behind for the pristine beaches and marvelous rainforest of Manuel Antonio. The palms rise with the background of perfect blue sky. The water is a calm sparkling jewel. Monkeys play in the trees and rustle the leaves. Rambunctious birds call out in the canopy. The idyllic landscape spreads over six-square miles, from waves to hilltops. Find yourself in the comfortable reaches of a charming resort situated between beach and forest where you can settle into your own slice of paradise. View the surf or the trees, and listen to the enrapturing crashing waves mix with the sweet rising calls from the jungle.

dayInfo.title: Manuel Antonio - A View from the Treetops
dayInfo.description: The sunrise casts a light over the top of the canopy and reaches outward towards the sea. The birds and monkeys are active in the cool morning air. Their calls once again mix with the waves brushing and peeling against the shore. After breakfast the day waits to be unraveled, offering you a plethora of opportunity to explore and time to enjoy the paradisiacal scenery. Local projects embody the spirit of Costa Rica in their caring attitude and helpful mission. Adventure through the treetops on a guided tour of the cloud forest in the hilltops of the national park. Squirrel monkeys cling to twining branches and climb through the canopy’s higher reaches. Walk along the edges of the Seco River and cross over bridges that take you through and over the exceptional biodiversity on the park. Morpho butterflies shimmer with metallic blues and greens. Their wings flutter around you as they haphazardly fly past. Waterfalls crash into deep pools. Stop at the center of the long hanging bridge and look out over the sweeping greenery of the rainforest.

dayInfo.title: Manuel Antonio - The Sunset Country
dayInfo.description: The sapphire water captures the sunlight and spreads the light like a beam to the beach. Spend time lounging in the perfect pool that overlooks the beach or indulge in a delightful spa service that will relax and rejuvenate you. In the early afternoon you can partake in a sunset cruise that will show you the unique and stunning waters in a way you have yet to have seen. The small catamaran casts its sails and takes you farther out to sea. The water isn’t just sapphire but crystal clear. Angelfish and Eyestripe surgeonfish swirl around coral reefs in couples and small schools. The wind feels cool and lively as it rushes past. The horizon is endless and dolphins arch into the air before diving back into the sea. The grill lights and the scent of fresh fish and lemon citrus mixes with the sweet ocean aroma. The sun descends to the edge of the horizon and lingers for a while. Layers of deep saffron and scarlet climb from the water into the sky until the sun disappears. Costa Rica is filled with different worlds, above and below the sea, but each world is just as charming as the next.

dayInfo.title: Manuel Antonio - Beachside Pleasantries
dayInfo.description: The natural grandeur of Manuel Antonio reaches the horizon. Indulge in a day of relaxation and rejuvenation. You can immerse yourself in the luxuries of an award-winning spa and let the healing hands and blissful beach panorama get you in touch with yourself and the countryside. The aroma of coconut oil is familiar. The crashing waves become the soundtrack to your massage. Candles flicker in the warm air and you feel the tenderness of the daylight drifting away. Hot stones are heated to over 120 degrees and placed on specific areas of your back and hands. Any remaining stress left over from before your arrival in Costa Rica disappears. A cool breeze flows through the spa. Sunset lingers over the horizon and you can watch the day fade out and the night fade from beneath the shade of a palapa.

dayInfo.title: Puerto Jimenez - Like a Picture Book
dayInfo.description: It is often the hardest to reach destinations that have the most to offer. The trees are untouched and the wildlife maintains a certain spirit and attitude different from those used to human interaction. Today you will have an early morning flight to the hard-to-reach southwestern corner of the Osa Peninsula, home to Puerto Jimenez and Corcovado National Park. Wildlife and civilization divide the town of Puerto Jimenez, from sprawling mangroves to energetic monkeys, tapir to wilderness-studded beaches. The rainforest canopy almost swallows the exceptional resort, which offers you remarkable views of the unhindered wildlife in the trees and a panorama of the open ocean beyond. Each room offers a private balcony and a tranquil ambiance.

dayInfo.title: Puerto Jimenez - No Trail to Follow
dayInfo.description: Watch the sunrise from your balcony and let the morning slowly come to the peninsula. The lodge offers a slew of activities for you to choose from including a snorkeling tour along the gemstone colors of the Golfo Dulce. Your guide takes you out to the water and you make your way out along the gulf. The crystal clear water lets the sun shine down to an average of 40 feet deep. Bright gangly starfish hold on to the craggy rocks. Yellow angelfish glare against the perfectly crystal-blue sea. As you swim a pod of dolphins nears the boat. The gulf is known for bottlenose, common, and spotted dolphin sightings. The bottlenose can reach a length of 13 feet and a weight of over 1,400 pounds. They are friendly and curious, swimming closer and closer to you before flipping out of the water. They dive down in an elegant display of their playful personalities.

dayInfo.title: Puerto Jimenez - Intensity of Beauty
dayInfo.description: Today you can partake in another batch of fabulous activities on offer at your tremendous eco-lodge. Corcovado National Park is considered the last great tropical rainforest of Pacific Central America, and is home to the largest population of scarlet macaws and harpy eagles. Join a guided tour through the vast stretch of dense trees and tremendous wildlife to experience what National Geographic called “the most biologically intense place on earth.” The park spans over 164 square miles of land, filled with towering trees and dense underbrush. Your guide explains the nature of the leaves and the thick canopy above. Toucans perch on thin outlets. Ocelots linger in the branches and jaguars prowl around the brush in search of tapir and anteaters. Howler monkeys cry out in the morning air, their calls deep and guttural. This dense forest is the last bastion of the jaguar; the male feline can grow to almost 350 pounds and up to six-feet long. They are careful and elegant, powerful and skeptical. You continue to follow your guide and are immersed in the wonders around you.

dayInfo.title: San Jose - When the Trail Ends
dayInfo.description: Indulge in the moment when the sweet aromas of breakfast combine with the exceptional panorama of the Osa Peninsula. You savor this perfect moment. After your meal you will have a domestic flight to San Jose where you will catch your return flight home. Your adventures on and off the trails of Costa Rica brought you wildlife and landscapes, whitewater and waterfalls, every moment more exceptional than the last. The journey may end but the exciting memories carry on.

tourName: Costa Rica Vacation Package: A Tropical Getaway to Quepos & Manuel Antonio
placesVisited: San Jose, Los Campesinos Private Reserve, Manuel Antonio National Park
generalInfo: Costa Rica surpasses the paradisiacal and borders dreamlike. On this 7-day tour you will experience the true splendor of the country, finding both luxury and adventure in the rolling hills and glowing beaches. Whether you have wandered through the lush rainforests before, or you wish to discover the magnificent charm of the white sandy beaches of Manuel Antonio for the first time, this vacation will take you beyond the possible and into the desirable. Discover what it feels like when tropical dreams come true.

dayInfo.title: San Jose - The Central Valley
dayInfo.description: The wonders of Costa Rica are within your grasp as you arrive in the capital of the country. The city is vibrant with an eclectic energy that incorporates the variety of culture from around the vast landscapes and regions. Beneath the fast pace and the sprawling neighborhoods is a city overflowing with charm and happiness, from the numerous parks to the remarkable historic museums. Your private transfer meets you at the airport and escorts you to a luxurious hotel in the city. Plaza de la Democracia was inaugurated in the late 1980s and celebrated the centennial of the election of President Jose Joaquin Rodriguez. The elevated terraces offer you a view of the surrounding mountains that create the greater skyline around the city. At sunset the mountains shift to silhouettes and the cityscape begins to shimmer. The nearby open-air crafts market displays a wealth of hand-carved wooden pieces and endless bags of Costa Rican coffee. The large and lively pavilion gives you a taste of the traditional culture with a touch of the modern world, from silver and gold jewelry shaped into pre-Columbian images to creamy flavors of farm fresh cheeses. For dinner, you can try Product C, a restaurant that started as a beachside shack and now champions sustainable seafood. The oysters served with lemon, Tabasco, and jalapeno vinaigrette creates a unique combination that you never knew you were missing until you to try it.

dayInfo.title: Manuel Antonio - Embracing Forest
dayInfo.description: Indulge in a breakfast filled with the rich aromas of Costa Rican coffee and the local flavorful and sweet exotic fruits. The papayas are bright and eye-catching. The bananas are creamy and decadent. After breakfast your private transfer takes you to the local airport for your flight to Quepos. The small town is a gateway to Manuel Antonio National Park and maintains a sleepy and jovial atmosphere amongst the locals. Continue onwards to your hotel, which may encompass the best of the rainforest and tranquil ocean views. With a little luck, you may spot monkey or a sloth on the grounds. In the afternoon, you will set out on a private hike with a biologist to introduce you to the surrounding beauty. The walk looks over 800 acres of tropical lowlands, which is home to a sensational collection of wildlife. Trek along the unpaved path. The trees vary in size from small to towering, thinly trunked to wide and massive. Motmots swirl through the trees. The birds have elegant and colorful plumage that almost glows against the background of jade leaves. Your guide points into the trees and shows you the bird gradually wagging its tail feathers, which calls attention to its otherwise hidden spot on the branch.

dayInfo.title: Manuel Antonio - Lead a Horse to Water
dayInfo.description: The morning fills with the early calls of the wildlife from beyond the trees. Monkeys and birds are active in the cooler air of the early morning and sound off with energetic cries. Frogs croak on the riverbanks and small marshes. After enjoying breakfast listening to the wonderful sounds of the wild, you meet your guide and horse that will lead you through the dense forestry to the water. The tree branches and leaves often hang low. The horse traipses along and follows the guide in front of you. Vanilla orchids rise from the brush. Toucans glide around the canopy. You hear the rushing waters of the Savegre River before you see the riverbanks. The river flows from the Talamanca Mountain Range and to the estuary of Manuel Antonio National Park. The water quickly glides past but the sound is soothing and the cool temperature is refreshing. Your river guide helps you into the raft and when everyone is ready you make your way downstream. The excitement pulses in your chest. The riverbanks are lush and quickly passing by. When the water turns to rapids your guide tells you to paddle. The boulders stick out of the river and make the water swirl. The water splashes around you. Continue to paddle and feel the wondrous rush and jovial atmosphere. When the river calms you find yourself next to a vibrant waterfall with lunch ready and waiting like an earned reward.

dayInfo.title: Manuel Antonio - The Privacy of Others
dayInfo.description: The morning symphony once again circles around you. Indulge in a robust breakfast before making your way to Los Campesinos Private Reserve. Located between the Naranjo Mountains and the Savegre River, the reserve is home to the longest hanging bridge in Costa Rica. Follow your guides through the exceptional landscape that takes you through the treetops and around waterfall basins. The air is aromatic, filled with the smells of tropical flowers like the vanilla orchid. Waterfalls thunder down the foothills. Step onto the hanging bridge that stretches 380 feet for a view of the powerful falls. The endless water tumbles over the cliff to the waiting pool below. The elegance of the streaming water is partially obstructed by the trees near the basin, however, the splendor remains. On the far side of the bridge is a second waterfall that fills a swimming hole with cool, refreshing water. The wonders of this uncharted forest continue to delight and amaze. In the afternoon you will transfer to Manuel Antonio and find the luxurious amenities and panorama of the pristine ocean. Look out over the deck to see where the jade canopy ends and the sapphire Pacific Ocean begins. In the evening you can indulge in the local flavors of Bambu Jam, known for their slightly spiced blackened mahi mahi with sweet mango chutney.

dayInfo.title: Manuel Antonio - Crescent Sands and Bending Trees
dayInfo.description: The morning brings in the rush of color from the sapphire ocean. You can see the waves peeling on the shore. The forest alights with birdcalls and howler monkeys bringing a rugged, archaic sound to the early light. The soft white sand sweeps around the bay in a crescent shape and the trees rustle in the breeze. Enjoy a morning hike and witness where the sea meets the trees. Squirrel monkeys swing from branch to branch and the exotic birds like the blue-crowned motmot are almost blinding with iridescent feathers. There is something both majestic and serene about exploring the countless trails of the park and of Costa Rica. The flowers are charming and the wildlife is spellbinding. Over 109 species of mammals call the national park home, including Hoffmann’s two-toed sloth. As you come to the beach you are more likely to find the black spiny-tailed iguana. The reptile can grow to over four feet in length and they usually have a whitish gray or tan color. They spread out on the rocks and bask in the sunlight. Waves crash against the rocky outcrops and spritz into the air. You find the combination of the trees and water both thrilling and beautiful. The biodiversity is unique and stunning, allowing you to explore the rainforest. Do as the iguana does and spread out on the beachside and indulge in the hot, soft sand and cool water of the pristine beach. The day drifts by and you relax without a care in the world amidst the soothing sounds of the water.

dayInfo.title: Manuel Antonio - The Sea Doesn’t End
dayInfo.description: The beauty of Manuel Antonio doesn’t end at the beach, but continues on and beneath the surface of the sea. After a lush breakfast of flavorful tropical fruits, such as pineapple and coconut, you will meet your private transfer and make your way to the seaside. Climb aboard a catamaran to journey away from the white-sand shores. The breeze is a welcomed cool against your cheeks as the sails are cast. The jagged rock formations and towering cliffs shrink along Costa Rica proper. The sapphire water is a glassy clear. You can see schools of fish swimming in the beams of refracted light. Their colorful scales glisten and you dive into the water for a closer look at the fish and the reef nearby. The coral sprawls upward from the seafloor and the colorful calcite is home to numerous fish. Angelfish weave around anemones. The water is refreshing and warm. People point to a distant pod of bottlenose dolphins. The dolphins arch into the air and dive deep into the water. They display their playful and friendly personalities. In the evening you return to your resort and revel in the absolute thrill of your seafaring adventure.

dayInfo.title: San Jose - Return to Central
dayInfo.description: The morning waves crash against the white sand and you are reminded of the lounging lizards of the previous day. The majestic view and the sensual tropical flavors are always captivating. You wake up to the sight of perfection, a world-renowned paradise that stretches from ocean to ocean. After breakfast, you will have a private transfer to Quepos for your return flight to San Jose. Once in San Jose you will continue the journey home. Your time exploring the rainforest and beaches of Costa Rica has shown you the ineffable spirit of the country, from its landscape to its people, its illustrious rainforest and captivating wildlife.

tourName: Dreamy Costa Rica Eco Tour for Couples
placesVisited: Central Valley, Bajos del Toro, Arenal, Punta Islita
generalInfo: This is an adventurous, 11-day journey that will have you exploring the very best of Costa Rica, including secluded lodges that have received ecological awards and sustainable tourism certifications. Welcome to a country of indulgent vibes and romantic charms that go hand in hand through cloud forests and coffee farms. Complete serenity will dominate most of your time, while exclusive activities showcase near-mythical landscapes. From the forest to the beach, you will escape the world and relax in idyllic locations.

dayInfo.title: Central Valley – Romance on a Plateau
dayInfo.description: After landing at the Juan Santamaria International Airport, you will be picked up and transferred to the Central Valley. Luxury awaits, and your hotel will be tucked away on a coffee plantation on the hills above Costa Rica. You will experience real privacy here, and you will not see anything artificial in your immediate vicinity. Today will be at your leisure, and you can spend as much time as you please in and around your suite. Self-guided walking trails can lead you through the coffee plantation, where you can find more places of privacy and the peaceful atmosphere of Costa Rica. Costa Rica is known as a destination for adventure, but on your first day, you will also discover that it is a premier choice for a relaxing getaway.

dayInfo.title: Central Valley – Coffee Plantation Tour
dayInfo.description: Aromas will tantalize you as you set off on a private tour of the coffee plantation. Everything is produced ecologically here, and the plantation was organic since long before organic certifications were created. By wandering among the bushes, you will witness how coffee is grown and harvested. In the harvest season of October to January, you can indulge in bean picking as well. After the plantation, you can get involved in the coffee-making procedure from clearing and drying berries through roasting techniques and how to keep the beans fresh. Part of your tour will be a professional coffee cupping session. You will learn how to discern the quality of beans through their look, smell, and taste.

dayInfo.title: Bajos del Toro – Escaping to Tropical Cloud Forest
dayInfo.description: Today, you will have a short transfer to Bajos del Toro, so you can relax, especially when fresh coffee is brought to your balcony. Your next lodge will be situated in a forest reserve. Here, creeks flow gently between the trees, and the trickling sound will be omnipresent throughout your stay. Waterfalls hide in the reserve, and you can search for them without a guide by walking down a series of small trails. After checking in, you can try out the spa. There is a yoga deck and a grand bar area, where you can relax with drinks throughout the afternoon. Today will be at your leisure, and there are plenty of romantic activities that you can arrange locally, including horseback riding, river rafting, and a zipline experience through a nearby forest canopy.

dayInfo.title: Bajos del Toro – Spa Indulgence and Cooking Class
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will have a couple’s rainforest aromatherapy session in the spa. Candles will flicker, and the whispering breeze of forest life will travel through the spa. Your itinerary will be entirely customizable, so you can adjust anything and everything to your moods and desires. You can even choose to move this spa session to another day or at another time. This afternoon, you will be provided with a private, organic cooking class in the hotel’s kitchen. First, you will wander through the gardens, smelling the fresh produce and picking out ingredients from the soil. This is a country of organic cooking, and there is a real nuance to the food, especially when you are guided by expert chefs.

dayInfo.title: Bajos del Toro – Amorous Dinner in the Treetops
dayInfo.description: Just beyond the reserve, you will find a rural village where traditions have been carefully preserved. Here, women sit on their doorsteps and will smile as you pass, children play along lanes of cobblestone, and locals open their doors, so you can develop a better understanding of their traditions, especially those that are different from the rest of Costa Rica. With a magnifying glass, you can venture on a micro safari to discover all the strange and tiny specimens of the garden. Dona Olga is another local who operates a house with an open door, and she can teach you how to make tortillas. This afternoon, you can choose another activity in the Bajos del Toro area or venture back to your lodge for some more waterfall walks. As dusk appears, you will wander down a hidden path before ascending into the treetops.

dayInfo.title: Arenal – Dreamy Volcano Views and Spa
dayInfo.description: By continuing your eco-tour through Costa Rica, you will travel into the Arenal region. A majestic volcano will take center stage, and you can often see flumes of steam escaping from its summit. This is one of the country’s most active volcanos, but it is currently safe to explore the slopes. Arenal is also a destination with dozens of activities that you can try, so this afternoon can be tailored to your interests. Your hotel will have a spectacular view of Arenal. The suites are split across two levels, and dreamy views can be expected from your balcony. There is also a spa, and you will be treated to a couple’s treatment upon your arrival.

dayInfo.title: Arenal – Canopy Tour and Forest Charm
dayInfo.description: Gondolas soar serenely above the forest floor and offer supreme views of both the volcanoes and lakes. After rising to the top of the forest, you will descend by a series of ziplines. In total, you will travel more than 1.7 miles down through the rainforest with each of the eight lines providing a glimpse of forest life and its winged inhabitants. After gliding down, you can continue your exploration by walking across long suspension bridges. Nearly all the rainforest’s organisms live in the canopy, so you will see more in the canopy than on the forest floor. Back at your hotel, you will find privacy, and today’s tour can be as long or as short as you like.

dayInfo.title: Punta Islita – A Beachfront Getaway
dayInfo.description: Today’s journey will be the longest of your vacation because it will take around four hours to reach Punta Islita on the Pacific Coast. The transfer will be in a private sedan, and there will be sublime views along the way. Your beachfront getaway will be partially hidden by the forest, continuing the theme of privacy and space. You will be staying in one of the villas that will be complete with stunning ocean views that will extend from your private swimming pool. This small resort has all the facilities that you may expect from a premium beachfront property, including a fusion restaurant and an infinity-edge pool that overlooks the sand. From the villa, you can walk barefoot to the beach and a quiet piece of the coast.

dayInfo.title: Punta Islita �– Best of the Guanacaste Area
dayInfo.description: These two days can provide you with more downtime. Like the rest of the properties on your journey, this hotel holds a four-leaf rating for sustainable tourism, which was awarded by the Costa Rican tourist board. This rating is a key indicator of ecological and sustainable practices, including preserving the natural surroundings and supporting local communities. The hotel also has a spa, and a couple’s spa ritual will be included in your stay. These two days can also be active. You can explore the nearby forest on horseback or take to the canopy once again with a zipline excursion. Small bays dot the coast, and there is some excellent snorkeling that you can enjoy.

dayInfo.title: San Jose – Departure
dayInfo.description: An airport has just opened in Punta Islita. This is destined to increase tourism, so you will be visiting Punta Islita at the right time before it gets too crowded. Currently, there is only one flight per day, which is a morning departure that will take you back to San Jose. Dayroom hotel use in San Jose can be arranged if there is a long wait for your international flight.

tourName: East to West Costa Rica Vacation of Romance & Luxury: Caribbean Sea to Pacific Coast
placesVisited: Tortuguero, Tamarindo, Monteverde Cloud Forest, Palo Verde National Park
generalInfo: Blend romance and luxury, exploration and relaxation on your 9-day custom-tailored Costa Rica vacation. Relax near the opulent waters of the Pacific Ocean and drift through the secluded canals at Tortuguero. Witness the distinctive simmer of an active volcano and traverse the unique canopy around the Cloud Forest Reserve. From coral reefs to turtles’ nests, jaguars to scarlet macaws, indulge in the rich natural life of Costa Rica.

dayInfo.title: San Jose – Between East and West
dayInfo.description: Welcome to San Jose, the capital of Costa Rica. The city resides in the Central Valley and contains the country’s heart and soul. The culture from around Costa Rica has settled in San Jose, creating a bustling melting pot of cuisine, atmosphere, and history. Colonial mansions line the streets of Barrio Aranjuez. Elegant hand-carved woodwork adorns the facades and porches wrap around the raised entryways. Your private transfer meets you at the airport and escorts you to a fabulous hotel that balances a central location with elegant seclusion. The central market is an entire city block and houses over 200 shops, stalls, and restaurants. Narrow lanes divide the vendors by goods, from wood carvings to produce. Bananas hang down in decadent bunches. Large watermelons tempt you from their display. The sweet and citrusy aromas of star fruit linger in the air. In the evening, share a romantic meal over candlelight at a local restaurant where after the first crunchy and juicy bite, you can find indulgence and perfection in Costa Rica’s Central Valley.

dayInfo.title: Tortuguero – Finding the East
dayInfo.description: The panorama of the encircling mountains accompanies the sweet tropical aromas of the neighborhood. The mountainous landscape creates a unique and lustrous skyline around the city and valley. Your private transfer meets you at the hotel and escorts you through the exceptional greenery of the Braulio Carrillo National Park en route to the secluded northeastern lowlands. Your transfer arrives at the riverbanks where you step aboard a local boat. The region receives 250 inches of rain a year. The rainfall and the biodiversity create the unique and secluded canals for which Tortuguero is famous. A slight breeze combs over the canal and through your hair. A bare-throated tiger heron perches on a large tree root that protrudes from the water. Arrive at the luxuries of a unique eco-lodge, concealed by the rainforest canopy along the secluded canals of Barra de Pacuare. The serene sounds of wildlife emanate from the Madre de Dios Lagoon and the tropical rainforest separating the isolated canals from the Caribbean Sea on a narrow peninsula. The unspoiled beauty of the canals provides authentic sightings of green, leatherback, and Carey turtles, as well as rare sightings of jaguars, endangered tapir, and the exceptional Agami heron. Nearly 6,000 acres of protected biological reserve provides a labyrinth of rivers, swamps, and cloud forests around Tortuguero. Your wonderful lodge promotes sustainability through ecological-friendly projects protecting the Pacuare canals, along with the delicate environment supporting the distinctive flora and fauna. In the afternoon, relax in the comforts of Lirio Lodge as you listen to the active kingfisher call out in the dwindling sunlight while swaying on a hammock or sitting near the bonfire with a view to the water.

dayInfo.title: Tortuguero – Tortuguero Canals and Pacuare Biological Reserve
dayInfo.description: The rainforest is alive around you, filled with elegant bird calls to start the day. Your private guide will meet you in the lobby and escorts you through the Tortuguero canals and Pacuare biological reserve in the morning light when the animals are still active. You step onto a boat and begin the journey. The trees quiet in the warmth of the late morning. The serene rainforest lines the canals’ banks creating a tranquil ambiance. Your guide points into the canopy. A troop of spider monkeys dawdles in the high branches. They favor the higher canopy and forage up to 98 feet above the forest floor. You can search the banks of the canals for the agami heron, which can grow to 30 inches tall with a neck and breast shining with chestnut plumage and a white line coursing down their neck. Their wings shimmer with emerald and their crown has hints of pale blue spreading to their lower back.

dayInfo.title: Monteverde Cloud Forest – Top of the Western Ridge
dayInfo.description: The active rainforest wildlife once again fills the morning with rambunctious and resonant calls. The sensually sweet aromas of tropical fruits, from luscious coconut to juicy papaya, swirl through the air. You will take a flight to San Jose where your private transfer will escort you to Poas National Park. The park is located 8,885 feet around the summit of Poas Volcano. The active crater steams at the high altitude. The crater is almost 1,000 feet deep and contains an emerald, boiling lake. Lush elfin forest wraps around the reflective lake and the water is refreshingly cold. In the trees, you can see and emerald toucanet. Its bill is brightly marked with yellow and black. Its tail feathers are tipped with orange. They call out with short loud chirps. In Monteverde, you will find comfort in a graceful lodge at the edge of the famous Cloud Forest Reserve.

dayInfo.title: Monteverde Cloud Forest – Watching the Clouds from Above
dayInfo.description: The Cloud Forest Reserve is famous for its rich biodiversity. The moisture of the Pacific and Atlantic oceans converges on the hilltops and creates meandering bursts of graceful clouds. The herbaceous aroma of ferns drifts with the clouds. Moss carpets the underbrush and lower branches. Rivers and streams careen around the forest floor. Tour through the canopy on a set of hanging bridges to discover the secluded beauty of the treetops. Resplendent quetzals roost on the branches. Their crimson and green plumage is iridescent against the blossomed rainforest. The world is peaceful on your private exploration of the forest. The clouds dissipate and the greenery glistens against the sweeping blue sky. Orchids intermittently shade the trees with lavender and pink petals.

dayInfo.title: Tamarindo – Cloud Forest Turns to Beachfront Paradise
dayInfo.description: The morning is wash with cool air and twittering birdlife. After breakfast, the trees fade behind the mountainside as you leave the Cloud Forest Reserve behind you. The grasslands of Guanacaste offer sprawling prairies filled with long-eared brahma cattle. Costa Rican cowboys ride horses in the meandering grass. The verdant fields house interspersed trees and glassy sapphire lakes. Arrive in Tamarindo, the cosmopolitan beachside city on the Pacific Coast. The current spreads across the shoreline. The sound of crashing waves is always nearby and the comforts of the quiet, private pool offer a captivating moment alone. Playa Grande is home to the nesting grounds of leatherback turtles. The waves provide the soundtrack for the hatchlings as they dig their way out of their sandy nests between November and March. The moonlight reflects off the water and attracts the newly born turtles. They push themselves with their finds. They leave small prints in the sand. Once they reach the water the tide takes them out to sea and they disappear in the luminous wake.

dayInfo.title: Tamarindo – The Beauty of the Beach
dayInfo.description: The rich aromas of the tropical western paradise emanate from breakfast. Sweet mango and luscious papaya accompany layers of chocolaty Costa Rican coffee. The day is yours to indulge in the pleasure of Tamarindo at your leisure, from relaxing on the plush sands of Tamarindo Beach to adventuring along the mangroves at Palo Verde National Park. The water around Tamarindo is delightfully cobalt and reflective. The white sand beaches around Tortuga Island gives crates 33 acres of pristine beach and forest for you to enjoy. Board a catamaran and sail across the sea to the secluded island. Spinner dolphins jump from the water and splash back down. Their dorsal fin is triangular and they can reach a length of almost eight feet. When the spinner dolphin springs from the water they quickly twist in the air, from two to five and a half times, before touching back down. The island sand shimmers in the distance. The sails flutter as they catch the wind. The breeze rustles through the prevalent tree line. Your sumptuous daily cruise sets you on the island shores and even beneath the tranquil current to view the angelfish and morays. Spotted eagle soar through the air. The fresh and elegant aroma of the sea drifts around you.

dayInfo.title: Tamarindo – The Calling Caves
dayInfo.description: The morning rises over the beachside and brings the current of the colorful ocean to life. The birds' twitter and tweet in the trees. The breeze brushes through the leaves. The day is once again yours to enjoy the majesty around Tamarindo. In the reaches of the Nicoya Peninsula are the Barra Honda caves. The grottoes run as deep as 787 feet into the earth. The limestone walls are cool and smooth to the touch. Stalactites hang down from the cavernous ceiling. Dripping water reverberates against the walls. The rocky outcrops rise, fall, and twist around the 42 different grottoes in the network of caves. In the cave labeled Terciopelo, you find a work of stone called “The Organ.” When stricken the stones produce a series of musical tones that resonate through the air; they call out like piano keys. The wonders of the cave give you deeper insight into the splendor of the landscape and the remarkable beauty all around you.

dayInfo.title: Liberia – East to West to Home
dayInfo.description: The images of turtles rushing towards the water in the evening light are strong in your mind. The sound of the current touching the shore fills the air. Savor the sweet and creamy pleasures of breakfast, from the star fruit to jackfruit. After breakfast, your private transfer will escort you to Liberia for your flight home. The luxuries of Costa Rica have brought you comfort. The sensual beauty of the landscape showed you majesty. You have seen the beauty of both wildlife and daily life on your lavish Costa Rican getaway.

tourName: Enchanting 7-Day Costa Rica Family Vacation
placesVisited: La Paz, Manuel Antonio, Arenal, Monteverde Cloud Forest
generalInfo: This luxurious 7-day journey combines three iconic destinations with adventures on volcanos, in the cloud forest, on Pacific beaches, and within wildlife refuges. Green, tranquil, wild, and full of wonder, Costa Rica is an enchanting destination for a family foray with a focus on interactive fun. Hot springs and bucolic lodges provide space to unwind, and private activities provide your family with much of the best of Costa Rica. Get ready to explore La Paz, Manuel Antonio National Park, Arenal, and Monteverde.

dayInfo.title: La Paz – Smothered in Cacao
dayInfo.description: Your Costa Rican vacation will begin the moment that you land in San Jose, and a nearby cacao plantation will be the perfect place to engage your kids immediately. You will be picked up at the airport by your driver and transferred to La Paz. Along the way, you will stop at an organic farm, where you can wander through the cacao bushes and wonder how such a bizarre plant can create such a delicious delicacy. From the cacao plantation, you will continue your journey to La Paz, which is a small destination that is surrounded by lush valleys. Here, your welcoming dinner will be complemented by traditional song and dance and a platter of local cuisine.

dayInfo.title: La Paz – Wonders of an Active Volcano
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will visit Poas Volcano National Park for a family treasure hunt on one of Central America’s most active volcanos. You do not need to worry because this is a very safe experience. Your local guide will lead you on an educational treasure hunt as you search for geological clues on the volcano, such as fumaroles and sulfur. After your scavenger hunt, lunch will be included at a nearby coffee plantation. Then, after eating, you can explore the organic farm, where you will follow the coffee-making process from bean to cup before sampling some of the finest coffee on the planet. You can all learn how to discern the coffee’s quality during a coffee cupping session.

dayInfo.title: Manuel Antonio National Park – Pacific Ocean Bliss
dayInfo.description: By staying in La Paz, you will have a short transfer to San Jose’s airport, where you will board a direct flight to Manuel Antonio National Park. During your time in the national park, you will be able to feel nature and the wonders of the wild while still enjoying a classic beach break. This afternoon will be at your leisure. Overlooking a golden beach, your hotel will be idyllically situated if you want to relax and not do much. In the late afternoon, your guide will lead you to the Pacific for a private catamaran cruise. Drinks and snacks will be served as you cruise along the national park coastline and enjoy a vibrant, Pacific sunset.

dayInfo.title: Manuel Antonio National Park – Costa Rican Wildlife
dayInfo.description: After a day on the beach, today will provide you with a day in nature, exploring the wildlife-rich trails of the remarkable Manuel Antonio National Park. As your adventure continues, you should look out for sloths as you walk, which are slow and baffling creatures that cling to tree trunks. The national park’s size is ideal for families, and you can walk just three miles and experience a stunning array of birds, mammals, and butterflies. After a morning of wildlife, the afternoon will be yours to spend at your leisure, so you can have the opportunity to spend more time on the Pacific beaches.

dayInfo.title: Arenal – Ziplining Through the Trees
dayInfo.description: After a relatively late start this morning, you will fly to Arenal. In Arenal, volcanos dominate the landscape, and you will touch down among the soaring mountains and forests of Costa Rica’s interior. After a private transfer and lunch at your resort, the afternoon adventure will reveal the wonders of Arenal’s forested slopes. First, you will travel by sky tram, ascending above the treetops to spectacular views of the water and canopy. You will travel up and then zoom back down via some of the world’s most exciting ziplining tracks. After a couple of short lines, you will continue your journey on a mix of high bridges and more ziplines. Your resort will have its own hot springs, and while these are also public, the entry price for non-staying guests keeps them serene and soothing.

dayInfo.title: Arenal – The Hanging Bridges of Monteverde
dayInfo.description: Your family fun will continue on a private adventure to Monteverde Cloud Forest Reserve. With the Arenal volcano peering down on you, you will cross Lake Arenal, which will prove to be a soothing, morning sight before a rugged track leads you into the clouds. Like yesterday, your experience today will be all about a unique way to explore. Narrow bridges connect enormous trees and hang down over the canopy, offering an idyllic view of the forest life. Hanging bridges are very safe and great for kids. They are like a giant adventure playground route in the midst of pure nature. After coming down for lunch, your local guide will show you the forest floor, where you will have the opportunity to witness more of Costa Rica’s rare animals.

dayInfo.title: Arenal – Intimate Wildlife Encounters
dayInfo.description: With a late-afternoon flight out of San Jose, you will have time for some more wide-eyed wonder before your exciting vacation comes to a close. This morning, your children come face to face with different monkeys and sloths. At a wildlife sanctuary the encounters are more guaranteed, so you can see any animal that is on your must-see list. From the sanctuary, you will be transferred to Arenal’s airport for the very short flight to San Jose and your onward connection.

tourName: Family Trip to Costa Rica in 7 Days
placesVisited: San Jose, Arenal, Golfo de Papagayo, Guanacaste Mountain Range, La Fortuna
generalInfo: Your customizable family tour of Costa Rica will take you deep into the rainforest for a fabulous river safari, and then along the azure waters of the tropical Pacific in search of passing humpback whales. The best family vacations inspire life-long memories and in which the kids explore exciting destinations with thrilling experiences, and these will embody the welcoming spirit of Costa Rican Pura Vida . Witness the volcanic peak of Arenal, wander the jungle terrain at night in search of active nocturnal wildlife, and relax on the gorgeous sands of the celebrated beaches of Guanacaste during your family-friendly Costa Rica vacation.

dayInfo.title: San Jose – Arrive in San Jose with an Introductory Tour of the Capital
dayInfo.description: The capital city of San Jose sits at the spiritual and physical heart of Costa Rica within the pleasant, mild climate of the Central Valley. Colonial grandeur rises along the distinct streets of the historical neighborhoods leading to the bustling aisles of Mercato Central and the immensity of the nine-story San Pedro Mall with 260 stores capturing the contemporary culture of the city. Before exploring it all, your family will arrive at Juan Santamaria International Airport, where your private transfer will greet you at customs and guide you through. You can take time to settle into the comforts of your luxury hotel near the epicenter of art galleries, colonial mansions, and museum collections. Your guide will greet you in the lobby eager to introduce your family to the splendors of San Jose beginning at the Museo de Jade. The fascinating gallery space spans five floors displaying 7,000 artifacts that have been preserved over the centuries. The kids will be engrossed with the stories of the native peoples who crafted the images of fertility goddesses, shamans, frogs, and snakes by hand. Your guide can point out the distinct Mayan influences on individual pieces, and your kids will likely pause at the stunning ceramic head with a dramatic row of serrated teeth that stand out from the surrounding precious stone images glinting in the soft light. After a quick pass through the museum, the indoor design of Mercado Central will keep any jet lag at bay as your eyes take in the range of local spices to coffee beans grown around the country, as well as vibrant produce like delicious mango and rich avocado. After a good wander around for initial impressions, an early night will be yours to settle in for the week. We work closely with the best Costa Rica tour operators to ensure that you have a fully personalized trip of a lifetime.

dayInfo.title: Arenal – Travel to Artisanal Sarchi and Discover Adventurous Arenal
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the aroma of freshly brewed coffee will fill the dining room with a rejuvenating aroma accompanied by the sweet citrus scent of fresh-squeezed orange juice. The colonial mansions around Plaza España highlight the wealth of former coffee plantation owners in the late 19th and early 20th centuries with architectural designs that imitate the Victorian prestige and the elegance of concrete art-deco aesthetics. The neighborhood will feel like an interactive art center with many of the aristocratic homes now containing hotels, cafes, restaurants, and offices. You will then travel to the town of Sarchi with your private driver for an overview of the artisan crafts for which the Central Valley is known. You will pass beneath the twin-towered church that soars over the village and visit the artists as they craft sensational wood furniture, leather goods, and the traditional ornate oxcarts that are a symbol of rural life in Costa Rica. The carts played a key role in the transport of goods to the markets during the country’s history, making the unique and ornate designs on the carts culturally and aesthetically meaningful. Markets in town heavily feature the works of local artists and showcase handmade bowls and sophisticated jewelry, stylish dressers, and rocking chairs ingrained with images of Costa Rican wildlife. The kids will marvel at the artisans as their painting and woodworking turn empty vessels into artwork before their eyes. You will continue to the base of Arenal Volcano in the eponymous town of Arenal, where your family can settle into the luxuries of your accommodations and the fantastic view of the volcano’s conical peak. The tropical jungle thrives in the rich minerals of the geothermal soil found along the Northern Highlands. To truly relax, you and the kids can visit the hot springs connected to your hotel and find a variety of pools with different temperatures, naturally heated by the subterranean volcanic activity with the hottest pool on the property reaching 102 degrees Fahrenheit.

dayInfo.title: Arenal – Enjoy a Rafting Excursion and Nocturnal Wildlife Tour
dayInfo.description: San Jose offered a glimpse of the contemporary culture of Costa Rica, and Sarchi provided an immersive touch of the artistic heritage of the country. You will next explore Arenal, which will deliver your first view of the pristine tropical rainforest and the remarkable biodiversity for which Costa Rica is famous. After breakfast, your guide will meet your family in the hotel lobby and whisk you to the banks of Penas Blancas River as it winds along the foothills of the Tilaran Mountains. Sections of the river hold high-class rapids, but you will board a raft along the pristine waters for an incredible wildlife viewing safari. Your guide will steer your raft as you listen to the chirping birds that are often interrupted by the guttural groan of howler monkeys. At first, the kids might think it is a predatory cat, but your guide can explain how the howler monkey call can echo through the trees for up to three miles. A bare-throated tiger-heron might perch on the edge of the brackish water remaining still as you pass. It can reach 32 inches tall and feeds on the insects and frogs hiding in the mud alongside the river. A troop of capuchin monkeys might scramble through the trees, and the kids will love watching the monkeys spring from the branches with their white fur standing out from the foliage. Their tails grow up to 22 inches long and help the monkeys balance along narrow branches and when reaching for distant foods like nuts and berries. At dusk, you will venture to a private reserve on which an owner has allowed the rainforest to regrow, which in turn has become new stomping grounds for some of Costa Rica’s captivating nocturnal wildlife. The kids will likely cling to your guide as you follow the marked paths searching for the numerous frog species hiding around the private reserve, hearing the high-pitched chirp of a dink frog and finding the bright blue, yellow, and orange markings of a red-eye treefrog clinging to an umbrella leaf.

dayInfo.title: Golfo de Papagayo – Visit Dry Tropical Forest with Family Leisure Time
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you will have a fantastic view of Arenal Volcano that stands 5,437 feet above sea level and looms over the edges of La Fortuna town, as well as the Arenal municipality’s green hillsides and lush rainforest. Before leaving for the drier coastal region of Guanacaste, your family will have the chance to visit La Fortuna Waterfall. A viewing platform looks out over the rushing whitewater in the distance and spills down the mountain 246 feet to the waiting pool below. You can walk with the kids down the more than 400 steps to reach the base of the falls where the crashing water sounds like thunder. The ribbon of water shines against the light with the spreading mist casting rainbows against the background of the rainforest’s verdant strands. After returning to your hotel, your private transfer will escort your family to the Gulf of Papagayo and your luxury accommodations overlooking the Pacific Ocean. A gorgeous pool provides panoramas that overlook the coastline, and a staircase offers direct access to the soft, golden sands of the gulf. The remainder of the day will be at your leisure to relax in the gorgeous views and family-friendly atmosphere of your hotel alongside the beauty of the Papagayo Gulf.

dayInfo.title: Golfo de Papagayo – Relish a Family Surf Lesson and Zip Line Tour
dayInfo.description: The morning will begin with your family taking to the sands of the gorgeous beaches along the Pacific Coast after breakfast. Your private surf instructor will greet you along the shoreline eager to begin your lesson for the day. Each family member will find their own handpicked surfboard on the sand, and you will learn how to pop up to your feet from the prone position. The scent of the salt water and the sound of the lapping waves make the experience more real as you watch the kids practice how to stand on their boards once more before taking to the water to try to catch their first ocean. The adventures of your day will continue in the afternoon with a zip line tour above the forest canopy. The exhilarating experience takes you up to 95 feet off the ground as you fly above and through the verdant trees with views spreading to the azure waters of the Pacific in the distance. You can hear the twittering birds around you while the cable hums as you glide through the air with the wind brushing against your cheeks. Your heart will race as you speed down the nearly mile-long course that takes you over a minute to reach the end of the line. After traversing the sky, you can take a deep breath in the butterfly garden to view some of the 1,200 types of butterflies found in Costa Rica, which accounts for 18 percent of the entire world’s butterfly population. The blue Morpho is one of the most popular butterflies to see due to its iridescent blue wings outlined with black tips. The butterfly is the largest in the world with a wingspan that is eight inches wide. The Glass Wing butterfly equally captivates your family due to its clear wings that are outlined with a crisp orange color resembling stained-glass.

dayInfo.title: Golfo de Papagayo – Discover the Enchanting Wilds of Guanacaste
dayInfo.description: The day will be at your family’s leisure to uncover the fascinating wilds of the Guanacaste region with either a whitewater rafting excursion through the Cañon de la Vieja or a hiking adventure along the trails of Rincón de la Vieja. For an experience distinctive to Guanacaste and the beauty of Costa Rica’s Pacific coast, you can board your boat after breakfast bound for the open ocean in search of passing whales and friendly dolphins. Costa Rica’s dry region of Guanacaste hosts the longest migration season of humpback whales during the year accounting for the pods traveling from the north between December and April or from the south between July and November. Nearer to the coastline, your guide can point to Olive Ridley turtles as they poke their heads out of the water as you pass. Eventually, you might notice a whale fin break the water’s surface, followed by the large head of a humpback slowly emerging. The whale can reach up to 52 feet long and is popular for its distinctive surface behaviors like leaping from the ocean. They migrate up to 16,000 miles each year feeding on krill and tiny fish populations. Viewing the whales in the wild is a memorable experience the family will share long after you return home from Costa Rica.

dayInfo.title: Golfo de Papagayo – Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: At breakfast, the kids will enjoy sharing their favorite excursion during your time in Costa Rica. The scent of coffee will add a refreshing aroma to morning air accentuated by the subtle sea breeze drifting across the hotel terrace. The kids will be able to impersonate the loud chirp of the dink frog during your nocturnal tour and might talk about their surf lesson, exaggerating their abilities to great fanfare.
