Your private transfer will soon meet your family in the hotel lobby after breakfast and escort you to the nearby Daniel Oduber International Airport in Liberia for your flight home, bringing a fun and luxurious end to your Costa Rica family vacation.

tourName: Handcrafted Costa Rica Tour: Finest Tropical Escape
placesVisited: Uvita, Arenal, Osa Peninsula, Manuel Antonio
generalInfo: Luxury and sustainability go hand-in-hand during your handpicked 11-day Costa Rica tour. Whether traveling as an adventurous family or looking for a romantic getaway, this featured tour offers endless options perfect for your needs, goals, and preferences. From sailing through the sky on a zipline or searching for elusive sloths, lounging on pristine beaches or relaxing in thermal springs, you will have the ultimate tour tailored to you.

dayInfo.title: Arenal - Arrive in View of Famous Arenal Volcano
dayInfo.description: Arenal is the perfect introduction to Costa Rica and will welcome you with protected lakes, lagoons, volcanoes, rivers, and waterfalls cast beneath the looming peak of Arenal Volcano. Your flight will land at San Jose’s Juan Santamaria International Airport, where your private transfer will meet you on arrival and take you to the fascinating landscape that embodies Costa Rica’s rich biodiversity. The remainder of the day will be at your leisure to bask in your hotel’s luxuries that highlight the idyllic location from spa services to yoga, stunning views to the sounds of the surrounding rainforest.

dayInfo.title: Arenal - Explore the Wilderness and Hot Springs
dayInfo.description: Each day is customizable to your needs and desired experiences in Costa Rica, allowing you to have as many exhilarating adventures or relaxing excursions as you would like. You may choose to embark on a private canyoning tour that takes you rappelling beside the rushing veils of three waterfalls. You might also opt to swing through the trees during a private canopy tour, a classic in Costa Rica, as you glide across 13 wires for the ultimate zipline excursion. You will feel the air brush your cheeks as you scan the treetops for signs of motmots or sloths. Late in the afternoon, your driver will pick you up for an evening spent at the hot springs, Enjoy the steamy water, created by volcanic rocks, and feel yourself relax into the beautiful night.

dayInfo.title: Arenal - Find Sloths and Walk Hanging Bridges
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you will travel to a private reserve and take to the half-mile trail lined with lush vegetation. The giant trees house a multitude of wildlife from lizards to frogs, as well as sloths. You may find the sloths clinging to the treetops with their fur helping them blend into the bark. If you choose, you can continue into the rainforest canopy to travel nearly two miles along a loop trail made of hanging bridges. The breathtaking views will sweep across the jungle where you may find signs of capuchins or hear the calls of passing tanagers. Return to your accommodations to enjoy the amenities and the peaceful surroundings of the rainforest.

dayInfo.title: Manuel Antonio - Travel and Enjoy Manuel Antonio
dayInfo.description: Your private transfer will meet you at the hotel after breakfast, ready to take you to the wonders of Manuel Antonio National Park. The scenic drive takes approximately four hours, but a flight from San Jose takes only 25 minutes, so you can determine which way you would like to travel. The park supports 109 mammal species and over 350 different plant species and is incredibly pretty. Upon your arrival, you can melt into the luxuries of your beachfront resort where the exotic flowers border the pristine shoreline, or you can devote yourself to the many water sports available. Spend the remainder of the day enjoying the Pacific view from your balcony, lounging on the beach, or visiting the small town of Manuel Antonio.

dayInfo.title: Manuel Antonio - Bask in a Private Wilderness Tour
dayInfo.description: A private tour of Manuel Antonio National Park will immerse you in the stunning contrasts of the jungle terrain and the white-sand beaches. The clear waters of the Pacific lap at the shoreline as if pointing into the trees where you can find abundant wildlife. Your guide will take you in search of the three species of monkeys where you may witness the guttural calls of howler monkeys that can be heard up to three miles away. You can also search for toucans with their colorful beaks standing out from the verdant treetops or three-toed sloth hugging the branches. Hike together at your pace, and stop for a treat of fresh fruits that will taste better than ever amid the spectacular natural beauty.

dayInfo.title: Manuel Antonio - Enjoy Kayaking and Snorkeling
dayInfo.description: Every day can bring a new experience of your choosing during your Costa Rica tour. Opt for a relaxing time on the beach, or consider a kayaking adventure beginning at Pez Vela Marina. Your guide will take you onto the ocean to find the rare coastal jewel of Biezans Bay. Your naturalist guide will point out the area’s rich biodiversity with colorful flora and exotic fauna, including marine life thriving in the coral reef systems. Nesting birds in Manuel Antonio National Park will stand out along the shorelines as you find large frigates and possible sightings of famous booby birds. Finish your paddle with a Costa Rican lunch near the beach before returning to your hotel for a relaxing evening.

dayInfo.title: Manuel Antonio - Experience the Surf and Leisure
dayInfo.description: The day is once again yours to experience the beauty and possibilities of Costa Rica and Manuel Antonio National Park. For an exciting activity perfect for travelers of all ages, you can spend the morning with a private surf lesson to learn. Before you try catching waves, your instructor will create a safe environment on the sand where you will learn the proper positions and posture before entering the water. After the lesson, you can return to your hotel and relax at your leisure or spend time lounging on the beach’s soft sands.

dayInfo.title: Osa Peninsula - Transfer to Adventurous Uvita
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, your private transfer will meet you for an hour-long journey to the Osa Peninsula. The unique landscape embodies some of the most biologically intense places on earth, creating a natural wonderland for endangered animals and birds. Your private driver will meet you at the hotel and escort you to the comforts of your remote villa near Uvita overlooking the Pacific Coast. You can visit the celebrated dining area for dinner, where you will have a 360-degree view sweeping from jungle to ocean.

dayInfo.title: Osa Peninsula - Delight in a Horseback Excursion
dayInfo.description: Costa Rica’s beauty stems from the natural wonders of biodiversity with Rancho La Merced National Wildlife Refuge capturing the rainforest, mangroves, and waterside setting perfectly. You can enjoy a half-day excursion on horseback through the reserve with a knowledgeable guide as you pass the serene rivers and ride along the waters lapping against the Pacific shoreline. You may find signs of the elusive blue-crowned motmots during your ride, the only motmot found in Costa Rica’s southern Pacific. The remainder of the day is yours to explore Uvita, lounge at the pool, or hike to the stunning Nauyaca waterfalls. Enjoy a quiet evening with a private dinner in your villa.

dayInfo.title: Osa Peninsula - Indulge in the Hidden Beaches
dayInfo.description: The day is yours to bask in the luxuries of the whale coast with a private beach-hopping tour. Your boat will meet you after breakfast and take you to a combination of famous and remote beaches where you can dig your toes into powdery sands. As you travel between beaches, you can keep an eye out for passing dolphins before relaxing at the likes of Playa Dominicalito or the remote ambiance of Playa Matapalo. The unspoiled nature of the coastline will combine the serene sounds of the waves with the adventurous character of capuchin monkeys rummaging through the bordering trees.

dayInfo.title: Osa Peninsula - Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you can spend time indulging in the tropical and luxurious aromas of the resort that may blend the decadent scent of fresh coffee with the citrus fragrance of lime or luscious hints of fresh mango. After breakfast, you will have a private transfer to the Quepos Airport for your brief flight to San Jose’s domestic airstrip, where a private transfer will meet you and escort you to the international airport bringing a luxurious end to your exceptional Costa Rica tour.

tourName: Intimate 8-Day Costa Rica Tour for Couples
placesVisited: Guanacaste, Bijagua, La Fortuna, Catarata del Toro, San Jose
generalInfo: From romantic river rides to waterfalls and brunch, this is the ideal 8-day journey through Costa Rica for couples. Costa Rica is where private plunge pools are situated on beautiful beaches, and indulgent spas hide in cloud forests. Explore Pacific Guanacaste, walk hand in hand on Tenorio Volcano, lounge in the hot springs of La Fortuna, and gaze upon Catarata del Toro. Featuring wildlife, waterfalls, and plenty of spas, this is a private getaway that is designed just for two.

dayInfo.title: Guanacaste – Beach Escape
dayInfo.description: After flying into Liberia’s International Airport, you will be met by a local guide for the short transfer to Guanacaste, which is Costa Rica’s Pacific beach hangout. Your suite will be perched above the sand and will feature a private plunge pool with Pacific views. As the sky turns purple and pink, you will cruise in the wind to explore some calm Pacific Ocean waters. This is an afternoon for popping a cork and toasting to yourselves while Costa Rica’s colors lead you on a journey through all the hues and shades. Most couples prefer to sail on the wind, but you can choose for the captain to use the motor, which allows you to cover more of the coastline.

dayInfo.title: Guanacaste – Private Plunge Pool
dayInfo.description: Today has been left completely free. In a destination like this, you do not need to make a plan. You can wake up late and order breakfast to your balcony. A private plunge pool will be waiting for you for, especially after the sun has gone down. Guanacaste’s white beaches are perfect for a hand in hand stroll and will have you gazing out on the volcanic forest. Stay on the quieter side of Guanacaste, so you will not come across many other people although there are still a few beach shacks and bars to stop at on any walk. Various activities can be arranged after you arrive in Guanacaste, and these can be tailored to your mood.

dayInfo.title: Bijagua – Hideaway on Rio Celeste
dayInfo.description: Volcanoes will provide you with a backdrop as you ascend into the cloud forest this morning. The beach time will be over, and you will have an hour and a half private transfer to Bijagua, which is a charming village in a spellbinding location. Today will be flexible, so you can choose whether to spend another day on the beach or venture to Bijagua to explore Miravalles Volcano. While the crowds descend on Arenal Volcano, Miravalles has stayed off the beaten track. You can indulge in a stroll upon its trails, and you can find natural hot springs, hidden waterfalls, and the opportunity to walk around a crater. Your accommodation will be on the edge of Bijagua village, which is at a boutique lodge with uninterrupted views toward the volcanoes.

dayInfo.title: Bijagua – Tenorio Volcano National Park
dayInfo.description: Tenorio Volcano National Park is Costa Rica’s next big destination. It was mostly undiscovered until 2018, but a long-term infrastructure project has created an asphalt road that runs to the park gate. Now, they have imposed quotas on visitors in order to maintain a quiet visitor experience. After a leisurely breakfast at your lodge, your guide will outline a number of different options for the day. There are many ways to explore this national park, and it all depends on how far you want to walk and what you want to see. Celeste Waterfall has become the iconic highlight, and it is a breathtaking experience that will lead you through dense rainforest to find an azure-colored cataract.

dayInfo.title: La Fortuna – Waterfalls and Volcanoes
dayInfo.description: La Fortuna is Costa Rica’s most famous destination and has come to define the country’s visitor experience. Here, forest trails lead to crater lakes, and there are so many natural attractions that you can get lost just thinking about them. Such a magnificent, natural scene attracts plenty of visitors, but there are still plenty of places where you can be alone in La Fortuna. After a private transfer from Bijagua, you can choose from a wide variety of afternoon activities. Your guide will explain your options, which will include a short hike to a crater lake, ziplining in the cloud forest, and strolling to some romantic viewpoints upon Arenal Volcano’s slopes.

dayInfo.title: La Fortuna – Romantic River Safari
dayInfo.description: This reserve is one of the most accessible places for intimate encounters with Costa Rica’s wildlife. You can encounter the full variety of animals in a relatively small space, and best of all, you do not need to walk or drive anywhere. You can drift down a river in a raft, occasionally paddling so you are cruising in the right direction. A river safari will be perfect for immersing yourself with Costa Rica’s iconic species. You can be silent on the water, so the animals do not perceive you as a threat. On walking safaris, the wildlife sometimes stays away from the trails because they are more open and provide fewer places to hide.

dayInfo.title: Catarata del Toro – Remote Spa Relaxation
dayInfo.description: After a relaxed morning, you will have an hour and a half drive to Catarata del Toro, which is a small town that acts as a gateway to the waterfall that shares the same name. Your lodge for tonight will be complete with its own spa, which is a feature that you will come to expect during your vacation in Costa Rica. After checking-in to your hotel, your guide will lead you through a small park to the waterfall for an activity that will absorb most of the afternoon. After entering the park, you will first explore gardens that come to life with hummingbirds. Venturing to the waterfall requires a steep descent, but there are many superb viewpoints along the way, so you can stop regularly and marvel at Catarata del Toro from many perspectives.

dayInfo.title: San Jose – Departure
dayInfo.description: It will be less than 50 miles to San Jose and your outbound flight, so that leaves time for a leisurely start to your day and an indulgent brunch in the old-world city center. You will dine in style at a restaurant of faded colonial grandeur, which will be a final treat to celebrate your eight days in Costa Rica. Afterward, you will be escorted to the airport for your flight home.

tourName: Luxuries of Costa Rica: Premier 9-Day Tour
placesVisited: San Jose, Tortuguero National Park, Tenorio Volcano National Park, Monteverde, Manuel Antonio National Park
generalInfo: Handcrafted with unique experiences and luxurious lodges, this 9-day tour celebrates much of the best that the country has to offer. Epic landscapes and a beautiful sense of tranquility fuse to make Costa Rica an idyllic destination during any month of the year. Explore remote cloud forests, soar in a helicopter above volcanos, witness sea turtle hatchlings, and experience pure solitude on two different coastlines. From cultural impressions to pure nature, this is the ultimate Costa Rica tour.

dayInfo.title: San Jose – Intimate Cultural Impressions
dayInfo.description: Costa Rica is a tropical destination that has something for everyone. After being greeted at the airport and transferred to your luxurious accommodation in the heart of the city, you will soon be immersed in San Jose’s delicate charms. As architecture and atmosphere set the scene, you will be immersed in San Jose’s culture. A local guide will lead you on a walking tour of the city past the key monuments and down the main streets before concluding in a place of storytellers and entertainers. While sipping on drinks, you can listen to tales of the country’s past before an evening of dance and dining at a small restaurant.

dayInfo.title: Tortuguero National Park – Nesting Sea Turtles
dayInfo.description: After a short domestic flight, you will land next to Caribbean waters and have some free time to rest on the beach. Your lodge will be perched on the water, and your local guide can lead you to remote beaches that are only accessible by boat. Sea turtles nest on the golden sand for eight months of the year, and four different species come to lay their eggs on the different beaches. It is only after dark that you can see the hatchlings on a private and intimate tour led by a local conservationist. You should note that you can customize the day further with snorkeling and scuba diving excursions.

dayInfo.title: Tortuguero National Park – Beautiful Wildlife Cruise
dayInfo.description: While marine life and tropical scenes dominate the coast, most of Tortuguero’s wildlife is inland. Deep inside the forest, you can find snakes, lizards, and sloths that hang down from the branches. Tortuguero’s monkeys are heard more than they are seen, and their boisterous calls echo around a tightly packed network of waterways and dense bush. After your boat cruise, you can indulge in a nature walk. You will not see quite as much when walking because wildlife can hear you coming. The afternoon will be at your leisure, so you can return to the beaches or take another rainforest walk before a second wildlife cruise in the late afternoon.

dayInfo.title: Tenorio Volcano National Park – An Iconic Volcano
dayInfo.description: Today, you will touch down in La Fortuna before being whisked off on a full-day tour of Arenal, which is Costa Rica’s most famous volcano. Walking trails will reveal hidden waterfalls and gushing springs, and heading deeper into the forest will reveal the volcano’s cone as it peers down imperiously. To customize this experience further, you can also indulge in some mountain biking in the park. Traveling by helicopter will allow you to peer into the crater and to admire how green landscapes extend along the slopes. Rather than staying in the touristic La Fortuna, the helicopter will transfer you to Tenorio Volcano and a national park that has only just opened to visitors.

dayInfo.title: Tenorio Volcano National Park – An Eco-Adventure
dayInfo.description: While Arenal is Costa Rica’s most famous volcano and destination, Tenorio remains off the radar because it used to be inaccessible. That has changed with the construction of a new road, but authorities continue to limit the number of daily visitors, so the authenticity of the wilderness is preserved. Today will be fully customizable to your interests, and the highlight, regardless of what you do, will be a feeling of exclusivity and tranquility in this incredible national park. There is a zipline that you can try, plus the chance to explore on a nocturnal walk, which is a time when the wildlife is usually more active.

dayInfo.title: Monteverde – Evening Nature Walk
dayInfo.description: Today will be all about the journey, and you will travel by river, road, and lake to Monteverde. First, in a white-water raft, you will negotiate rapids and glide down the Rio Celeste, finding a place of absolute solitude until you hear monkeys that call from the trees. As cliffs towers above, you may think the Celeste never ends, but it casually opens back to civilization, which is where you will continue by road. After crossing a lake, you will ascend into the clouds in Monteverde. Above the clouds, you will find a delightful lodge with suites that are practically in the forest canopy. To experience more intimate encounters with the local wildlife, you will venture out on a nighttime walk, traveling along trails in search of Costa Rica’s nocturnal creatures.

dayInfo.title: Monteverde – Hiking and Ziplining
dayInfo.description: By staying in Monteverde, you can be in Santa Elena Cloud Forest not long after your first flight. You will be among the first in the reserve, so you can zip through the canopy and ascend above the trees before the day-trippers arrive from La Fortuna. After zipping through the canopy and wandering across the hanging bridges, you will be returned to the lodge by mid-morning. Midday is too hot to be exploring anyway, so you can take your time over lunch before going back to the forest in the mid-afternoon. A local guide will lead you to wildlife research stations that are far from the main trails to continue your adoration of Costa Rica’s animals.

dayInfo.title: Manuel Antonio National Park – Scenic Helicopter Tour
dayInfo.description: After a few days of intimate encounters, from howler monkeys to quetzals, today’s exclusive experience will be all about scale. Soaring above Costa Rica on a private helicopter tour, you will discover a spectacular landscape of volcanoes, forests, and beaches. The route will lead you around the country’s interior before flying toward the Pacific Coast for a lunchtime picnic at a remote beach. The afternoon’s flight will be entirely coastal. You will experience a fusion of blue water and green landscapes before touching down near Manuel Antonio National Park.

dayInfo.title: Manuel Antonio National Park – Departure
dayInfo.description: Tiny Manuel Antonio National Park is full of biodiversity, including different monkey and sloth species. You can enjoy the park on the self-guided walking trails before having some time to relax on the beach. In the late afternoon, you will be transferred to the airport for your outbound flight, and a representative will assist you in San Jose for your change of aircraft.

tourName: Off-the-Beaten-Path Costa Rica Family Tour
placesVisited: Turrialba, Puerto Viejo, Tortuguero National Park
generalInfo: Connect with the indigenous culture and explore wildlife-filled nature during this adventurous 7-day family journey through Costa Rica. Featuring local experiences and beautiful off-the-beaten-path locations, this handcrafted tour will show you the natural splendor Costa Rica, which is a land of authentic and often surprising scenes. Meet Bribri Indians, savor a cultural farm-stay experience, paddle through the jungle in search of monkeys, and search for sea turtles on Caribbean beaches.

dayInfo.title: Turrialba – Costa Rica’s Volcano Heartland
dayInfo.description: Costa Rica’s volcanic heartlands epitomize the local saying of Pura Vida . This is a country that instantly seems exotic and new but is also quick to make you feel at home. Today’s experiences will be customizable and can be adjusted after you arrive, depending on how you feel. The journey to Turrialba will lead you by Poas and Turrialba, which are two volcanoes that offer a superb variety of hiking trails. By trekking through forests, you can search for quetzals and waterfalls. It is also possible for your guide to drive you to Poas’s summit, where you can admire fumaroles, mini geysers, and mud that spits and surges.

dayInfo.title: Turrialba – Cultural Exchange on a Farm
dayInfo.description: Today, you will be immersed in the Costa Rican farming lifestyle with a full-day cultural exchange. Exact activities can be tailored based on your interests, and the general idea will be to gain an authentic insight into local rural life. Learning local production methods can be fascinating, but today can also include visiting stables and animal pens with activities, such as gathering eggs and brushing horses. Discovering organic coffee is likely to be part of your day, and you can follow the process from bean to cup. From seeds and crops, drying and roasting, and grinding and packing, you can explore how small decisions have an enormous impact on the final product.

dayInfo.title: Puerto Viejo – Sloths and Howler Monkeys
dayInfo.description: Your drives will feel like you are on an adventure rather than just a transfer between destinations. As green pastures set the scene, you will be bumping along country roads to Puerto Viejo with stops at charming villages along the way. With a private journey to Puerto Viejo, you can make many other stops along the way. Before settling onto a quiet Caribbean beach, you will spend a portion of the afternoon in the Jaguar Rescue Center. Here, your children can get up-close with rehabilitated and rescued animals, and you can watch how a creature can create such wide-eyed amazement in your kids.

dayInfo.title: Puerto Viejo – Indigenous Jungle Experience
dayInfo.description: Today, you will travel down the Yorkin River in a canoe, which will be an enchanting 90-minute journey that demonstrates how much of Costa Rica remains untouched. After being introduced to the indigenous community, you will be guided to some natural pools for a refreshing swim before being provided with a traditional Bribri lunch that will teach you about different elements of the local culture. The afternoon will include palm thatch weaving, archery, learning the Bribri language, and tasting homemade chichi , which is a fermented corn drink.

dayInfo.title: Tortuguero National Park – Encounters with Hatchling Sea Turtles
dayInfo.description: After a short journey to Limon, flying to Tortuguero will save you valuable vacation time. After settling in to your opulent accommodation, your family will go searching for sea turtles. Four different species nests in the area, including leatherbacks that weigh up to 1.5 tons. On a small boat, you will then explore tranquil Caribbean waters. Snorkeling is wonderful here, and your guide will select places based on the abilities and ages of your kids. The real highlight will come after dark. Walking the beaches with a flashlight can feel like a treasure hunt as the roving light seeks out hatchlings on their wild dash to the water.

dayInfo.title: Tortuguero National Park – Jungle Canoe Ride
dayInfo.description: A canoe ride will be the best way to explore, and it is also an ideal activity for families with kids of all ages. Everyone can have the chance to paddle, but you can also just sit back and explore without needing to walk and brave the insects. Traveling in a canoe is slow and silent, which also means you can get really close to the animals. Caimans and otters often peek above the water as they swim from bank to bank. Lizards typically bask on the riverbanks, and the sight of a manatee may add another dimension to your excursion. It is best to ride early in the morning because the wildlife is more active.

dayInfo.title: Tortuguero National Park – Departure
dayInfo.description: After a short river ride, you will fly out of Tortuguero National Park. The domestic flight will touch down in San Jose, where a local representative will meet you and ensure that you are comfortably transferred to your international flight.

tourName: Off the Beaten Path for Families: 8-Day Costa Rica Vacation
placesVisited: San Jose, Puerto Jimenez, Poas Volcano National Park, Corcovado National Park, Osa Peninsula, Caño Island
generalInfo: Volcanic craters simmer and bubble against the pristine blue sky, fish and manta rays swim around vivacious coral reefs and toucans soar across the rainforest canopy. This 8-day adventure in nature is a custom-tailored Costa Rican vacation that will take you deep into the heart of the jungle and follow trails that edge the coastline. This family-friendly vacation provides time together on a captivating adventure for kids and parents alike.

dayInfo.title: San Jose - Family Gets Together
dayInfo.description: Mountains encompass the Central Valley where you find the capital city of San Jose. Jovial people and colorful murals that represent everyday life fill animated streets. Colonial mansions decorate the historic neighborhoods of Amon. Your transfer will meet you at the airport and escort the family to a luxurious and comfortable hotel in the heart of the city. The day is yours to enjoy the city, such as the Central Market where the family can find over 200 stalls organized to create endless rows of shops. The colors of tropical fruits may create a virtual rainbow of produce.

dayInfo.title: Osa Peninsula - The Southern Peninsula
dayInfo.description: Transfer in the morning for a quick flight to Drake Airport. Upon landing, your guide and transfer will meet you at the airport and take you into the remote reaches of the countryside to the edge of the Agujitas River. The emerald water has a calm current. Step onto the boat and the family drifts downstream until you reach your eco-lodge. The canopy hides the wooden edifice. You can continue the day's adventure by ziplining through the canopy. When you rise, the trees, the canopy, and the rolling hillsides open themselves up to you. You can climb up to 196 feet in the air and travel across 50 acres of rainforest.

dayInfo.title: Osa Peninsula - Marvels in Sapphire
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, your family will set out on a boat ride to Caño Island to find hot white-sand beaches lined with palm trees, and shimmering with coral reefs. The warm water makes the habitat a virtual paradise for a range of dolphins and passing whales. Spinner Dolphins tend to burst from the ocean and flip in the air. They can grow almost eight feet long and tend to have a white or pale gray belly. When you return to the peninsula, you can relax on the beach as the kids venture off to snorkel.

dayInfo.title: Osa Peninsula - Discovering the Rainforest
dayInfo.description: Embark on a short boat ride to the San Pedrillo Ranger Station. The station sits on the northern edge of Corcovado National Park. The canopy shades the forest floor and filters in the sunlight. The sapphire water of the Pacific borders the front of the station and the rainforest borders the back. The water laps at the beach with serene calm. Your naturalist guide takes you along the beachside trails that wind through mangroves and montane forests. You may arrive at a waterfall to find a thunderous clap of the water hitting the lower pool.

dayInfo.title: Puerto Jimenez - The Sweet Gulf
dayInfo.description: In the afternoon, your private transfer will take you to the city of Puerto Jimenez, located at the edge of Golfo Dulce. Scarlet Macaws roost on the crossbar of the local soccer field. Their vibrant red plumage shines against the background of green grass. Their tail feathers dangle behind them like streamers to a length of around half their entire size. The remainder of the day is at your leisure to spend at the Gold Mining experience or to witness the bioluminescence of the waters on a night kayaking tour when the water shimmers with remarkable light.

dayInfo.title: Poas Volcano National Park - Looking Inside the Crater
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, you return to San Jose on a quick flight and continue northward to Poas Volcano National Park. The lush rainforest trees frame the park’s entryway. The family eagerly traverses the hillside in search of the volcano’s summit. When you reach the top, you find the open sky filled with nearby and distant fertile mountaintops. Poas volcanic crater is before you. The summit stands at around 8,885 feet above sea level. Botos Lake sits at the center of the sprouting trees. The stunning scenery and spirited volcanic activity are enchanting. The raw power of the landscape is inspiring.

dayInfo.title: Poas Volcano National Park - Peace, Colors, and Waterfalls
dayInfo.description: La Paz Waterfall Gardens is located on the slopes of the Poas volcanic region and rich in biodiversity. The altitude undulates between 4,000 and 5,000 feet above sea level bringing together cloud forest and rainforest in a tightly knit environment. The waterfall gardens encompass 70 acres of protected landscape. A collection of atriums house plants, butterflies, and monkeys. Hummingbirds flutter around the trees and sip nectar out of the birdfeeders. Their plumage is iridescent in the Central Highlands sunshine. You can view the falls from the side and near the mouth of the cascade as spray rises from the pool.

dayInfo.title: San Jose - Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: The sun rises over the mountains and layers the sky with morning light. Savor the flavors of breakfast and the view of the hotel’s central garden. Tropical fruits grace the table with sweet aromas and creamy textures. Rich Costa Rican coffee helps start the day with a flavorful boost. The kids even eat the once unfamiliar dishes that they now seem to enjoy. The family has traversed the edges of the countryside, wandered through the rainforest and around volcanic peaks. Soon your private transfer will take you to the airport.

tourName: One-Week Costa Rica Adventure Tour for Couples
placesVisited: Arenal, Tortuguero, Osa Peninsula
generalInfo: By including Caribbean escapism, Pacific Ocean bliss, and the rainforest canopy, this luxurious, 7-day tour captures the three essential elements of a Costa Rica adventure for couples. Handcrafted with domestic flights and private activities, this one-week tour will celebrate the unspoiled allure of Costa Rica, including hidden beaches, volcanic hot springs, hanging bridges, and sea turtles. It will provide you with a getaway from the world, where wildlife sings an evening lullaby and luxury radiates from your private locations.

dayInfo.title: Arenal – Private Hot Springs
dayInfo.description: After a meet and greet service at Juan Santamaria International Airport, you will be transferred to Arenal. You should note that of San Jose’s two international airports, Juan Santamaria is better as it is located on the Arenal side of the capital city. You will check-in to your lodge, where you will have a two-hour couple’s treatment in the spa. This will still leave some time for free exploration in the surrounding rainforest. Trails set out directly from your lodge, and you do not need a guide to explore these mostly private sections of Arenal. Your main highlight will likely be the hot springs. Although the Arenal area is famous for its therapeutic waters, only a couple of lodges have private hot springs.

dayInfo.title: Arenal – Hanging Bridges and a Volcano
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, your local guide will discuss different hiking options with you in addition to some other activities that you may wish to try, such as ziplining or horseback riding. A legendary experience can be found high in the treetops: wandering upon hanging bridges that provide you with a bird’s-eye view of an immaculate landscape. On today’s tour, you can traverse the slopes of a volcano. After a customizable day of touring, you will have more time to enjoy your lodge, hot springs, and gardens.

dayInfo.title: Tortuguero – The Caribbean Coast
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will fly to the Caribbean coast before transferring to Tortuguero National Park, which is a wilderness area that is best navigated by boat and canoe. Your lodge will be more than 100 miles from the nearest town, and the coastline is inaccessible by road. Tortuguero is famous for sea turtles. You will be staying at a luxury lodge that is located directly on the water. As you are staying in the wilderness, all meals will be included at the lodge and can be served to your room. After checking-in to your lodge, a local guide will explain different activity options to you. You can spend some alone time at the beach, traverse narrow creeks in small boats, or venture on some short hikes.

dayInfo.title: Tortuguero �– Wildlife Encounters and Connections
dayInfo.description: With a full day in Tortuguero, you can discover much of the best of Caribbean Costa Rica. After traveling inland along the rivers, you can stop at a small Afro-Caribbean village. From the village, you can travel around another few river bends to Tortuguero Beach, where hundreds of sea turtles lay their eggs, and a conservation program is helping to ensure the survival of a new generation. Today’s program will be flexible, and you can adjust the activities to your mood. It will be worth exploring creeks in the morning before the midday heat takes hold. You may also want to indulge in an expedition to a hidden rainforest waterfall or to spend an afternoon drinking cocktails around the pool.

dayInfo.title: Osa Peninsula – Pacific Ocean Seclusion
dayInfo.description: After crossing Tortuguero River by boat, you will fly across Costa Rica to the Osa Peninsula. Your lodge will be located inside Corcovado National Park. From your suite, your views will be entirely uninterrupted. These views can also feature the onsite spa, and after checking in, you will enjoy a couple’s treatment in the spa, which will prove to be an excellent way to fill the hotter hours of the day before having the afternoon at your leisure. There are some stunning beaches within easy reach of the lodge, including two that can be visited on a self-guided rainforest trail. Today, you will find pure seclusion amid a landscape of tropical colors and evocative sounds.

dayInfo.title: Osa Peninsula – Natural Splendor
dayInfo.description: During your full day in the national park, you can explore in many different directions. The activities will be customized to your interests and are best arranged after you arrive, so they can be tailored around your prevailing mood. You can indulge in a stroll along the Carbonera River with a local guide before swimming beneath the falls. The Osa Walk rainforest trail is an excellent choice for a self-guided hike because most of it is well signposted. A stay in Corcovado always involves some beach time, and you can visit different stretches of sand, including small bays that are concealed by overhanging forest and what remains of an ancient cliff line.

dayInfo.title: San Jose – Departure
dayInfo.description: After a final breakfast and spa session in Costa Rica, you will be transferred to the airport for a domestic flight back to San Jose. Here, you will be assisted in transferring to international departures for your outbound flight.

tourName: One-Week Costa Rica Itinerary: Nature & Culture
placesVisited: San Jose, Tortuguero, Arenal
generalInfo: The charming wildlife and stunning jungle terrain have shaped a fascinating heritage that will be revealed during your customizable tour of the history and culture of Costa Rica. Whether viewing the splendor of the rainforest��’s ancient life or finding artifacts of the pre-Columbian peoples, you will wander through a wide range of national preserves that protect the natural evolution of diverse flora and abundant fauna. Watch for turtles returning to the Caribbean shores, glide through the air on a zipline for views over the wild jungle canopy, and relax in soothing hot springs while experiencing Costa Rica’s important blend of natural and recorded histories.

dayInfo.title: San Jose – Arrive in Costa Rica’s Capital for a Cultural Introduction
dayInfo.description: Costa Rica’s capital of San Jose will embody the culture of the surrounding country while also showcasing a timeline of the heritage from inside the museums and along the distinctive neighborhoods. Your flight will land at Juan Santamaria International Airport, where your private transfer will greet you upon arrival and will escort you to the comforts of your luxury hotel. Arriving early in San Jose will provide ample time to explore the city’s fascinating history with the private company of a guide, beginning with the Plaza de la Cultura . Locals will enjoy the public square at the heart of the city where vendors will also offer food and drinks to passersby. Children will enjoy the refreshing ice cream cones and impressive acts by jugglers. Underneath the concrete plaza stands the celebrated Museo de Oro Precolombino y Numismática , which hosts priceless artifacts, including pieces of pre-Columbian gold and contemporary art. The galleries are held within a vault and are owned by the Banco Central, who display a substantial collection of artifacts. Amulets, figurines, and earrings shine in the soft light of the museum, providing a glimpse into the historical importance of gold to the pre-Columbian peoples of Costa Rica. Your guide will bring you to the figure of El Guerrero, which is a life-sized, golden warrior that is embellished with lavish ornaments.

dayInfo.title: Tortuguero – Enjoy Scenic Travel to the Caribbean Town of Tortuguero
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the scents of sweet mango and pineapple will fill the dining room of your hotel before fading beneath the aroma of freshly brewed coffee. The Central Market will brim with activity as more than 200 shops open for the day featuring colorful fruits, delicious vegetables, and refreshing coffees. You can also buy many other crafts from vendors such as cowboy saddles, fragrant flowers, and many other trinkets and souvenirs one can imagine. Your private transfer will greet you at the hotel after breakfast eager to escort you Eastward to the secluded Caribbean town of Tortuguero. The scenic drive will take you through a portion of Braulio Carrillo National Park, a protected area of 108,000 acres with an active volcanic peak. Traveling through the national park will offer insight into the marvelous biodiversity for which Costa Rica is known as you will see a small portion of the 6,000-plant species growing in the diverse terrain that also support over 500 different species of birds. The banana plantations along the drive will give way to the mangrove forest and canals that block the roads from reaching Tortuguero. You will board the long, skinny boat along the edge of the mainland and snake through the rivers and canals alongside the verdant rainforest. The sounds of twittering birds will echo through the trees. The journey to Tortuguero will be almost as fascinating as the village itself. The village is nestled between the Caribbean sandbar and the dense rainforest. Coconut and cocoa plantations border the outskirts of the village streets and local fishers often return to the shore resting their boats along the beach. In the evening, your guide will meet you at the hotel and lead you to the shoreline between the months of March and October to view the annual nesting season of sea turtles. You will have to wear dark clothes to avoid disrupting the turtles. The warm evening will fill with a refreshing sea breeze as you wander along one of the town’s beaches, which is considered the world’s most important turtle nesting site. The Green Turtle can weight more than 400 pounds and lay nearly 700 eggs per season.

dayInfo.title: Tortuguero – Traverse the Marvelous Protected Canals of Tortuguero
dayInfo.description: You will set out with your private guide in the morning onto the canals that lead away from the village to explore the 194 square miles of protected coastal park. The waterway spread inward from the Caribbean Sea and encompasses one of the wettest regions in all of Costa Rica. You will pass alongside the banana plantations before the dense jungle terrain envelopes the canal that supports more than 300 different bird species, including hawks, falcons, and cuckoos. Your guide will quickly point out a basilisk lizard as they are very common and unique to the region. These lizards can grow up to two and a half feet long, including their tail. Traveling along the remote, watery landscape will offer a feeling of adventure and discovery as you search through the trees while you glide deeper beneath the canopy. Jaguars and pumas will hunt on the protected grounds at night, and peacocks will graze during the day. Along the shoreline, you will also find alligators cooling their bodies down in the water. They will stay away from the boat but possess a dominating presence. You will then turn your eyes from the banks to the trees in order to find a troop of the endangered Geoffroy’s spider monkeys. They live in packs of up to 42 members and use their prehensile tails to balance as they travel through the forest canopy. They can grow up to 25 inches with their tail growing longer than their body. Viewing wildlife in its natural habitat has an enchanting effect that will allow you to witness ways in which the monkeys forage, travel, and even interact with their fellow white-headed capuchin monkey.

dayInfo.title: Arenal – Venture to the Historic Arenal for a Scenic Volcano Hike
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the aroma of fresh coffee will fade beneath the refreshing scent of the Caribbean Sea. The butterflies in the observational garden will flutter around the leaves and tree trunks as they feed on the nectar. Monarch butterflies will glow with iridescent blue hues along their wings that can stretch up to four inches wide. After breakfast, you will travel back along the water to meet your private transfer, who will escort you to the captivating region of Arenal. The summit will soar above the landscape at 5,479 feet above sea level, and the lush greenery of the landscape will shimmer along the edges of Lake Arenal. Resorts, boutique shops, and charming Caféswill emerge from the beneath the rainforest canopy to offer marvelous views of emerald scenery and access to the celebrated natural thermal springs that decorate the region. You will enjoy the comforts of your hotel before meeting your guide for an easy hike along the trails of Arenal National Park. The protected landscape surrounds 26,692 acres that overtake stunning lava fields, pristine forests, and volcanic peaks. You will wander along the Lava Flow Trail where the surrounding greenery opens to a clearing of lava rocks that will resemble a lunar landscape. The boulders will embody the history of the 1968 eruption when rocks shot into the air at speeds of up to 1,200 miles per hour. The trail will provide a panoramic view across the rugged black rocks and healthy forest that is crowned by the idyllic peak of the volcano for a perfect introduction to the region.

dayInfo.title: Arenal – Delight in a ZipLine and Rainforest Canopy Excursion
dayInfo.description: The day will begin with an adventure to uncover the life and history of the rainforest canopy during your exciting zipline excursion. You will soar through the sky as you fly along seven cables that reach a total of 2,460 feet in length. The wind will rush against your cheeks as you speed over the canyon and touch the edges of the mountain slopes. You will search the treetops for wildlife that rests between the leaves, hopefully noticing a resting sloth or two. Your guide will explain that the most common sloth in Costa Rica is the brown-throated sloth, which can grow up to 31 inches long. Their gray and brown fur helps them blend into the trees to avoid predation of circling harpy eagles or passing jaguars. Your exploration of the canopy will continue with a tour along the famous hanging bridges that consist of a two-and-a-half-mile trail, offering unique views of the diverse rainforest ecosystem. The suspension bridges will connect to the mountainous trails for a distinc view of flora and fauna. Your guide will point out a colorful keel-billed toucan that perches in the trees and forages for nuts. Their beaks are famous for their marvelous yellow, orange, lime, and pale blue colors that are topped with a crimson tip that contrasts with their black plumage. A flock may call out with shrill chirps at altitudes of up to 3,937 feet above sea level. In the afternoon, you will return to the cozy ambiance of your resort and indulge in the soothing waters of the natural thermal springs that are connected to the property. The geothermal activity beneath the landscape heats the springs that filter through the foothills and valleys, creating pools with temperatures reaching 105 degrees Fahrenheit. The rich minerals from the volcanic soil seep into the waters providing medicinal properties, moisturizing dry skin, and soothing aching muscles.

dayInfo.title: Arenal – Visit a Chocolate Plantation and Search for Nocturnal Wildlife
dayInfo.description: Your guide will meet you at the hotel after breakfast eager to introduce you to one of Latin America’s most important native species: the cocoa tree. During a fascinating chocolate tour on a plantation that hosts approximately 300 trees, you will follow your guide through the property to learn about the history of cacao in Latin America and its popular growth in Europe after the arrival of the Spanish in the sixteenth century. Wandering among the trees, you will find the large pods that contain the seeds that eventually become chocolate. The interior will have a white gelatinous coating, which you will taste and find a tart and sweet flavor that is similar to vanilla pudding. Your guide will show you the fermentation and seed-drying processes before you help roast the beans. Roasting the cocoa will release the familiar aroma of dark chocolate, and grinding the beans will produce a fine, powdery texture. Cooking the powder will turn the cocoa into cajuli, or liquid chocolate. You will be delighted by your first taste of pure, hot chocolate before finding a slight, bitter quality that tends to bite through the richness. You will also personalize the drink with your preferred flavors, adding sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, or marshmallows to the mixture until the drink contains your perfect blend of spice and sweetness. In the evening, your guide will lead you out of Arenal to reach a private reserve of secondary forest where nocturnal animals are seemingly restless. Your tour will focus on the amphibians of Costa Rica, while also searching for reptiles and mammals amid the nightly frog songs that echo throughout the trees. Nearby, you will find the bright coloration of a red-eyed tree frog, which are common at low elevations. The red-eyed tree frog is famous for its brilliant flashes of color with dark blue thighs and bright orange hands that contrast with their huge crimson eyes.

dayInfo.title: Arenal – Return to San Jose and Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: At breakfast, the radiant colors of the fresh fruit in the dining hall will remind you of the bright hues of the red-eyed tree frog that is seen clinging to the trees during your nocturnal hike the previous night. The aroma of Costa Rican coffee will drift through the air and highlight the renowned quality of the soil and crops. Outside of the resort, visitors will eagerly venture from activity to activity such as lounging in the hot springs, trekking to stunning waterfalls, searching for wildlife from hanging bridges, and angling over whitewater on a thrilling rafting tour. Your private transfer will meet you in the hotel lobby and escort you back to San Jose at Juan Santamaria International Airport for your flight home.

tourName: One-Week Luxury Costa Rica Vacation for Seniors
placesVisited: San Jose, Arenal, La Fortuna, Tamarindo
generalInfo: This custom-tailored vacation for seniors will take you on a journey from the coast to the rainforest to experience many of Costa Rica’s most breathtaking destinations. You will indulge in decadent dining experiences, explore by way of private guides, and culminate each day by unwinding at five-star hotel accommodations. You will bask in Arenal’s mineral-rich, bubbling hot springs, decompressing as you breathe in the cool, jungle air. You will also encounter two-toed sloths, howler monkeys, toucans, exotic plant species, and much more during your exclusive tours of the misty rainforest. While lounging on Tamarindo’s pristine, white-sand beaches, you will listen to the relaxing sounds of the ocean as it crashes onto the shore. Whether you are traveling as a couple, family, or with a group, this immersive vacation is the perfect mix of adventure and relaxation that you will not soon forget.

dayInfo.title: San Jose - Arrive in Costa Rica's Lively Capital City
dayInfo.description: After landing in San Jose, your private driver will meet you at the baggage claim and whisk you through customs. Driving through Costa Rica’s lively capital city, you will be amazed by San Jose’s vibrant culture. Situated in the heart of the Central Valley, San Jose’s rolling hills are dotted with homes, lined with city scrapers, and adorned with beautiful buildings. You will notice a mist as it drifts through the bordering mountains and luscious rainforest that looms in the distance. In the city’s center, expansive outdoor markets are decorated with brightly colored souvenirs, and you will be able to hear school children as they play games of soccer in the park. Locals will pour into breweries, cafes and, restaurants, and once your driver arrives at your luxurious hotel, you will be free to enjoy a night of relaxation before tomorrow’s adventures begin.

dayInfo.title: Arenal - Delve into Costa Rican History on a Privately Guided Plantation Tour
dayInfo.description: The second day of your Costa Rican vacation will begin by sampling the tantalizing, local cuisine. The aroma of freshly brewed coffee will drift through the air, and you will immediately feel refreshed as you sip the creamy, caramel taste from your cup. You will indulge in ripe, juicy guava, pineapple, and orange slices, and sample a savory Costa Rican stable and Pinto Gallo with homemade tortillas. After a satisfying breakfast, your private guide will meet you in the lobby to transfer you to your next destination of Arenal. As you drive, the bustling cityscape will disappear and slowly transform into the tropical Arenal region. Heading into town, you will notice one of Costa Rica’s most popular destinations as it looms in the distance: the Arenal volcano. At over 5,000 feet, its cone-shaped spout seems to reach the swirling clouds above. You will be able to feel the humidity on your skin as you breathe in the rich oxygen of the many flowering plants that surround the area. An afternoon visit to a local coffee plantation will be sure to delight your senses, delving into the history and complex production on a privately guided tour. The fields will stretch as far as your eyes can see, and your knowledgeable guide will discuss the intricate coffee growing, picking, and harvesting processes with you. After your tour, you will sample different types of coffee, noticing the different tones of honey, molasses, and citrus flavors of the rich and delicious Costa Rican coffee.

dayInfo.title: Arenal - Explore the Tropical Rainforest and Discover Wildlife in Arenal
dayInfo.description: You will wake to the soothing sound of chirping birds today. As you sip your morning coffee, you can decide to sit outside and enjoy the cool, early morning air and beautiful scenery. Butterflies may flutter between brightly colored flowers, and you may be able to spot a toucan as it rests on a nearby branch. Shortly, your private guide will greet you in the lobby to continue your venture through the Arenal region. You will be led into the lush rainforest, which will appear to be a dense green canopy of ferns, vines, and trees. Your trained guide will point out two-toed sloths as they dangle from a nearby tree and relax in the warmth of the day. You may notice a Capuchin monkey’s white face and dark body as they scamper through the branches above. Your guide will inform you how the monkeys’ long tails help them balance as they move throughout the forest. After a short walk, you will reach the La Fortuna waterfall. The water cascades from 75 meters above, pouring into a glistening swimming hole below. The view will be absolutely breathtaking. Dense, green foliage surrounds the waterfall from all sides, and your private guide will lead you back to your luxury accommodation where you will relax into the comforts of the quieting sounds and the setting sun.

dayInfo.title: Arenal - Create a Costa Rican Meal and Unwind in Arenal's Natural Hot Springs
dayInfo.description: On the fourth day of your Costa Rican adventure, you will learn to cook like a Costa Rican and take a dip into the region’s natural, mineral-rich hot springs. After a delicious breakfast, you will meet your private escort who will drive you to your cooking class. Here, you will learn about local cuisine along with grilling, slicing, and flavoring techniques. Through the window, you will enjoy stunning views of the La Fortuna waterfall as it ripples in the distance. Finally, you will taste your delicious creations from savory to sweet with the exciting knowledge of how to craft your recipes without the supervision of a professional. Next, your private guide will lead you to Arenal’s soothing, thermal springs. The region’s geothermal activity heats the natural, bubbling waters. As you soothe your adventurous muscles, you will feel your stresses melt away. The spring’s healing waters are known to help alleviate dry skin, arthritis, and high blood pressure. The enchanting atmosphere will create a perfect environment for you to unwind.

dayInfo.title: Tamarindo - Relax on Tamarindo's Pristine White-Sand Beaches
dayInfo.description: In the morning, your private transfer will escort you to your next destination: the tropical shores of Tamarindo. Tucked along the Nicoya Peninsula, Tamarindo is a small town that every tourist deems as a must-see. Once you arrive, you will feel the warm breeze of the Pacific Ocean on your skin, and you will sink your toes into the silky, white sand. You can watch surfers as they glide on the waves, children as they craft sandcastles, and iguanas as they bask in the sun on the shore. As you rest on the beach, you will hear the howls of monkeys and the calls of exotic birds among the trees, and in the late afternoon, you will have the opportunity to visit Tamarindo Garden Plaza. Spanning 12,500 square meters, you will have no trouble finding the perfect souvenir to take back home. As your day ends, you will watch the sunset as it colors the entire sky with bright oranges, pinks, and yellows while you rest in your luxury, beach-side accommodation.

dayInfo.title: Tamarindo - Encounter Dolphins and Sea Turtles on a Private Boat Tour of Tamarindo
dayInfo.description: You will wake to the calming crash of the Pacific Ocean, the chirps of birds, and the familiar, rich scent of freshly brewed coffee. As you eat your breakfast on your balcony, you will breathe in the early morning air and enjoy the peace of the empty beach. When you head down to the lobby, your private guide will greet you and take you on a private boat excursion. Your boat will move peacefully along the Pacific, and you will be able to experience Tamarindo from an entirely different perspective. You will notice the contrast of the thick, luscious rainforest and the flat, white-sand beach. If you are lucky, you will have the opportunity to witness a diverse array of wildlife such as dolphins, sea turtles, and crocodiles. You will enjoy a freshly prepared lunch on board with the refreshing sea breeze at your back. As the day winds down, you will enjoy one last, breathtaking sunset as you reflect upon the many amazing memories that you have made during this unforgettable trip.

dayInfo.title: San Jose - Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: On your final day of Costa Rica, you will enjoy one last, delicious breakfast. You can sit outside and listen to the crash of the waves and feel the warmth of the early morning sun, taking in the spectacular view one last time. Following breakfast, your private driver will meet you in the lobby and escort you to the San Jose Airport for your flight home.

tourName: One-Week Romantic Costa Rican Getaway Vacation
placesVisited: San Jose, Uvita, Marino Ballena National Park, Naranjo, Corcovado National Park, Juan Castro Blanco National Park
generalInfo: Experience the exotic passion and exuberant spirit of the jungle during your customizable romantic tour of Costa Rica, where you will immerse yourself in the gorgeous seclusion of the Central Valley and the captivating majesty of the Pacific coast. You will discover the idyllic setting of your luxury accommodations and the captivating thrill of viewing iridescent birds and rambunctious monkeys in their natural habitats. You will also witness breathtaking waterfalls, embrace the soothing ambiance of a couple’s massage, and enjoy the flirtations of the tranquil scenery. From sampling cherished coffee to lounging on treasured white-sand beaches, your Costa Rican tour is full of intrigue, opulence, and romance.

dayInfo.title: Central Valley – Enjoy San Jose with a Private Drive to a Secluded Lodge
dayInfo.description: The Central Valley of Costa Rica represents the country’s heart with sprawling coffee plantations that are interspersed between the lush jungle foliage. As the spiritual center of Costa Rica, the Central Valley contains the history of Spanish conquistadors and national independence that is accentuated by the picturesque villages that offer panoramas of surrounding volcanic ridges. Your flight lands at Juan Santamaria International Airport, where your private transfer will greet you upon arrival. The bustling streets of San Jose become a welcoming immersion into the capital where neoclassical décor embodies the history of wealth as well as the fashionable aesthetic of Costa Rica. The National Theater will host plays, operas, dances, and classical concerts inside the grand nineteenth-century façade. The neighborhood of Barrio Amón reflects the former prestige of the coffee plantation owners who erected sensational mansions in a variety of elegant and exuberant nineteenth and twentieth-century styles. Many of the old homes have been converted into hotels, cafes, and restaurants in order to preserve the history of the neighborhood while also attempting to revitalize contemporary culture. You will travel through the capital of Costa Rica before arriving at your secluded accommodation on the outskirts of the Central Valley. The luxurious charms of the décor will incorporate the rich coffee culture of the area while also offering you tremendous views of the Poas, Barva, and Irazu volcanic summits that highlight the unforgettable romance of Costa Rica’s luscious landscape.

dayInfo.title: Central Valley – Indulge in the Isolated Romance of your Luxury Lodge
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the scent of freshly brewed Costa Rican coffee drifts through the open-air of your accommodation’s dining room. The delicious aroma fades beneath the subtle fragrance of blossoming hibiscus. You can embrace the new day’s romantic ambiance and celebrated style of Pura Vida , known throughout Costa Rica as “pure life.” The sounds of twittering birds will echo from the protected wilderness in El Chayote Forest Reserve that encompass 988 acres of cloud and rainforest. This rainforest is home to about 150 different species of birds. Set out with your guide on a tasty adventure to a local coffee plantation where a coffee producer will guide you through the plantation. White flowers grow from the coffee plants releasing the relaxing scent of jasmine. Small red cherries dangle between the leaves, which will then be harvested, dried, and roasted before they will become the coffee grains with which you are familiar. At the end of the tour, your guide will teach you the basics of sampling coffee and how to find the different flavors inherent in the beans, much like tasting wine. You will sip the coffee and taste a blend of citrus and apricot that will be supplemented with an intense aroma of brown sugar. Continue to Catarata del Toro for a spirited waterfall experience at one of the most impressive water features in the country. The falls tumble over the lip of an extinct volcanic crater dropping approximately 300 feet into the waiting pool. Trekking to the waterfall will take you on a manicured trail weaving through part of a 250-acre reserve of thriving primary forest. Here, blue morpho butterflies flutter their wings in the soft light that pierce the dense canopy, which attracts the butterflies across large distances. Along the lush edges of the pool, hummingbirds feed on the bright, blossoming flowers.

dayInfo.title: Central Valley – Discover the Splendor of Costa Rica’s Central Valley
dayInfo.description: At breakfast, you will test your new-found talents of identifying the flavors and aromas of freshly-brewed coffee, and will notice the captivating scent of caramel that accentuates the tart lemon and sweet-honey flavors when it lingers on your palate. The romance of Costa Rica will be palpable within the stunning views your room and lobby will provide. After breakfast, your guide will meet you at the hotel and leads you to the natural splendor of Juan Castro Blanco National Park. Cloud forests surround the protected landscape at 7,212 feet above sea level which span approximately 35,200 acres. While you walk through enchanting rugged terrain, your guide will explain how the high-altitude rains and mist feed the source of five rivers that wind into the Northern Region. Share the moment with your loved one as you can traverse more than three miles of manicured trails. As you venture into a landscape covered with 60 percent of primary forest you may witness the Pozo Verde Lagoon, which has a depth of nearly 50 feet. This small pool of emerald water can perfectly mirror the surrounding vegetation inside the crater of the ancient extinct volcano. The tranquil seclusion of the hillsides provides the perfect destination to search for the resplendent quetzal, which is an exotic bird that nests in the Montane cloud forests between Southern Mexico and Western Panama. Their radiant plumage glints with green, gold, blue, violet, and red along with a collection of feathers that act like a streamer for a tale that can reach up to 26 inches long. Their colorful hues stand out from the greater jade foliage of the trees, yet adapt to the colors of the canopy within rainy weather. Spotting one in the wild will offer a sense of serenity and excitement of seeing the rare bird in its natural habitat that will only enhance the passionate connection you feel with this captivating and pristine scenery.

dayInfo.title: Costa Ballena – Enjoy a Scenic Drive to Lovely Beaches of Costa Ballena
dayInfo.description: Your private transfer will meet you at the hotel lobby after your delicious breakfast to escort you to the comforts of your luxurious accommodations on the Costa Ballena. Before arriving on the enchanting Pacific shores, you will stop in the charming town of Sarchi, which is known as the artisan capital of Costa Rica. A giant oxcart, the national symbol of the country, decorates the entrance to Sarchi with an elegant and ornate hand-painted design. The bright colors and distinctive shapes symbolize a tradition passed down through the generations when oxcarts acted as the main source of transport and farming techniques. The church glows at the center of town with a pink and blue hue glinting along the two large towers overlooking the public plaza. Local artisans craft the delicate carved wooden utensils, stunning jewelry, and historically inspired masks as well as intricate furniture with hand-carved panels that show a touch of Costa Rica’s past whether in the form of harvesting farmers or soaring toucans. Whether watching an artist detail a small oxcart with intense focus or caressing the complex features of a hand-carved rocking chair, Sarchi highlights the beautiful local artistic heritage.

dayInfo.title: Costa Ballena – Relax in Comfort at your Luxurious Accommodations
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the sound of howler monkeys will roar through the jungle canopy. The New World monkey lives in groups with up to 20 others and can call throughout the day as they communicate between their group with a territorial cry. After breakfast, the day is yours to enjoy the beauty of Costa Rica’s treasured Pacific coast and the charms of Costa Ballena at your leisure. The jungle reserve connected to your hotel boasts a stunning private, tiered waterfall where whales often swim past the powdery white sands of Punta Uvita Beach. Couples can also learn to paddleboard on the calm waters of the nearby Mangrove canals or enjoy the thrills of a whitewater rafting excursion on the Coto Brus River. Take to the skies on a stunning ziplining tour that allows you to stream through the rainforest canopy like a chestnut-mandible toucan. Sail above the forest floor and across valley streams connected by eight cable lines where the wind will brush against your cheek as you glide between platforms and watch the emerald leaves of the forest blur. Searching the canopy will reveal hidden treasures like feeding toucans, snacking on nuts, and observing resting, two-toed sloths clinging to the trees. The common Hoffman’s two-toed sloth has two heavy toes ending with long curved claws. They can grow up to 28 inches in length and move with slow, focused movements. This will be an excellent opportunity to take pictures and interact with these unique creatures. In the evening, you can relax in the romantic ambiance of your hotel with a couple’s spa treatment accentuating the splendors of the setting and the natural resources of the local landscape. The scent of jasmine and sea-salt fills the room for a relaxing atmosphere. You immediately feel soothed and more connected as a couple as your muscles unwind. The sporadic sounds of passing birds remind you of the tropical setting spreading in and around your opulent accommodations relieving the tension in your shoulders, neck, and back.

dayInfo.title: Costa Ballena – Explore the Beauty of Uvita and Costa Ballena at Leisure
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you will indulge in the view of the Pacific Ocean from the comfort of your dining room. You will have another day at your leisure that allows you to bask in the sunlight alongside the infinity pool or venture out into the wilderness for another deep exploration of Costa Rica’s captivating biodiversity. Your guide will lead you away from the hotel for the day, eager to introduce you to the majesty of Corcovado National Park. The protected landscape overtakes nearly 40 percent of the Osa Peninsula, acting as a bastion for marvelous endangered wildlife such as the Baird’s tapir, giant anteater, and the world’s largest population of scarlet macaws. The trails winding through the jungle terrain highlight 164 square miles of one of the most cherished and diverse biomes on the planet. You will explore these trails under the supervision of an experienced guide who is incredibly knowledgeable about the region. Your guide may find a troop of spider monkeys running along the upper branches. The endangered species has a long, prehensile tail reaching 35 inches long which helps them balance in the trees, either when running through canopies, or dangling from vines. Continuing your expedition deep into the national park will also reveal the hiding place for a flock of scarlet macaws. These birds are famous for their stunning plumage that shines with red, yellow, and blue hues that also grow up to 32 inches long. You can hear their high-pitched throaty squawk, which can carry for miles when searching for a group. They scour the trees looking for fruits, nuts, and seeds but also gather around clay licks filled with sodium-packed dirt. Viewing the colorful and dynamic wildlife in their natural habitat can emphasize the natural charm of the region that is amplified by the romantic ambiance of your luxurious accommodations while giving you a taste of both the luscious jungle and the serene beaches that litter this majestic region.

dayInfo.title: Costa Ballena – Fly from Uvita do San Jose and Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: The gentle pace of the coastal life continues at breakfast where the scent of the sea breeze fades beneath the delightful aroma of fresh-squeezed orange juice. The grandeur of Marino Ballena National Park will shimmer in the sunlight deriving from the pristine blue Pacific water as it protects the coral and rock reefs of secluded islands. At low tide, the sandbar appears to resemble the distinctive shape of whale’s tail. The waters around the national park protect nesting sea turtles and three different species of dolphins, while also allowing humpback and pilot whales to pass when migrating. After breakfast, your private transfer escorts you to the airport at Quepos for your brief flight to Juan Santamaria Airport in San Jose, where you continue home.

tourName: Perfect 7-Day Costa Rica Vacation
placesVisited: Arenal, Monteverde, Manuel Antonio, Selvatura Park, Damas Island Estuary, Monteverde Cloud Forest and Biological Reserve
generalInfo: This week-long Costa Rica vacation exudes luxury and excitement, exploration and excellence, and is custom-tailored to your preferred experiences. Enjoy a carefree existence in thermal springs heated by the volcanic activity of Arenal. Listen to the waves lap against the Pacific coastline and watch the clouds fade over the highland rainforest in Monteverde. Scour the treetops on hanging bridges and zip lines to find the active lifestyles of howler monkeys, toucans, sloths, and iguanas. A perfect Costa Rica vacation becomes a perfect week and will be accentuated by the bountiful splendors of luxury resorts, landscapes, and wildlife.

dayInfo.title: Arenal – Arrive in San Jose and Travel to the Comfort and Luxury of Arenal
dayInfo.description: San Jose embodies the history and prestige of Costa Rica in the bustling culture that pulses through its streets. Coffee plantations grow along the ridges of the mountains surrounding the Central Valley. A slight blue haze hovers above the thriving plants at over 5,575 feet above sea level where the crops cease to grow. The grandeur of former plantation moguls and the mansions in Barrio Amón symbolize elegant taste and highlight the natural wealth of the landscape found in Costa Rica. The neighborhood leads north and west of Plaza España and was constructed between the 19th and 20th centuries. Colorful, flower-clad walkways add layers of elegance to the art deco, concrete, and Victorian architecture supporting the arts center of the San Jose. Upon arrival, your private transfer greets you at Juan Santamaria International Airport and escorts you out of the Central Valley towards Arenal. The town of La Fortuna creates its own charm in the shadows of the Arenal Volcano. Spiny iguanas scramble through the bushes outside of the narrow streets and sloths linger in the trees that shade the creek. You pass through town for a view of the Arenal Volcano, which erupted from three separate craters in the 1960s. The sporadic clouds fade and offer a view of the perfect cone peak at more than 4,475 feet above sea level. The rainforest canopy clings to the edges of the road and turns the foothills of the marvelous volcano a shimmering emerald. You settle into the luxuries of your secluded resort celebrated for its gorgeous landscape and quiet ambiance. After spending time relaxing in your suite that provides a partial view of Arenal Volcano, you venture to nearby heated pools. The water trickles over the rocks, providing a soothing and serene atmosphere. Steam rises from the pools and rushing streams due to the temperature of the water that ranges from 72 to 105 degrees Fahrenheit. Consider reading some of our traveler's reviews for Costa Rica vacations to learn more about this exciting experience.

dayInfo.title: Arenal – Traverse Hanging Bridges and Relax in Natural Thermal Springs
dayInfo.description: Sunlight spreads across the rainforest canopy and brings the sounds of wildlife to the resort. Howler monkeys groan in the refreshing cool of the early light. Their deep, guttural calls make you think of wildcats or dinosaurs instead of monkeys. The sound of their calls echoes for up to three miles and connotes the territory of a particular troop. Your resort, Montaña De Fuego, offers several "enjoy the moment" activities celebrating this beautiful morning. These activities include a morning guided bird-watching session, an indigenous Malaku culture experience, and a tour of the on-site farm, where children may collect chicken eggs and learn about farm animals. After your morning activity, your guide will escort you from the hotel lobby to the mystical hanging bridges and walkways for an unrivaled perspective of the rainforest. You will travel over 15 suspension bridges taking in the herbaceous aroma that emanates from the trees and the scent of jasmine that blends with the spicy musk of fern trees. The loud chirp of a keel-billed toucan draws your attention. The bird’s yellow breast is striking as it stands in contrast to the emerald leaves and dark branches. Seeing a toucan in the wild is thrilling, from the unique, drawn-out caw to the rainbow of tropical colors featured on their beaks. For the first time, you notice that the toucan’s feet are light blue, matching the small streak on the bottom of their chins. The exhilaration of walking along a suspension bridge never wanes and only increases with the wildlife you find coursing through the canopy. White-headed capuchin monkeys graze on nuts and berries, utilizing their prehensile tail to help balance as they reach the far branches. After wandering through the vibrant rainforest, you return to your resort for some relaxation.

dayInfo.title: Monteverde – Experience Canyoning before Venturing to Monteverde
dayInfo.description: At breakfast, the scent of fresh Costa Rican coffee drifts through the open-air dining room. You find subtle notes of almond and tangerine accompanying the delicious sweetness of fresh pineapple and passion fruit. After the meal, you set out with your guide on a canyoning adventure and into the depths of the rainforest around Arenal. This exciting excursion is wildly different from the calm walk that you took through the treetops the previous day. A 4x4 jeep takes you on a rough track surrounded by dense trees and a small slope. Your guide offers insight into the types of animals most often found in the forest, including deer, tapir, and the occasional jaguar. Parrots squawk in the treetops, and you can hear the rushing water of a nearby cascade. After an in-depth tutorial on the safety measures of your excursion, your guide fits you into the harness and lets you lean back against the edges of a cliff. The waterfall you heard before now trundles over the precipice beside you at 150 feet. You imitate the motion of your guide pressing your feet into the solid rock face and propelling your body away, gliding closer to the ground. Mist from the waterfall coats your cheeks and is refreshingly cool in the tropical heat. You arrive at the bottom of the canyon and step into the rushing river to continue your active exploration of the scenery. Watercourses over your legs and the pebbled riverbed undulates beneath your feet. You slide down a rock that has been smoothed naturally over time as the water rushes over the landscape. After the fun of your extreme experience, your private transfer escorts you into the mountains at Monteverde to experience the wonders of the Cloud Forest. Your resort offers a cozy, luxurious ambiance into which you easily settle. Before dinner, your guide leads you on a private introductory tour along the trails outside of the lodge to view the nightlife of the famous ecosystem.

dayInfo.title: Monteverde – Explore Monteverde Cloud Forest and Biological Reserve
dayInfo.description: The clouds brush over the high-altitude peaks of Monteverde, located at more than 4,660 feet above sea level.
