The moisture from the clouds leaves dew in the canopy and along the forest underbrush where moss coats the branches, grounds, and fallen logs. Instead of feeding off of rain, the local greenery feeds off the clouds, showcasing one angle of Costa Rica’s fascinating biodiversity. The clouds dissipate before breakfast, and your guide greets you at the hotel before escorting you into the Cloud Forest and Biological Reserve to follow the trails that wind through the more than 40 square miles of protected landscape. The cool temperature is a striking difference from the tropical warmth you felt at Arenal. Along the trail, your guide explains that Monteverde contains two and a half percent of the world’s biodiversity, with Costa Rica housing an astounding five percent, though it only represents one one-hundredth of the world’s landmass. Your guide excitedly points to fresh jaguar tracks near the base of a tree. The day is filled with fascinating birdcalls, and you strain in your attempt to identify which of the region’s 400 different species you are hearing. Follow your guide in search of the resplendent quetzal, a rare bird returning in numbers to the cooler climates of Costa Rica’s cloud forests. The males are known for their ruby-red breast and the iridescent green plumage along their backs and wings. Their tails grow long and delicate like streamers, reaching up to three feet in length. You reach a secluded portion of the trail and find the dangling feathers of a quetzal, leading upwards to the male bird perching on a quiet branch and shining in the sunlight.

dayInfo.title: Manuel Antonio – Zip Line in Selvatura Park and Drive to Manuel Antonio
dayInfo.description: You wake-up in time to watch the clouds drift through the forest with thick, heavy layers. From the comforts of the dining room, you sip a fresh coffee, enjoying the warmth of the resort as the sunlight burns away the cloud cover of the aptly named Cloud Forest. After breakfast, you return to the treetops for a zip line excursion, eager to feel the wind against your cheeks and to delight in the views over the dew-filled trees. You travel to Selvatura Park, a conservation area encompassing 1,200 acres. You step into the trees ready to glide along more than 2 miles on 15 separate cables. The sounds of nature abound with the short bursting call of the orange-bellied trogon. You keep your eyes peeled for a fiery-billed aracari, a type of toucan known for its gorgeous bill that shimmers with red and orange, and a bright yellow and crimson underbelly that shines against the trees. After soaring through the sky, you spend some time in the hummingbird garden, taking a peaceful walk amongst the fluttering wings and colorful plumage. The magnificent hummingbirds grow to five and a half inches long and look dark until the sunlight catches flashes of bronze, green, and violet feathers. Your private transfer escorts you down the mountainside of Monteverde, and west toward the Pacific. En route, you will stop at the Tarcoles River Bridge to view the giant crocodiles basking in the water below. Upon reaching your resort in Manuel Antonio, you will indulge in the ambiance created by the serene waves of the Pacific Ocean and the comforts of your private suite.

dayInfo.title: Manuel Antonio – Discover Damas Island Estuary and the National Park
dayInfo.description: At breakfast, you can hear the waves of the Pacific Ocean crashing against the soft sands of the shoreline. The aromas of pineapple and coconut overtake the scent of fresh coffee, and the sea breeze cools the morning heat as a flock of parakeets fly into the neighboring trees. Your guide leads you from the hotel lobby to the banks of the mangrove forest. Canals wind along the protruding roots of the riverine trees where the salt and fresh waters converge. The trees have evolved by filtering the saltwater from their systems in order to thrive in this unusual ecosystem while also helping to keep the soil from eroding. You step into a kayak and float up the river in search of the fascinating wildlife that inhabits Costa Rica’s smallest national park. Manuel Antonio comprises three square miles of protected land where you will listen to the tranquil sounds of the forest as the water drips from your paddle into the still canal. White-headed capuchins ramble through the branches and your guide points to a small crocodile resting in the sunlight on the banks. A vine above the water suddenly moves, and you realize the thick body belongs to a boa constrictor that you have startled with your arrival. Snowy egrets stand out with pristine white plumage that glows against the surrounding greenery and brown underbrush. They graze on the marshy banks in search of insects or crabs, and as you get closer to the estuary, your guide points into the water at sponges and oysters. Baby black-tipped sharks swim in the transparent canals close to the mouth of the ocean. In the afternoon, you return to the resort for a private walking tour around the trails of Manuel Antonio National Park in search of signs of the endangered squirrel monkey.

dayInfo.title: Manuel Antonio – Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: Costa Rica has an undeniable allure, drawing visitors from around the world to its countless adventures and endless, perfect experiences. A long-billed starthroat hummingbird flutters past your balcony in the morning searching for blossoming flowers, its gray underbelly flashes with silver and streaks of iridescent green beneath its radiant blue crown. They twitter raucously when excited or annoyed. A gartered trogon is perched on the tree beside your room, its unique black and white polka-dotted plumage framing its orange-yellow underbelly. At breakfast, you savor the aroma of pineapple and the slight sweetness of the coffee harvested from a micro-mill in the coveted coffee-growing region of Tarrazu. After the meal, your private transfer greets you in the hotel lobby and escorts you back to the Central Valley to reach Juan Santamaria International Airport for your flight home.

tourName: Secluded Rainforest Costa Rica Adventure
placesVisited: Santa Juana, Corcovado National Park, Puerto Jimenez
generalInfo: With seclusion comes adventure during your exciting 9-day Costa Rica off the beaten path tour. Embrace the majesty of the soaring mountains and the exciting intensity of the jungle terrain. Revel in the sunset over the Pacific, listen to the chattering birdlife or wander the forest. Whether searching for exuberant sea life or exciting wildlife hidden in the canopy, you can embrace the variety and adventure of Costa Rica.

dayInfo.title: Santa Juana - Arrive Costa Rica’s Secluded Wonders
dayInfo.description: Exceptional charm and breathtaking beauty define Santa Juana, where you can bask in the jungle panoramas leading to ocean views. You will arrive in San Jose and continue to the airstrip at Quepos, where your private transfer will meet you. The scenic drive will take you into the mountains to reach a nature reserve hidden in the rainforest canopy. As you settle into the wonder of your surroundings, you can settle into and embrace the serene ambiance and welcoming luxury of the open view sweeping across the treetops to reach the Pacific.

dayInfo.title: Santa Juana - Embrace Santa Juana’s Adventures
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, you can enjoy the day with your choice of adventure to experience the Pura Vida spirit, for which Costa Rica is known. Venture into the Santa Juana Rural Mountains or zipline through the treetops. You can take part in a coffee tour to learn more about the history and production. Your guide will offer you an expert’s perspective of a celebrated microregion in Los Santos to view the ripening coffee cherries, witness the drying beans, and then learn how to distinguish the layered flavors from the region with a tasting that highlights dark chocolate notes.

dayInfo.title: Drake Bay - Transfer to Stunning Drake Bay
dayInfo.description: You can enjoy the sounds of the jungle in the morning, when you may hear the birds twitter or the howler monkeys call out through the trees in the cooler hours of the day. After breakfast, you will transfer from Quepos to Drake Bay to meet your boat bound for a luxurious lodge that connects the rainforest and the Pacific coast. You may hear the ocean waters lap against the golden beach as you sit in the shade of the towering jungle canopy. The remainder of the day is yours to enjoy the comforts of your accommodation and soft sands.

dayInfo.title: Drake Bay - Discover the Rainforest at your Pace
dayInfo.description: You will venture into the wonders of the wilderness after breakfast with a private tour that can take you into the intense biodiversity of Corcovado National Park. The rainforest terrain covers nearly one-third of the Osa Peninsula, where you may encounter the likes of endangered jaguars, elusive tapirs, or colorful scarlet macaws. You can follow your guide through the various habitats found within the single protected park with an immersive experience in nature. You may hear the boisterous calls of Costa Rica’s four different species of monkey, including the endangered squirrel monkey, as they swing through the dense canopy.

dayInfo.title: Drake Bay - Explore Cano Island National Park
dayInfo.description: The natural marvels of Cano Island National Park will come to light as you set off with your private guide to discover the exceptional collection of rock formations, coral, and marine life. Mild trees create a perimeter around the island and colorful coral grows like stiff cacti out of the ocean floor. You can view the dramatic wilderness of the island from the boat or leap into the water with your snorkel for a better view of the stingrays, barracudas, and passing sea turtles. You may also find dolphins in the distance passing around the island in search of food.

dayInfo.title: Puerto Jimenez - Travel to Pacific Coast Charm
dayInfo.description: You will leave behind the charisma of your accommodation in the morning for the exotic ambiance of your new lodge near Puerto Jimenez on the Golfo Dulce. With unspoiled views of the Osa Peninsula, you can immerse yourself in a new paradise that spans more than 750 acres of forest with views perched from atop a coastal cliff. You can once more connect the forest trees to the crashing waves of the Pacific as you take time to settle into the fantasy of the new panoramas.

dayInfo.title: Puerto Jimenez - Enjoy the Osa Peninsula Adventure
dayInfo.description: You can indulge in the splendor of nature after breakfast with a tour of your choice that can plunge you into the primary forest or in search of the region’s exceptional birdlife. An early morning tour can take you on a wildlife excursion to glimpse at the more than 350 species of birds, as well as the diverse array of monkeys found in the canopy. You may hear the howler monkey’s call echo through the trees up to three miles away. Capuchin monkeys scramble through the branches in search of fruits or hear the hummingbirds’ fluttering wings.

dayInfo.title: Puerto Jimenez - Delight in your Adventures
dayInfo.description: With another day to explore the Osa Peninsula at your pace, you can venture back into the primary rainforest for a hike in search of anteaters and peccaries or spend the morning relaxing at your accommodation before partaking in a sunset tour. Once the sun liners on the horizon, your guide can lead you along the protected grounds in search of the nocturnal wilderness where bats roam, snakes linger in the branches, and the red-eyed tree frogs cling to giant leaves. Exploring at night can give you a different perspective and appreciation of the rainforest and its captivating wildlife.

dayInfo.title: Puerto Jimenez - Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you can enjoy breakfast and wander the gardens and pond of your accommodations to hear the calling birds and roaming wildlife. You may choose to cross the suspension bridge over the rainforest gorge. Your private transfer will meet you at the hotel to make your flight to the San Jose airport, where you will continue onward home. You will have explored and discovered the marvels of the rainforest and Pacific with an exceptional tour off the beaten path in Costa Rica.

tourName: Splendid Costa Rica Vacation for Seniors: Live the Pura Vida
placesVisited: San Jose, Arenal, Monteverde, Playa Samara
generalInfo: Imbued with Pura Vida , this ten-day Costa Rica tour will immerse you in the cloud forest, beach bliss, and thrilling landscapes. This laid-back collection of Costa Rica’s best private tours for seniors leads you from cultural San Jose to coastal Samara. You will travel at your pace through Costa Rica’s ultimate highlights on a customizable tour that balances outdoor thrill and relaxation.

dayInfo.title: San Jose – The Land of Pura Vida
dayInfo.description: Costa Rica always provides a leisurely introduction, even in its capital city of San Jose. You will touch down and soon be immersed in a city of colonial townhouses and infectious energy. Residents stroll around the plazas, and chatter emanates from small cafe terraces. A local guide will meet you at the airport and transfer you to your accommodation, which will be a converted heritage building in the city’s heart. You will enjoy a short city orientation with your guide before having your choice of local restaurants for dinner.

dayInfo.title: San Jose – Cultural Wonders in the Old Capital
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will set off with a local guide into the mystery and culture of a city that is full of contrasts. There is opulence here, especially at the neoclassical Teatro Nacional and a neighborhood of grand farming mansions. Your guide will reveal older history in the Museo del Oro Precolombino, where tales of past civilizations are narrated alongside all the gold. With a full day in San Jose, you can easily visit the highlights and learn about the nation’s past along the way.

dayInfo.title: Arenal – Beneath the Volcano
dayInfo.description: Arenal’s majestic frame will be your compass point during your privately guided transfer this morning. Along the way, you will stop at La Paz Waterfall Gardens, where sublime cascades can be discovered along short and easy walking trails. A hummingbird garden will prove to be an incredible place to stop for lunch. Here, the birds flutter in all directions. Afterward, you will have the afternoon at your leisure to enjoy your lodge, which will be perched beneath Arenal’s cone. You can laze in the natural hot springs and watch the mist roll in as the sunset marks the sky.

dayInfo.title: Arenal – Lounging in Hot Spring
dayInfo.description: Arenal is Costa Rica’s famous outdoor paradise, and it is not just a place for young thrills. There are activities and trails for all ages here. A private guide will customize the day to your fitness levels and interests. Arenal is great because the trails are so well maintained. As a result, you can walk on boardwalks instead of rough jungle paths. The scenery is always exquisite and includes waterfalls, monkeys, distant volcanoes, and endemic birds. After a day of exploring, you can relax in private hot springs and feel Costa Rica’s leisurely charm.

dayInfo.title: Arenal – An Organic Coffee Plantation
dayInfo.description: In Arenal, you can go kayaking, paddle boarding, rafting, hiking, climbing, ziplining, and much more. You do not need to travel fast to enjoy the landscapes and charms either. This morning, your local guide will lead you to a small organic coffee plantation, where the vistas are as impressive as anywhere in the country. From bean to cup, you will discover the coffee process. This visit will also include a guided tasting session that will teach you how to evaluate coffee beans. This afternoon will be at your leisure, so it can be as calm or as adventurous as you like.

dayInfo.title: Monteverde – Intimate Wildlife Sightings
dayInfo.description: Clouds rove elegantly through the alpine forest in Monteverde, monkeys call from trees and move past you in large troops, and quetzals brighten the canopy. While Monteverde is famously home to Costa Rica’s best zipline, it is also a fabulous place for laid-back wildlife viewing. You can choose to zipline before an afternoon wildlife safari, which will include the chance to join a conservationist in a hideout that overlooks a popular watering hole.

dayInfo.title: Playa Samara – Lounge On the Coast
dayInfo.description: Costa Rica’s classic combination of highlights includes a cultural city, a towering volcano, an intimate cloud forest, and two untouched coastlines. Today, you will travel to the Pacific for three nights in Playa Samara, which is an excellent destination for senior travelers. Mangoes and monkeys mark the way, and you can stop at a biological reserve en route, where you can encounter large troops of capuchins and spider monkeys. You will be staying at a hotel on the coast in a suite that offers uninterrupted views of the Pacific.

dayInfo.title: Playa Samara – Day Trip to Chora Island
dayInfo.description: Dolphins move poetically through Pacific waters, and thick forest hangs over the golden sand to create a colorful landscape. This is a unique coastal area, and you will have two full days to enjoy its charms. You can wander from the hotel to the beach and spend the mornings doing very little other than listening to small waves. Today’s half-day excursion will lead you to Chora Island, which is an isolated speck of land. Here, you can bask in utter serenity and savor the soothing Pacific air.

dayInfo.title: Playa Samara – Private Catamaran Tour
dayInfo.description: After yesterday’s quiet time, today’s private catamaran tour will take you further along the coast so that you can discover more unchartered wonders. Monkeys come remarkably close to the shore, and you can dock near-deserted beaches. You will have options for swimming in calm bays and disembarking at tiny islands. As the afternoon comes to a close, you will be out on the Pacific for an incredible ocean sunset. This will be the perfect end to this collection of Costa Rica tours for seniors.

dayInfo.title: San Jose – Departure
dayInfo.description: Rather than drive all the way back to San Jose, you can take a domestic flight from Nosara. After a relaxing morning, you will transfer privately to the airport for your local flight. A local representative will greet you in San Jose to assist in connecting to your international flight.

tourName: Superb Costa Rica Getaway: Tropical Paradise and Wildlife
placesVisited: Tortuguero, San Jose, La Fortuna, Monteverde, Piedras Blancas National Park
generalInfo: Nestled between Panama and Nicaragua, Costa Rica presents visitors with an abundance of adventure as well as modern comforts, and this 16-day tour has been handcrafted to deliver plenty of both. Throughout this trip, you will enjoy the charms of this unique corner of Central America. From the heights of Mt. Arenal to the shores of Tortuguero National Park, active explorations will ensure that you see and experience everything you desire.

dayInfo.title: San Jose – A Tropical Paradise
dayInfo.description: There is perhaps no better ambassador for the beauty and charm of Costa Rica than its capital of San Jose. Nestled in the lush mountains of central Costa Rica, San Jose regularly attracts visitors with its colorful neighborhoods, stunning museums and galleries, and rich culture. Upon your arrival at San Jose's main international airport, a transfer will be waiting to convey you into the heart of this vibrant city to embark on your two-week tour of the best of Costa Rica.

dayInfo.title: San Jose – Strolling Through History
dayInfo.description: To celebrate your arrival and first full day in San Jose, you will enjoy a guided walking tour of the city, including all the main sites, with a knowledgeable guide. After a leisurely morning and breakfast, you will be met at your hotel by your guide who will lead you to the city's most iconic attractions, such as the National Theater and the Gold and Jade Museums.

dayInfo.title: Tortuguero – Arriving on the Caribbean Coast
dayInfo.description: Today, the colonial buildings of central San Jose will be replaced by the mangroves and forests of Tortuguero. In the morning, you will turn your back on the Costa Rican capital and set a course for a more rural environment. Tucked along the placid shores of the Caribbean Sea, Tortuguero National Park is the third-most visited in Costa Rica, and upon your arrival at your comfortable accommodation, it will be no surprise why. In the afternoon, the remainder of the day will be yours to explore at your leisure.

dayInfo.title: Tortuguero – In Search of Sea Turtles
dayInfo.description: You will be spared the bright rays of the sun by the dense canopy of mangrove trees that blanket this lush region. You will enjoy a leisurely morning in your accommodation, and it is not uncommon to experience growing anticipation of the adventures that await you. Tortuguero is known for its diverse ecosystems with various flora and fauna, and its namesake sea turtle is known to nest on the beaches only steps from your hotel. After a boat ride on the Tortuguero river, you will set off in search of these turtles during a guided beach walk.

dayInfo.title: La Fortuna – At the Foot of an Active Volcano
dayInfo.description: Your tour of the natural beauty of Costa Rica will continue when you turn your back on the sandy shores of Tortuguero National Park and make you way to the slopes of the famous Arenal Volcano National Park. An active volcano, Arenal has not erupted since 2010 and is an excellent portal for indulging in the region's abundant opportunities for outdoor recreation. After arriving at your accommodation in La Fortuna, you can stretch your legs on a number of nearby hiking trails or relax in the comfort of your conveniently located hotel.

dayInfo.title: La Fortuna – Soaring Through the Jungle
dayInfo.description: Rising out of the jungle like an inverted ice cream cone, Arenal volcano dominates the ring of mountains that surround La Fortuna. Today, these mountains will provide a scenic backdrop for your jungle explorations. After breakfast, you will embark on a quintessential Costa Rican activity that makes traveling to this country unforgettable. The Canopy Ecoglide is a series of cables and platforms by which you can enjoy a bird's-eye view of the land. You will glide across the landscape with the wind in your hair on a zip-lining adventure. You will then spend the evening at leisure.

dayInfo.title: La Fortuna – A Land Teeming with Life
dayInfo.description: On your final morning in proximity to Arenal volcano, you will explore the suspended bridges and wildlife of Mistico Park. Accompanied by a knowledgeable guide, you will enjoy a guided excursion in search of the region's abundance species of iguanas, sloths, tree frogs, caimans, and over 150 bird species. With such a spectacular setting at your fingertips, you will be encouraged to unleash your curiosity on your guide, who will happily answer your questions before leaving you to an evening at your leisure.

dayInfo.title: Monteverde – Arriving in the Cloud Forest
dayInfo.description: From the scenic slopes of Mt. Arenal, you will plunge deeper into the numerous mountain ranges of Costa Rica and the famous Cloud Forest National Reserve. After a relaxing morning, you will enjoy a final breakfast before meeting your transfer for the comfortable ride to Monteverde and the Tilaran Mountain Range. After your arrival, you will settle in to your new accommodations before enjoying the remainder of the day at your leisure.

dayInfo.title: Monteverde – Costa Rican Commodities
dayInfo.description: The higher elevations of these mountains give rise to a slightly different blend of flora and fauna than what you have enjoyed at Tortuguero or Arenal National Parks. The elevation is what makes this region an excellent place for growing two of Costa Rica's most important crops. Today, you will dive into the world of coffee and chocolate production during a tour of the fields and production facilities that aid in the harvest of these valuable cash crops. You will also savor the variety of forms each item takes during their journey from bean to mouth.

dayInfo.title: Piedras Blancas National Park – Gateway to Adventure
dayInfo.description: Today, the scenic heights and coffee plantations of the Tilaran Mountain Range will be replaced by the sand and lagoons of the Pacific Ocean. You will make your way to Piedras Blancas National Park by way of a convenient transfer and brief domestic flight. Your final destination will be a rainforest lodge set against the beautiful backdrop of the Piedras Blancas National Park and the Golfo Dulce Bay. Upon your arrival at your lush accommodation, you can stretch your legs with a stroll along the many patios, lounges, and gardens of this attractive setting.

dayInfo.title: Piedras Blancas National Park – A Day of Leisure
dayInfo.description: For your first full day in Piedras Blancas National Park, you will chart your own course for a leisurely day. A few short steps away from your hotel, Nicuesa Beach allures travelers with its sandy shore and pristine water. The beach is an outstanding location to relax with a good book or to enjoy a refreshing dip in the gulf. You can also embark on a self-guided hike along the coast to take in the majestic contours of this scenic land.

dayInfo.title: Piedras Blancas National Park – Hidden Waterfalls
dayInfo.description: With the early morning light changing the jungle hue from a smokey darkness to a soft glow, dawn is an excellent time to embark on a stroll. After breakfast, you will plunge into the verdant surroundings during a guided walking tour in search of the region's many hidden waterfalls. As you amble along the coastal path, your guide will introduce you to the local species of flora and fauna.

dayInfo.title: Piedras Blancas National Park – Paddling Through Paradise
dayInfo.description: As you will have undoubtedly learned by now, your lodge at the Piedras Blancas National Park presents visitors with an abundance of recreational opportunities along with the ability to relax and bask in the ambient tranquility. Today, you will take to the waves on a guided kayaking tour of the coast, during which you will rock to the rhythm of the waves and enjoy a view of the shore. Upon your return, you will have the remainder of the afternoon to enjoy this stunning landscape.

dayInfo.title: Piedras Blancas National Park – Reclining in Ambient Beauty
dayInfo.description: After your scenic kayaking tour, you may notice a slight soreness in your torso from the active adventure along the Pacific coast. Such a sensation is an excellent excuse to partake in the spa services of your lodge or to register for a professional massage from a trained expert. These are only some of the options you can enjoy on a final day of leisure in this rustic setting.

dayInfo.title: Piedras Blancas National Park – A Snorkeling Adventure
dayInfo.description: After some relaxing time in the Piedras Blancas National Park and your rainforest lodge, you will enjoy your final full day on this tour with a snorkeling adventure. The serene water of the Golfo Dulce will be yours to explore as you enjoy the numerous reefs and marine life that inhabit the coastal water. After the staff offers you a few locations for the best places to explore, you will have the remainder of the afternoon to enjoy the refreshing water and snorkel at your own pace.

dayInfo.title: Piedras Blancas National Park – Departure
dayInfo.description: On your final morning in Costa Rica, you will enjoy a walk along the waterfront before returning to the lodge for your breakfast. Today, you will make your way back to San Jose via Golfito for your return flight home, and a series of comfortable transfers will ensure your timely arrival to each airport.

tourName: The Honeymooner Special: Costa Rica Tour of Romance
placesVisited: San Jose, Arenal Volcano, Punta Islita, Manuel Antonio
generalInfo: Your 12-day Costa Rica vacation highlights the desirable glow of the coral reefs and amorous foliage spreading along the slopes of active volcanoes. Romance casts a wide and comfortable shade over the mountainous landscape, from white beaches along the Caribbean Sea to dry forests near the Pacific, and the cloud forests in between. Sit in private pools overlooking the rainforest and listen to the vibrant calls of wildlife. Whether reveling in the romance of your honeymoon or wanting to relive the passion of previous vacations, you will find ardor in the adventure and sensuality in Costa Rica’s divine luxuries.

dayInfo.title: San Jose – Adventure Arrives
dayInfo.description: Welcome to San Jose, a unique and vibrant city in a country known for its paradisiacal biodiversity. The bustling streets of the city fill with Josefinos--residents of San Jose--and music, astounding murals and museums packed with layers of gold. A private transfer greets you at the airport and escorts you to a gorgeous hotel located in the heart of the relaxed city known for its fast-pace in contrast to the surrounding country. The hotel is located on a serene shady street and offers you a quiet oasis close to the pulsing beat of the capital. The halls are decorated with lush tropical flowers that emanate a sweet and exotic aroma. The central market echoes with life at all times of the day. The bright lights of the city illuminate the precious landscapes to come. The scent of exotic spices and coffee beans drift through the aisles of the circular marketplace. Vendors showcase bright fruits reminding you of the tropical setting outside of San Jose with giant watermelons standing on tables or sweet mangos shining with yellow and green rinds. The delicious fruits represent nature’s abundance in Costa Rica, fed by the tropical climate, volcanic soils, and large following of organic cultivation.

dayInfo.title: Cartago Province – The Privacy of Trees
dayInfo.description: The morning spirit fills the city with activity. Children rush through La Sabana Park and watch the ducks swim around the pond. The scent of fresh coffee from Costa Rican sourced beans fills the dining room at breakfast. Today you make your way from the capital city’s crowds to the tranquil trees and beaches of the Caribbean. Arrive at your jungle lodge and find an entire gorgeous resort made for with seclusion in mind by combining the jungle ambiance with exceptional luxury. The surrounding trees provide shelter for the wildlife of Costa Rica’s cherished rainforest, including howler and capuchin monkeys. The Pacuare River careens around the foothills of the Talamanca Mountains. The hotel is situated between the towns of Turrialba and Siquirres. The roofs are made from palm leaves and your own private deck looks out over the canopy that runs along the rolling jungle hills. Relax in the comfortable waters of your private trickling plunge pool and let the day drift away or, for an intimate experience in the privacy of the jungle terrain, you could partake in a soothing couples massage. The sounds of birdsongs mix with the waters rushing from the river for a peaceful soundtrack as you and your loved one find comfort in the company and the aroma of jasmine blending with the herbaceous trees of your surroundings.

dayInfo.title: Cartago Province – Inspiring Waters and Trees
dayInfo.description: The beauty of the rainforest can be viewed from the comforts of your private plunge pool or with an excursion through the towering trees. The day is at your leisure to enjoy the remarkable landscape as you desire, whether cozying up to your partner and marveling at the panorama or taking an adventurous ride through the trees, together. A day of canyoneering takes you into the charm and awe of the rainforest. A series of rope bridges lead you beneath the canopy still overlooking the forest floor. A troop of capuchin monkey scrambles through the trees shaking the distant branches. The rush and splash of whitewater from a waterfall echoes from a small cliff. You notice the pool billowing below. Mist rises from the rippling water and provides a refreshing touch to the warm tropical heat. Your guide leads you down the cliff-side and you can feel the cool rushing water tapping at your shoulders. Your guide straps you in for a short but thrilling descent to the base of the precipice. The rocks are firm but wet. The waterfall splashes beside you. Orange-chinned parakeets twitter in the canopy. Your heart pounds from the thrill of abseiling and the beauty of endless views. After an adventurous day, you settle into the evening with the sensual delights of a three-course dinner and the soothing sounds of the surrounding jungle after dark.

dayInfo.title: Arenal – Red Hot Marvels
dayInfo.description: The rainforest sings in the morning with the low guttural call of howler monkeys hooting after sunrise. They can grow to over 35 inches long and produce calls audible for up to three miles. Leaves rustle and the cool, misty air wraps around your skin. After breakfast, you begin the exciting half-day river rafting tour along the Pacuare River. The river borders the Talamanca Mountains and leads to the Atlantic Ocean traveling a length of more than 65 miles. The water is a pure turquoise, cool and crisp to the touch. The calm and serene setting lets you float downstream. Tall, craggy cliffs line the river and you can hear the rapids in the distance. You maneuver around large boulders. Trees sprout from the rugged bordering cliffs and shade the waterway. The rapids come quick and strong. The mist splashes up from the water and hits your cheeks. You paddle and push your way through the extent of the path above the rapids until the water turns placid. You float alongside small waterfalls and listen for herons or the calls of white-chinned swift. In the afternoon, your private transfer escorts you to a gorgeous hotel near the base of the popular Arenal Volcano. Your room has a private view to the conical peak with a window framed by the lush tropical landscape supported by the rich minerals in the volcanic soil.

dayInfo.title: Arenal – Kissable Canopy
dayInfo.description: The morning is filled with naturally sweet treats such as ripe, juicy mangos and creamy bananas. The luscious scent of coconut fills the room and the saccharine taste of pineapple lingers on your tongue. After breakfast you venture out on a guided tour through the canopy to experience the jungle from the perspective of a bird. The air brushes against your cheeks as you soar across the first zip line on a course ranging between 40 and 1,400 feet in length. High in the treetops, you become familiar with the avifauna and the warm sunlight beaming through the open trees. An ornate hawk-eagle perches in the trees and decorates the branches in view of the line. They grow up to 27 inches tall with a wingspan reaching nearly 60 inches wide. Their prominent crest raises when excited. As you glide to a series of platforms you have a remarkable view of the volcano. The steam rises out of the crater and mixes with the sporadic clouds. The lush rainforest displays an everlasting grandeur in the blossoming flowers and dense leaves. The vibrant diurnal life of the wild fades in the warm afternoon as sloths, monkeys, and avifauna seek shade in which to rest. You return to the comforts of your hotel and indulge in the allure of the natural hot springs.

dayInfo.title: Tambor – Enigmatic Wild
dayInfo.description: The Nicoya Peninsula is known for its relaxed atmosphere along a sensual coastline. The sapphire water brushes against the soft sand and peels up the gold-sand beach. Waves create picturesque barrels before crashing down and filling the air with the soothing and familiar sound. The shoreline presses against the edge of rainforest with trees climbing the roaming foothills and mountains. Your private transfer collects you at the Tambor Airport after a short flight from Arenal. You can hear the sounds of howler monkeys calling in the forest trees before they hide from the mid-morning heat. You reach the grounds of your accommodation, which overlooks the palm trees lining the soft gold sand of Playa Tambor. The tranquil setting blends the elegant twittering of the tropical birds with the soothing sound of lapping water. The resort provides a private location surrounded by the unspoiled beauty of nature for an unforgettable, romantic setting. Relax in the intimate location in view of Whale Bay and the lush hills shaping the volcanic valley. The remainder of the day is yours to experience the majesty of the resort at your leisure. The restaurant on the property features seafood caught fresh that morning and popular dishes blending traditional Costa Rican flavors and seductive international delights. The resort demonstrates a commitment to sustainability in daily practice while also providing the nearby villages with educational supplies to inform a new generation about the importance of living in a healthy and vibrant coastal community. The spa provides an elegant, secluded destination amidst the foliage where you can relax in a jacuzzi or stretch your muscles in an empowering yoga session. For a more active adventure to experience as a couple, you set out onto the trails leading into the trees for a guided birding expedition searching for the nearly 300 bird species recorded around the property, which includes the elusive and threatened scarlet macaw. The trails consist of bridges and resting areas spread across more than four miles. Your guide quickly points out a purple gallinule, whose plumage shimmers with dark purple hues around the head leading to a green back and light blue forehead.

dayInfo.title: Tambor – Innocent Seaside
dayInfo.description: The day is yours to indulge in the romance and seclusion of your resort as you wish. Journey through the jungle on a guided trek or lounge on the soft, hot sand at the fringe of the lapping water. For an exciting and active tour, you venture out with your guide on a kayak expedition for a different view of Costa Rica’s fabled ecosystems. As you venture on to the ocean, the paddle drips refreshing water down the pole and onto your fingers. The sunlight glints against the white sands of the coastline. Your guide leads you along the seascape bordering Curu Wildlife Refuge, a small preserve protecting nearly 210 acres of pristine scenery. Pelicans glide over the clear water, dipping their open beaks beneath the surface to scoop up unsuspecting fish. You continue inland along the mangrove estuary, finding playful white-faced capuchin monkey foraging for berries. The monkey reaches a length of nearly 18 inches with a tail extending another 22 inches long. Their tail assists the monkey when feeding by supporting their body weight when foraging or helping them balance when running through the trees.

dayInfo.title: Tambor – Waterfalling Grace
dayInfo.description: Today is another day of luxury and exploration. At breakfast, you take the time to indulge in the simple pleasures of a freshly brewed cup of Costa Rican coffee, finding the hints of citrus and caramel in the flavor. After the meal, you can choose your own adventure by visiting the far reaches of the Nicoya Peninsula’s beauty ranging from Playa el Carmen to the 17th-century church of San Blas. Stroll along Waterfall Trail and see the natural geography create spectacular rainbow-clad waterfalls. The rainfall streams down the rolling hills and sudden cliffs to create a collection of elegant cascades and deep pools. Roseate spoonbills graze on the marshy riverbanks. They resemble pink flamingos in both size and color. Montezuma Falls is one of the most celebrated falls in the country and is an accumulation of three separate cascades. The lowest of the falls trundles down a cliff from nearly 80 feet above the waiting pool. Thrill-seekers climb up to the top of the cliff and dive from the highest point down into the rippling water below. A rope allows daredevils to swing from the cliff and plunge into the depths of the water near the splashing curtain of the cascade. The tallest waterfall thunders down with powerful force while the two smaller falls bead down with more elegance. The greenery opens around the pools and you can dip your body into the water for a refreshing stop surrounded by the flourishing greenery of the smallest falls at 15 feet tall.

dayInfo.title: Manuel Antonio – Charming Sunsets
dayInfo.description: Picnics alongside waterfalls and the afternoon jungle discoveries are unique opportunities to experience when indulging in the wonders of Costa Rica, however, the coastal magnetism of Manuel Antonio is impossible to ignore. In the comfort of your hotel room, you listen once more for the sounds of rambunctious howler monkeys or the distant calls of scarlet macaws hiding in the protected trees of Curu Wildlife Refuge. Your private transfer greets you at the airport close to the borders of Manuel Antonio before escorting you to the comforts of you a hotel blending views of the Pacific Ocean and the rainforest. The national park is known to have some of the most beautiful beaches in the entire country. The jungle frames the golden sands and drapes over the hillside. The water around the shore ranges from clear sapphire to translucent turquoise. You take time to relax in the sounds of the lapping waves before participating in a tortilla making class. Your instructor welcomes you like a member of the family. You find bowls with salt, harina flour, and water on the table. You quickly learn how to mix the ingredients to make a dough before rolling out small balls which you will flatten before cooking. The dough sizzles when it hits the griddle turning from raw dough to delicious, fluffy tortillas. Your instructor places springy cheese on the griddle as well, providing a delicious stuffing for your homemade fresh tortillas when done cooking.

dayInfo.title: Manuel Antonio – Wandering Mangroves
dayInfo.description: Lounge on the beach and let the sunshine wash over your skin or take part in a private guided tour through the hills. The days in the diverse landscape and ecosystems of Manuel Antonio National Park overflow with possibility. You return to the water to explore the mangroves at Damas Island that create wide and narrow canals leading into the ocean. Follow your guide alongside the winding and leaning estuary to observe the natural marvels of the island. The water from the ocean is cool as it drips off of your paddle. The trees line the banks and sprout from the water itself. White-headed capuchin monkeys watch you from the trees. Their tails curl around the branches and their watchful eyes follow you upstream. Your guide points to a dangling vine before you realize it is actually a boa constrictor. The snake can reach 13 feet in length and can weigh 100 pounds. Every push of your paddle takes you deeper into the island’s winding canals and into its secluded reaches in search of more unique wildlife sightings you can share with your loved-one as a couple.

dayInfo.title: Manuel Antonio – Simmering Sunshine
dayInfo.description: The sounds of the national park are incandescent. When you wake in the morning the rainforest is already alive with calls from howler monkeys and the waves splash against the coastline. Your final day can be spent relaxing poolside and watching the palm trees create the unique and gorgeous skyline or venturing into the Manuel Antonio National Park in search of the endangered squirrel monkey. In the early afternoon, you board a catamaran for an exploration of the sea and the sunset. The sparkling water opens up along the horizon and you can see the rolling hills of the national park carpeted in dense jade. Cliffs rise against the edge of the placid water texturing your view of the landscape. The water contains an inviting warmth with a slight salty aroma. When the boat stops you can jump into the sea and look at the coral making its home on the ocean floor. Schools of yellow-tailed surgeonfish wade through the bright water. Butterfly fish swim with the elegant coloring of butterfly wings. As the sun begins to set you find the splendor of the horizon burning with rich and enchanting brightness. Suddenly the flaming sunset cools and the stars light up the night.

dayInfo.title: Manuel Antonio – Sweetly Unique
dayInfo.description: Enjoy another moment in the morning sky overlooking the reflective Pacific Ocean. The sweet flavors of fresh fruits satisfy the early hours of the day and the decadent aroma of fresh coffee brings coveted energy. Today your private transfer will escort you from the lavish beachside resort to the airport in San Jose for your flight home. Your time in Costa Rica has been filled with private luxury and secluded grandeur, giving you a unique taste of the country and a remarkable experience with the one you love.

tourName: The Romance of Costa Rica for Couples Itinerary
placesVisited: San Jose, Arenal Volcano, La Paz Waterfall Gardens, Nosara, Guanacaste
generalInfo: Wildly remote, endlessly intimate, and utterly romantic will best describe your Costa Rica vacation together. Whether in the mood for a cherished getaway or planning the idyllic honeymoon, you can blend luxury and captivating wildlife, adventure and comfort stretching from the Central Valley, overtaking the highlands, and lounging on the gorgeous Pacific. Indulge in the seductive scenery, bask in the rejuvenating thermal springs and paddle through exhilarating whitewater rapids. Your personalised itinerary puts you in the mood for love, romance, and limitless exotic landscapes. As the two of you create your perfect getaway, consider browsing some of our other Costa Rica vacations for further inspiration.

dayInfo.title: San Jose – Arrive in Costa Rica and Indulge in Secluded Luxury
dayInfo.description: Beyond the bustling streets and colorful facades of San Jose is majestic and captivating ambiance emanating from the surrounding mountain ridges and unique charms at the heart of the historical city center. Golden idols and lavish jewelry glisten in the soft light of the Gold Museum, which highlights the illustrious crafts created by the indigenous peoples before the arrival of the Spanish. The National Theater represents a neo-classical revival featuring pillars and radiant statues with an interior adorned with vibrant frescoes. Art Deco and Victorian mansions line the streets of the Barrio Amon, where late 19th and early 20th-century coffee tycoons chose to build their elaborate masterpieces. Your private transfer greets you upon arrival at Juan Santamaria International Airport. As you make your way out of San Jose, your driver points a small ridge located at over 5,575 feet above sea level where a veil of blue tint drifts from the coffee plantations at which the plants around the San Jose cease to grow. You reach the comforts of your private suite in a gorgeous eco-luxury resort in the suburb of Heredia. The concierge welcomes you with a refreshing towel soaked in cool water infused with basil, along with a drink made from fresh organic strawberries. Your peaceful room offers a sense of tropical romance in view of the rolling ridges along the edges of the Central Valley where you listen to the song of the clay-colored thrush, Costa Rica’s national bird.

dayInfo.title: Alajuela Province – Explore the Grandeur of La Paz Waterfall Gardens
dayInfo.description: You wake in the comforts of your luxurious lodge to the calls of the crimson-fronted parakeets. They perch on thick branches near Heredia’s central park with their long tails dangling with light green hues. At breakfast, the aroma of fresh Costa Rican coffee drifts through the open-air dining room as you learn that the beans are sourced from the coffee plantation connected to the lodge while the scent of jasmine derives from the blossoming flowers along the plants. You can enjoy an early exploration of the coffee plantation with a guide to learn about the history and process of the beans before your private driver greets you in the lobby and escorts you to La Paz Waterfall Gardens, located in the Central Highlands. Upon arriving at the gates, you find a protected landscape encompassing 70 acres of a private reserve, including 40 acres of cloud and rainforest, along with 30 acres of pastureland. The air has a sweet and herbaceous aroma originating from the blossoming flowers and lush trees lining the more than two miles of hiking trails. While in the Butterfly Observatory, you come in close contact with over 25 different species in various stages of natural development while the light shines into the glass and acrylic space glinting off the small pool filled by a waterfall. Your guide explains that Costa Rica accounts for nearly 90 percent of the butterfly species in Central America, along with 18 percent of the world’s variation. You follow the unique path of a Blue Morpho butterfly as their outer wings are an iridescent blue against an outline of black. They have a much larger wingspan than the abundance of Monarch and Heliconius doris butterflies, reaching over three inches in span. You continue to the waterfall path and step onto the stunning platforms offer clear views of the five separate cascades spilling over the mountain ridges. You easily succumb to the romantic atmosphere created by the sounds of rushing water, the refreshingly cool air, and active wildlife calling in the trees.

dayInfo.title: Arenal – Travel to Arenal for a Chocolate Tour and Soak in Thermal Springs
dayInfo.description: At breakfast, you watch the clouds drift through the forest trees from the comforts of the dining room as the aroma of fresh coffee drifts from your mug, accompanied by the delicious scents of pineapple and mango. The sensual ambiance adds to the luster of the forest’s natural allure with blankets of moss spreading across the underbrush and tree branches to help collect the moisture. After breakfast, your private driver escorts you on a scenic road to Arenal. Before arriving at your luxurious resort in view of the sensational peak of Arenal Volcano, you stop at a private chocolate plantation to learn about the history and cultivation of chocolate. Your guide leads you on the journey of cacao, which began in the Amazon rainforest of Brazil, making its way by migrating birds or through trade into the tropical landscapes of Central America. Walk along the vibrant pods of the cacao tree, growing unexpected orange, purple, and yellow fruit. You touch the rind to find a leathery texture growing to over an inch thick. You crack the pod onto the nearby table to pop the outer layer in half, revealing the inner pulp and protected beans. The aroma of dried, roasted beans fills the air, drifting away from the outdoor wooden stove. You help grind the beans into a paste with the use of a metal grinder, churning the cacao into the familiar look of dark chocolate. Your guide adds sugar, creating an average of 70 percent pure, chocolate. You take a spoonful and sample the velvety texture, giving way to a rich flavor for a seductive experience you are happy to share with a loved one.

dayInfo.title: Arenal – Delight in an Exciting Whitewater Rafting Tour on the Balsa River
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you have a partial view of the majestic peak of Arenal Volcano, which presents a perfect cone reaching a height of nearly 5,480 feet above sea level. The scent of papaya and passion fruit drifts through the dining room at breakfast before your guide leads you away from the resort and into the jungle terrain. The water rushes along the riverbanks and over rumbling rocks as the leaves provide an herbaceous aroma amidst the tropical heat. Howler monkeys moan in the canopy with their guttural call resembles the growl of a big cat, audible up to three miles away. Sharing in the thrill of a whitewater-rafting excursion provides another memory sure to last a lifetime. You board the raft and let the water take you as the refreshing temperature of the Balsa River contrasts the warmth of the rainforest. You break from paddling to notice the serene landscape surrounding the riverbanks with white-headed capuchin monkeys rambling through the trees and toucans perched on the upper branches. You can hear the whitewater echoing through the lush greenery before you see the rapids. The overall course takes you nearly five miles, shifting from the adrenaline rush of paddling along the torrents and resting in tranquil waters. During a rest period, your guide points to a sloth sleeping in the trees. It uses two close branches like a hammock to cradle its backside. You wipe away water from your cheeks and enjoy the view. You make your way to the thermal springs connected to the comforts of your lodge to bask in the soothing, naturally heated waters reaching temperatures of up to 105 degrees Fahrenheit.

dayInfo.title: Arenal – Discover the Splendors of Arenal on the Adventures of your Choice
dayInfo.description: The morning washes over the rainforest canopy returning the emerald hues of the trees and the active yowl of the howler monkeys. Freshly brewed Costa Rican coffee offers a revitalizing aroma in the dining room. The day is yours to indulge in the wonders around Arenal at your preferred pace. Enjoy a relaxed and romantic afternoon in the thermal springs or soar through the trees on a zip line adventure. For an unforgettable, idyllic stroll, you make your way to the Hanging Bridges to traverse the 15 walkways ambling through 600-acres of private nature reserve. The tropical wet forest is located nearly 2,000 feet above sea level and represents highly diverse species of trees found in both high and lowland forest. You can walk hand-in-hand across the suspension bridges, noticing how the walkways bounce with your steps. The marvels of nature reveal themselves in the treetops, embodied in the three-wattled bellbird. The unique bird can grow to 12 inches long with chestnut brown wings and tail while a black ring around the eyes stands out from the white crown. The males give a bell-like call audible to passersby at close range that sounds like a quick succession of a hollow bell ringing. A crested guan feeds on a fruit tree nearby and resembles a turkey in stature with the grace of a hawk, using its large wings to glide through the trees.

dayInfo.title: Nosara – Travel West to the Splendor of your Pacific Coast Luxury Lodge
dayInfo.description: Your private transfer greets you after an early breakfast to begin the scenic drive west to the Pacific. The winding roads take you from the tropical warmth of the rainforest to the hot humidity nearing the Colorado Gulf. Fruit stands shimmer with bunches of bananas, plantains, and watermelons cut in half to reveal vibrant red interiors with deep-black seeds. Rural communities teem with life around pineapple and banana plantations, and you soon reach the soft limestone caverns that populate the Tempisque Basin, where the Nicoya Peninsula touches mainland Costa Rica. Small mountain ranges create Barra Honda Caverns National Park, which contains more than 40 grottoes spanning more than 5,670 acres. The unique contours of the landscape provide another fantastic memory in which you can share, feeling like an explorer diving into the unexplored interior of the earth. Barra Honda was a volcano in which archeologists have found artifacts and skeletons of pre-Columbian tribes. You touch your fingers to the cool, smooth stone of the soft cave interior. In some places, the caves reach nearly 800 feet deep, and your guide pours light into the cave to show the stunning array of stalagmites rising out of the grounds like columns. The sound of dripping water bounces off the walls amidst the twisted formations. You emerge from the centers of the earth to find coati and anteaters populating the landscape. You continue to the shores of the Pacific to find a featured Zicasso eco-luxury resort featured, the Lagarta Lodge. Your beautiful suite has a view of the waves crashing along the coastline along with the jade canopy of the mangrove trees. From the infinity pools to the restaurant, Lagarta Lodge was designed with panoramic views and ultimate luxury in mind, while remaining connected to Costa Rica’s vibrant wildlife through the 90-acre private biological reserve connected to the property.

dayInfo.title: Nosara – Relax in Comfort with a Couple’s Spa Day and Beach Visit
dayInfo.description: In the morning, a flock of parakeets perches on the tree outside your private balcony. The staff places freshly brewed coffee, tea, and croissants on your doorstep as you wake up. The sunlight washes over the indigo hues of the Pacific Ocean as fishers cast their lines beyond the waves and snow egrets waddle along the sandy banks at the mouth of the estuary in search of insects, small fish, and sand crabs. The day is yours to bask in the comforts and majesty of Lagarta at your leisure. The infinity pool offers a refreshing temperature overlooking the mangrove forest and coastline. At breakfast, the scent of coconut syrup overtakes the savory aroma of traditional gallo pinto , rice and beans. A private shuttle takes guests to and from Playa Guiones and Pelada, or for a remarkable, refreshing day at Lagarta, you can visit the spa for a couple’s massage. The view permeates every aspect of the hotel, offering a spectacular panorama from every angle, including within the comforts of the tranquil spa. The masseuses welcome you with an easy, soft-spoken demeanor. The large room contains the aroma of jasmine and citrus. The natural light lulls you into a sense of comfort and tranquility in the romantic ambiance. Any lingering stress fades from your shoulders. Your muscles relax in the calming spirit as your masseuse puts light pressure on your neck, gliding down your upper back to loosen the connective tissue. You ease into the pampering, and at the end of the massage, you indulge in the natural sweetness of a pineapple and kale drink while relaxing in the spa’s private bubbling Jacuzzi.

dayInfo.title: Nosara – Explore the Wonders of Guanacaste with a Choice of Excursions
dayInfo.description: Surfers take to the waves along Guiones Beach to enjoy the celebrated break. The breeze rustles the palm fronds edging the powdery white sand while at breakfast, you enjoy the mixture of sweet pineapple and the gentle sea breeze. The day is filled with possibility due to the various excursions from which you can choose. Enjoy a couple’s surf lesson in the morning or take to the sands of Nosara Beach in the afternoon to experience the sunset on horseback. The beauty of nature calls to you at Ostional Beach, the world’s second-largest nesting grounds for Olive Ridley turtles. The shoreline of the Ostional Wildlife Reserve extends nearly seven miles long, encompassing Ostional, Nosara, and Guiones beaches, along with the estuaries and mangroves inland from the shoreline. From August to November, the shores abound with endangered giant leatherback turtles and green sea turtles returning to the sands to nest. Shards of broken shells scatter across the top-layer of beach near the rambling tide. At the start of the quarter moon, hundreds of turtles emerge from the water in a steady stream returning to the place they once hatched. They stay for three days before venturing back to the sea, leaving mounds of eggs inside their nests. The event, known as Arribadas , occurs monthly during nesting season. You keep the flash on your camera off and wear dark clothing as not confuse the baby turtles searching for the waterline by the moon’s reflection. You hold hands, watch the turtles emerge from their shells, and embrace the unique experience of a Costa Rica romance.

dayInfo.title: Nosara – Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the sunlight returns to the beaches around Guanacaste. The sodas , small restaurants , open along the shoreline offering great coffee, exceptional views, and magnificent ceviche utilizing sour lemon as citrus to cook succulent conch. You stand on your private balcony to linger in the spectacular private view while parakeets chirp along the trees before flying into the mangrove forest. Great kiskadee flutter their wings and perch on the small branches dangling in front of your room with bright yellow breasts shining against their red-brown wings. Their call resembles their name, twittering with a high-pitched kis-ka-dee before darting out to feed. After breakfast, your private driver greets you in the hotel lobby and escorts you to Nosara Airport. Your brief, scenic flight touches down at Juan Santamaria International Airport, where you have plenty of time to check-in for your flight home.

tourName: The Soul of Costa Rica: An 18-day Luxury Tour of Natural Beauty
placesVisited: San Jose, Osa Peninsula, Golfo Dulce, Tortuguero, Arenal, Monteverde, Manuel Antonio
generalInfo: Learn about indescribable natural beauty on your 18-day Costa Rica luxury tour curated for your ultimate comfort and discovery. Soar over emerald rainforests in private charter flights and glide by private boat to secluded, world-class eco-lodges. With expert naturalist guides, you will explore diverse ecosystems, from the pristine marine wilderness of the Osa Peninsula to the mist-shrouded canopy of the Monteverde cloud forest, surpassed only by the the volcanic grandeur of Arenal. This itinerary blends thrilling wildlife encounters with moments of deep relaxation and authentic cultural connection, where every detail is seamlessly arranged.

dayInfo.title: San José - Arrive in Costa Rica’s Cultural Heart
dayInfo.description: Welcome to Costa Rica. Your journey into paradise begins as you touch down at San José’s international airport. A dedicated Zicasso representative will greet you for a seamless, private transfer. Feel the city's energy as you are chauffeured to your elegant hotel, a tranquil oasis in the nation's capital. After settling into your suite, your private guide will lead you on an introductory tour of San José’s historic neighborhoods. Stroll through bustling plazas where the aroma of roasting coffee hangs in the air and admire the neoclassical grandeur of the National Theatre, its gilded interiors whispering tales of a proud cultural heritage. This gentle immersion is the perfect prelude to the wild beauty that awaits, allowing you to acclimate in sophisticated comfort.

dayInfo.title: Golfo Dulce - Soar Above the Canopy to a Secluded Rainforest Lodge
dayInfo.description: After a gourmet breakfast, your adventure truly begins. A short, private transfer brings you to a local airfield where your private charter plane awaits. Ascend into the sky for a breathtaking 50-minute scenic flight, soaring over a vast, unbroken carpet of emerald-green rainforest that stretches to the horizon. Witness the landscape transform below as you approach the shimmering Golfo Dulce. Upon landing at a remote airstrip, you will be escorted to a private boat. Glide across the turquoise, fjord-like waters to a secluded lodge, a luxurious sanctuary where the jungle meets the sea. Settle into your private casita, the sounds of toucans and the gentle lapping of waves serving as your welcome chorus. Relish the remainder of your day with leisure time to explore your accommodations or simply lounge by the pool with a tropical cocktail.

dayInfo.title: Golfo Dulce - Encounter Marine Royalty and Kayak Serene Mangroves
dayInfo.description: Awaken to the glorious sounds of the rainforest. Today is dedicated to the marine wonders of the Golfo Dulce, one of only four tropical fjords in the world. Your private guide will lead you by boat into the heart of these protected waters in search of its most majestic residents. Feel the thrill as a pod of dolphins playfully dances in the boat's wake or, in season, the awe-inspiring sight of a humpback whale and her calf breaching the calm surface. In the afternoon, experience the jungle from a different perspective on a Río Esquinas mangrove kayaking expedition. Paddle silently through serene, narrow channels beneath a dense canopy, your guide pointing out elusive river turtles and exotic water birds hidden among the intricate root systems.

dayInfo.title: Golfo Dulce - Hike a Primal Forest and Witness a Starry Sea
dayInfo.description: Venture deep into the pristine wilderness of Piedras Blancas National Park with your expert naturalist guide. This challenging hike takes you beneath the canopy of giant, ancient trees, some of which are centuries old. Feel the cool, humid air as you listen for the rustle of monkeys in the branches above and learn about the complex, interconnected ecosystem of this incredibly biodiverse lowland rainforest. As dusk settles, board a small boat and drift into the bay to witness the natural phenomenon of bioluminescence. As you trail your hands through the water, watch it ignite with thousands of sparkling, phosphorescent organisms, mirroring the starry sky above in a silent, glittering spectacle.

dayInfo.title: Osa Peninsula - Journey to a Wildlife Haven and Discover Hidden Waterfalls
dayInfo.description: This morning, a scenic boat transfer takes you across the gulf to Puerto Jimenez, the gateway to the magnificent Osa Peninsula. From there, a private land transfer will wind through lush landscapes to a world-renowned eco-lodge in a private rainforest reserve. After settling into your suite, with its panoramic ocean views, embark on a private wild waterfall hike. Your guide will lead you through the vibrant green forest, descending along a riverbed where tiny, jewel-toned poison dart frogs hide among the leaves. The reward for your trek is a pristine, secluded waterfall, where you can plunge into the cool, crystalline pool for a refreshing swim, completely enveloped by the sounds of the jungle.

dayInfo.title: Osa Peninsula - Greet the Dawn with a Bird Chorus and Walk a Nocturnal World
dayInfo.description: Rise before the sun for an early birdwatching tour, sharing the cool, misty morning air with the Osa Peninsula’s most colorful residents. With high-quality binoculars and your guide's expert eye, you will spot a dazzling array of species, from vibrant scarlet macaws to toucans and hummingbirds, as the jungle awakens. After a day of relaxation, your adventure continues after sunset with a guided night walk. With a flashlight in hand, follow your guide into the velvety darkness of the rainforest. This is when the jungle truly comes alive with a new cast of characters. Your senses will sharpen to the sounds of the unseen as you scan the shadows for the glow of bioluminescent fungi, the quick flash of a snake, and the wide, curious eyes of a nocturnal kinkajou. With luck, your guide’s light will reveal the night’s most prized sighting: the iconic red-eyed tree frog, its brilliant ruby eyes shining back at you. This is a stunning reward in the darkness.

dayInfo.title: Osa Peninsula - Learn Ancient Secrets and Leave a Lasting Legacy
dayInfo.description: Today offers a deeper connection to the forest and its future. Join your guide for a fascinating local medicine tour, a walk through gardens and rainforest, where you will learn about the traditional uses of plants, trees, and seeds passed down through generations of indigenous tribes and local settlers. Discover the secrets of the "living pharmacy" that thrives all around you. The afternoon gives you a chance to help this paradise flourish. Join the Lapa Rios reforestation program, where the scent of rich, loamy soil will fill the humid air as you prepare a place for new life. Feel the delicate roots of a native seedling in your hands before settling it into the dark earth. With the jungle as your soundtrack, you will leave a piece of your story here, a lasting connection to the land that you will remember long after you hold the certificate.

dayInfo.title: Tortuguero - Fly to the "Amazon of Costa Rica"
dayInfo.description: Trade the Pacific for the Caribbean as you board another private charter flight for a spectacular 90-minute journey to Tortuguero. From your aerial vantage point, you will witness the country’s dramatic spine of volcanic mountains giving way to a vast network of rivers and canals. Arriving at the destination, you will notice the air is different here. It’s warm, humid, and fragrant with the scent of damp earth and tropical blossoms. A private boat will be waiting to navigate the winding canals of this "Venice of the Jungle” as you take in the sounds of chattering birds and the gentle lapping of water against the hull. You’ll pass dense walls of emerald green toward the seclusion of your lodge. This afternoon, immerse yourself in the unique local culture with a private guided visit to the small, car-free village of Tortuguero. Stroll along its sandy pathways, feel the laid-back Caribbean vibe, and learn about the community’s deep connection to the sea turtles that give the region its name.

dayInfo.title: Tortuguero - Explore the Serpentine Canals of a Jungle Sanctuary
dayInfo.description: Dedicate your day to exploring the extraordinary biodiversity of Tortuguero National Park. In the morning, board a private boat with your guide and venture deep into the smaller, more intimate creeks and canals that weave through the dense jungle. Glide silently through the still, emerald-green water as your guide points out troops of howler and spider monkeys feasting in the canopy, three-toed sloths moving in slow motion, and sunbathing caimans lurking near the water’s edge. The afternoon brings a journey into a different set of waterways. On them, the jungle’s soundtrack changes and your ears will guide you as much as your eyes. You'll learn to listen for the distinct, croaking call that reveals a magnificent toucan hidden in the leaves or the raucous squawks that signal a flock of parrots feasting high in the canopy. With your guide’s help, the dense green walls of the rainforest transform into a gallery of breathtaking, living art, showcasing the incredible diversity of the park's over 300 bird species.

dayInfo.title: Arenal - Travel to the Land of Volcanoes and Thermal Springs
dayInfo.description: Your journey continues as you travel from the Caribbean lowlands to the volcanic highlands of Arenal. A private boat transfer takes you through the winding jungle rivers to La Pavona Dock, where your personal driver will be waiting. Settle in for a comfortable private land transfer, watching the landscape transform from flat wetlands to rolling hills with the iconic cone of the Arenal Volcano looming in the distance. Arrive at a tented luxury camp, your opulent home for the next three nights. The afternoon is yours to simply relax and rejuvenate. Immerse yourself in the warm, mineral-rich waters of your private hot springs pool, fed directly from the volcano, and feel the stresses of the world melt away.

dayInfo.title: Arenal - Walk Among the Treetops and Cook with Volcanic Soul
dayInfo.description: Experience the rainforest from a breathtaking new perspective on a guided tour of the Arenal Hanging Bridges. Your naturalist guide will lead you across a series of suspension bridges high in the canopy, offering a bird’s-eye view of the lively ecosystem. In the late afternoon, connect with the culinary heart of Costa Rica during an organic farm adventure and cooking lesson. Tour the fields where traditional crops grow in rich volcanic soil, then join a local family in their home. In a warm, inviting atmosphere, you will learn to prepare a traditional Costa Rican dinner on a woodstove, a hands-on experience that fills the air with the delicious aromas of fresh herbs and spices, culminating in a shared, authentic meal.

dayInfo.title: Arenal - Search for Sloths and Explore a Crystalline Underworld
dayInfo.description: Today is a day of delightful discoveries, both high in the trees and deep within the earth. Your private guide will take you on a dedicated sloth-watching walk on a private eco-project. Stroll along a gentle trail, learning to spot two-toed and three-toed sloths as they rest and feed in their favorite trees. In the afternoon, prepare for an adventure of a different kind as you explore the magnificent Venado Caves. Equipped with a helmet and headlamp, your guide will lead you into a fascinating subterranean world of ancient stalactites and stalagmites, following the path of an underground river through chambers filled with crystalline rock formations and the quiet echoes of a world indifferent to light.

dayInfo.title: Monteverde - Cross the Continental Divide to a Mystical Cloud Forest
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, your journey takes you to the ethereal highlands of Monteverde. A private vehicle will bring you to the shores of Lake Arenal, where you will board a private boat for a stunning crossing of Costa Rica’s largest lake, with magnificent views of the Arenal Volcano on a clear day. You'll feel the warmth of the tropical sun on your skin as you watch its majestic cone mirrored on the sparkling, deep-blue water. As you make your ascent, the air grows cool and damp, carrying the fresh scent of rich earth as the vegetation transforms into a tangled, emerald world of dripping mosses and giant ferns. Back at your hotel, your room opens up to the sounds and sights of the forest, offering a chance to unwind on a private terrace overlooking the misty canopy or explore the hotel's nature paths. In the evening, you will embark on a thrilling guided walk, discovering the unique nocturnal creatures of this high-altitude ecosystem.

dayInfo.title: Monteverde - Hike a Legendary Forest and Taste a Treasured Bean
dayInfo.description: Spend your morning on a private guided hike in the world-renowned Monteverde Cloud Forest Preserve, a sanctuary of biodiversity. Your guide will help you navigate the misty, moss-draped trails, searching for the forest’s most prized resident, the resplendent quetzal. It’s a bird of almost mythical beauty, with iridescent emerald plumage and a long, flowing tail. In the afternoon, immerse yourself in the flavors of the region with a coffee, chocolate, and sugar cane adventure. This hands-on tour takes you through the entire process, from seeing the ripe coffee cherries on the plant to learning about the fermentation of cacao. Smell the rich aroma of roasting beans and taste the sweet juice of freshly milled sugar cane for an authentic taste of Monteverde’s agricultural heritage.

dayInfo.title: Manuel Antonio - Descend to the Pacific Coast with a Crocodile Safari
dayInfo.description: Today you will journey from the cool mountain air of the cloud forest to the warm, sun-kissed Pacific coast of Manuel Antonio. During your private land transfer, you will stop for an exciting adventure. Board a private safari boat for a tour of the Tárcoles River, famous for its massive American crocodiles. Your expert captain will skillfully guide the boat close to the muddy banks, pointing out what at first look like fallen logs, until a slow blink or a massive, toothy yawn reveals a colossal crocodile basking just feet away. You'll be close enough to appreciate the texture of their ancient, armored skin and feel the thrill of their powerful presence. The river is also a haven for birdlife, offering chances to spot scarlet macaws, herons, and kingfishers. After lunch, you will continue to your luxurious hotel in Manuel Antonio, arriving in time to witness a spectacular sunset over the Pacific Ocean. This is the perfect moment to find a comfortable seat on your private terrace, perhaps with a cool drink in hand, and simply let the soothing sound of the waves wash over you as the sky ignites in a fiery spectacle.

dayInfo.title: Manuel Antonio - Explore a Coastal Gem and Ride the Pacific Waves
dayInfo.description: This morning, you'll wander through the living Eden that is Manuel Antonio National Park. Follow your private guide down a lush rainforest trail, where dappled sunlight filters through the canopy and the air is thick with the scent of life. Their trained eyes will help you spot the hidden wonders: a sloth hanging motionless like a part of the tree, the flash of a colorful iguana in the undergrowth, and the antics of white-faced monkeys chattering overhead. The path ends in a breathtaking reveal, as the forest parts to show one of Costa Rica's most beautiful beaches, its white sands kissed by the brilliant blue Pacific. The afternoon invites a different kind of immersion. Trade the quiet observation of the jungle for the exhilarating energy of the ocean with a private surf lesson. Feel the warm Pacific water and the buoyant strength of the surfboard beneath you. It’s a playful way of learning to read the ocean's cues, paddling to meet a wave, and feeling that incredible surge of power as you rise to your feet, connecting with Costa Rica's legendary beach culture.

dayInfo.title: Manuel Antonio - Kayak a Hidden Coastline and Discover a Jungle After Dark
dayInfo.description: Your final day in paradise is an immersion into three of Manuel Antonio's hidden worlds. First, you will discover the world as seen from the water. You’ll paddle a sea kayak along a coastline of dramatic cliffs and secret coves, a perspective of the park inaccessible from shore. Then, you'll slip into the world beneath the waves. In the tranquil waters of Biesanz Bay, you’ll don a snorkel mask to find the silent, vibrant life of the coral reef, swimming amidst schools of colorful tropical fish. As your day seems to close, one final world awaits. After sunset, venture back into the rainforest, where the narrow beam of your flashlight will reveal the shy, secret life of the jungle after dark, an entirely new cast of creatures that only emerges once the sun has set.

dayInfo.title: San José - Depart from Paradise
dayInfo.description: Savor one last Costa Rican breakfast, with the sounds of the ocean as your soundtrack. At the designated time, your private driver will escort you on a comfortable transfer to the San José international airport. Reflect on the incredible biodiversity and unforgettable moments of your journey as you prepare for your flight home, your heart filled with the pure, rejuvenating spirit of Costa Rica.

tourName: Two-Week Costa Rica Vacation for Families
placesVisited: San Jose, La Fortuna, Tamarindo, Manuel Antonio, Monteverde Cloud Forest
generalInfo: From beautiful beaches to wondrous cloud forests, Costa Rica provides the perfect spaces to relax and play. Monkeys howl, volcanos impress, and you can lead your family on an adventure through the trees. By balancing laid-back relaxation with thrilling activities, this adventurous two-week Costa Rica tour is expertly handcrafted for families with children of all ages. This is a safe and serene place to travel together, and you will discover the best of it, including Arenal, Monteverde, Tamarindo, and Manuel Antonio National Park.

dayInfo.title: San Jose – Easing Into Costa Rica
dayInfo.description: To begin your adventure, you will touch down in San Jose, and the Costa Rican capital may feel a little different to your preconceptions. This is not a place of bustle, but it is a low-slung capital that is easy to explore on foot in addition to being very safe for families. The historic center and oldest neighborhoods of San Jose can prove extremely relaxing places to ease into Costa Rica and to make first impressions of the country. After landing at the country’s major international airport, you will be met by a local guide and transferred to a luxurious boutique hotel in the city’s center.
